job_description:
Candidate will participate on project teams for site civil and stormwater projects. Candidate should have between 1 – 4 years with EI certification. Responsibilities include permitting, best management practice sizing calculations, drainage design, developing construction drawings and specifications, erosion and sediment control, and report writing.

Technical experience with AutoCAD Civil 3D is preferred. Candidates must be self-motivated, highly organized and possess excellent writing and communication skills. Occasional local and regional travel may be required.

Qualifications/Skills required:

 * Experience with Autocad Civil 3D software is preferred.
 * Experience with Microsoft Office products is required.
 * 1-4 years of experience. This is an entry level position.
 * EI/EIT Certification required

Educational Requirements:

 * Bachelor of Science in civil, biological & agricultural, environmental or biosystems engineering

company_name: Public Utility District No. 1 of Chelan County, Washington
job_description:
This position will be filled at either the Civil Engineer I, II, III, Senior I or Senior II level, contingent upon the skills and experience of the selected candidate.

JOB PURPOSE:
The Civil Engineer working in Engineering & Project Management performs intermediate to advanced (at higher levels) calculations, analysis, design, and construction support in the competency areas of geotechnical, hydraulic, structural, water resource and dam safety and assists with project management activities related to operation, maintenance and rehabilitation of hydroelectric generation facilities, switchyards, substations, parks, hatcheries, water and waste water systems and treatment plants. The position requires independent judgement/knowledge of the principles, practices, and procedures, including materials, equipment, and techniques, used in professional level work in the field of civil engineering and project management. At level III, the position will act as the design engineer and/or project manager for moderately complex projects. Additional responsibilities will include directing consultants, crew superintendents, foreman and contractors to troubleshoot and resolve problems.

Responsibilities:

 * Design Engineering - Perform basic civil engineering design, analysis, and calculations for projects under the guidance, direction, and supervision of higher-level engineers. Tasks will be assigned that apply and develop basic engineering skills. Prepare basic plans, specifications, and cost estimates for procurement; prepare material and/or labor bid document packages. Follow engineering quality procedures. Review submittals and respond to requests for information during construction. Develop inspection and testing plans. Inspect fabrication and construction activities, materials, work products and troubleshoot construction problems. Prepare start-up and training plans for operation and maintenance of projects.
 * Perform technical inspections and field verifications to help learn about the design process and construction practices. Operations and Maintenance Troubleshooting and Technical Assistance Clarify and pinpoint problems. Develop testing methods and alternatives. Participates in investigations, collects data, and performs research. Provide alternative problem solutions. Write brief reports describing possible solutions and recommendations. Receives daily technical guidance from higher level engineers.
 * Planning and Preliminary Engineering - Perform basic engineering planning, feasibility studies (including technical report writing), cost estimating, economic analyses and develop alternatives to help determine solutions to operational problems, regulatory concerns, efficiency improvements, asset management issues, etc.

 * Planning, Preliminary Engineering, Budget Development: Perform engineering planning, feasibility studies (including technical report writing), cost estimating, economic analyses and develop alternatives to help determine solutions to operational problems, regulatory concerns, efficiency improvements, asset management issues, etc.
 * Operations and Maintenance Troubleshooting and Technical Assistance: Troubleshoot operations and maintenance problems at the request of plant personnel. Clarify and pinpoint problems. Develop testing methods and alternatives. Provide alternative problem solutions. Write brief reports describing possible solutions and recommendations.
 * Project Management: Assist in the development and implementation of scopes, schedules, budgets, and procurement documents for project. May act as a project manager for projects of limited complexity. Communicate progress on project related activities to project manager, internal clients, District supervision and management. Write status and tracking reports. Participate in progress meetings. Procure materials. Participate in the selection and management of consultants and contractors. Participate in the preparation of technical specifications and other bid documents required for project construction. Ensure compliance with quality procedures.

 * Perform civil engineering design, analysis, and calculations of medium complexity, as assigned. Develop design criteria, provide the design steps and correct sequencing of the technical activities to other project team members.
 * Manage conventional projects or portions of larger complex projects from concept to close out. Develop and implement scopes, schedules and budgets. Set up and lead project teams including design engineers, consultants, contractors, construction inspectors, real property agents, skilled crafts workers, permitting specialists, purchasing agents, etc.
 * Troubleshoot operations and maintenance problems at the request of District personnel. Clarify and pinpoint problems. Develop testing methods and alternatives. Provide alternative problem solutions. Write brief reports describing possible solutions and recommendations.
 * Perform engineering planning, feasibility studies (including technical report writing, and more.
 * Participate in work process improvement efforts primarily as a member of interdisciplinary work teams. Contribute to the development of District technical standards.

 * Perform engineering design, analysis and calculations of advanced complexity as assigned determining the methodology and depth needed. Lead other team members in proper execution of technical activities.
 * Perform engineering planning, feasibility studies (including technical report writing), cost estimating, economic analyses and develop alternatives to help determine solutions to operational problems, regulatory concerns, efficiency improvements, asset management issues, etc.
 * Manage moderately complex projects from concept to close out. Develop and implement scopes, schedules, and budgets. Set up and lead project teams including design engineers, consultants, contractors, construction inspectors, skilled crafts workers, permitting specialists, purchasing agents, etc.
 * Troubleshoot operations and maintenance problems at the request of Operations & Maintenance personnel. Clarify and pinpoint problems. Develop testing methods and alternatives. Provide alternative problem solutions. Write brief reports describing possible solutions and recommendations.
 * Perform testing, start-up, and commissioning. Prepare test and commissioning plans, direct craft labor and contractors to perform the tests, interpret test result and prepare summary reports, prepare operations and maintenance instructions.
 * Participate in work process improvement efforts primarily as a member of interdisciplinary work teams. Contribute to the development of company technical standards.

 * Perform complex engineering design, analysis and calculations of advanced complexity frequently determining the need and scope of the analysis and calculation. Investigate alternatives for design steps and sequencing for obscure or indeterminate problems. Provide structure and work sequence to lower-level engineers to guide technical activities. Receives only general objective guidance from higher level engineers and management.
 * Manage complex projects from concept to close out. Develop and implement scopes, schedules and budgets. Set up and lead project teams including design engineers, consultants, contractors, construction inspectors, skilled crafts workers, permitting specialists, purchasing agents, etc. Negotiate conditions and agreements with stakeholders, landowners and regulatory agencies. Ensure compliance with QA/QC procedures to maintain the quality of project deliverables.
 * Perform engineering planning, feasibility studies (including technical report writing), cost estimating, economic analyses and develop alternatives to help determine solutions to operational problems, regulatory concerns, efficiency improvements, asset management issues, etc.
 * Troubleshoot operations and maintenance problems at the request of Operations & Maintenance personnel. Clarify and pinpoint problems. Develop testing methods and alternatives. Provide alternative problem solutions. Write brief reports describing possible solutions and recommendations.
 * Perform testing, start-up and commissioning. Prepare test and commissioning plans, direct craft labor and contractors to perform the tests, interpret test result and prepare summary reports, prepare operations and maintenance instructions.
 * Participate in work process improvement efforts primarily as a member of interdisciplinary work teams. Contribute to the development of company technical standards.

QUALIFICATIONS: The qualifications listed below are representative of those required, but reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Post-Secondary Education:
Bachelor's degree (B. S., B. A.) in Civil Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.

Civil Engineer I, II and III:

 * EIT (Engineer in Training) achieved by passing the FE (Fundamentals of Engineering) exam is preferred.

Senior Engineer I and II:

 * Professional Engineer (PE) License strongly preferred.

Experience:

Candidates with experience in hydropower infrastructure and/or with an electric utility preferred.

2+ years experience performing civil engineering related to hydropower generation, power distribution, and water resources fields of increasing complexity. Experience must include examples of successful application of basic civil engineering in the form of reports, calculations, specifications, and drawings; participation in data collection and field research or inspections. required. and

4+ years performing civil engineering related to power generation, dam safety, power distribution, and water resources of increasing complexity. Experience must include examples of successful application of fundamental civil engineering in the form of reports, specifications, and drawings required. and

6+ years experience performing civil engineering related to hydroelectric generation facilities, switchyards, substations, parks, hatcheries, water and waste water treatment plants of increasing complexity. Experience must include examples of successful application of engineering in the form of reports, specifications, and drawings; knowledge of construction means and methods including cost and schedule estimates; knowledge of construction turnover/testing and commissioning; and proper identification of appropriate codes and standards for a wide variety of situations. required.

8+ years performing civil engineering related to hydroelectric generation facilities, switchyards, substations, parks, hatcheries, water and waste water treatment plants of increasing complexity. Experience must include examples of successful application of complex engineering in the form of reports, calculations, specifications, and drawings; knowledge of construction means and methods including cost and schedule estimates; knowledge of construction turnover/testing and commissioning and proper identification of appropriate codes and standards for a wide variety of situations.

Skills & Abilities

 * Basic knowledge of the application of engineering practices, principles, tools, software, and methods in civil engineering and may require regular referral to training & textbooks
 * Basic knowledge of industry codes & standards in civil engineering
 * Ability to continuously learn and apply engineering principles
 * Ability to interpret basic applicable codes and standards
 * Problem Solving - able to perform analysis and solve problems using flow charts and written examples

 * Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles of production of technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models..
 * Basic knowledge of industry codes and standards within civil engineering.
 * Basic knowledge of construction practices, quality control, and project execution.
 * Basic knowledge of civil engineering design directly relating to earth work, foundations, building structures, water and wastewater conveyance and treatment, power and communication support structures.
 * Working knowledge of the principles, practices and procedures of engineering, project management and construction, including methods, materials, equipment, techniques, technical software, schedules, specifications, and contract documents.

 * Working knowledge of the engineering practices, principles, codes, standards, tools, and software for most types of engineering problems in the discipline typically encountered. Rarely refers to training and textbooks.
 * Basic knowledge of principles, codes and standards of other engineering disciplines.
 * Basic knowledge of project management phases & processes
 * Knowledge of industry codes and standards within civil engineering.
 * Knowledge of construction practices, quality control, and project execution.
 * Knowledge of civil engineering design directly relating to earth work, foundations, building structures, water and wastewater conveyance and treatment, power and communication support structures.

 * In depth knowledge of the application of engineering tools and software. Rarely refers to training and textbooks.
 * Gaining basic knowledge of codes and standards in multiple engineering disciplines.
 * Knowledge of project evaluation, scheduling, budgeting, and contract execution for moderately complex projects.
 * General knowledge of other engineering disciplines used at the District.
 * Ability to collaborate in the development of alternatives in a team environment.

 * In depth knowledge of the application of engineering tools and software. Refers to training material, textbooks, and references only to verify accuracy or determine proper methods for less common problems.
 * Well-developed knowledge of codes and standards in multiple engineering disciplines.
 * Knowledge of project evaluation, scheduling, budgeting, and contract execution for moderately complex projects.
 * Knowledge of how other engineering disciplines relate to assigned discipline.
 * Accurately interpret and apply common codes and standards.
 * Able to analyze and resolve complex engineering problems in area of discipline.

Physical Demands

 * Sitting - Regularly
 * Standing - Occasionally
 * Walking - Occasionally
 * Pushing/Pulling Distance/Surface - Occasionally
 * Perform Work on Ladders - Occasionally
 * Climb Stairs - Occasionally
 * Stooping/Bending - Occasionally
 * Squatting/Kneeling - Occasionally
 * Crawling - Occasionally
 * Talking - Frequently
 * Hearing - Frequently
 * Visual - Near Acuity - Regularly
 * Visual - Far Acuity - Regularly
 * Visual - Depth Perception - Regularly
 * Visual - Color Discrimination - Regularly
 * Feeling - Frequently

Working Conditions

 * Wet and/or Humidity - Occasionally
 * Proximity to Moving Mechanical Parts - Occasionally
 * Exposure to Electricity - Occasionally
 * Noise Intensity Level: - Moderate

Weis Builders is proud to be built on a foundation of open communication, an excitement of our industry, 80+ years of consistent business growth and continuous family-owned leadership.

We offer associates individualized professional and personal development, challenging experiences, meaningful projects, and a supportive team atmosphere. Let our culture of Building Relationships be a top consideration for your work-life balance and well-being. …it is this culture statement that is core to our success with associates, clients, vendors, and the communities in which we work.

The PE plays a vital role in the success of each project as the central hub for project information between the Project Superintendent and Project Manager, our client and the architect.

What you ll do

 * Develop lasting relationships with clients, architects, vendors to understand future planning as well as support Weis Builders continuous growth.
 * Preconstruction/Project start up: Assist in material take offs, obtaining subcontractor and supplier quotes, schedule preparation and subcontract award.
 * Construction Management: identify and implement cost and time saving measures, obtain permits, assist in field start up activities, create reports as needed, obtain submittals and manage submittal process, submit weekly OFIs for future projects.
 * Post Construction: Assist Project coordinator to obtain final closeout submission documents, prepare project records for storage, warranty follow ups.
 * General: acquire understanding of building code and design, learn and improve personal/technical and managerial skills, assist as needed to ensure timely and economic project completion.

What you ll bring

 * Client focus
 * Ability to prioritize
 * Strong work ethic
 * Professional composure, integrity

Join our team! Our mission is BUILDING COMMUNITIES. IMPROVING LIVES. With a history spanning over 110 years, HR Green has consistently delivered on this mission, establishing ourselves as a trusted partner for our colleagues, clients, and communities alike. Each day, we work to find solutions that inspire our employees and fit our clients' needs to build trust to exceed their expectations. As a leading player in the industry, we’re proud to be ranked No. 168 on Engineering News Record’s Top 500 Design Firms list in 2023. Our unwavering dedication to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment has earned us the distinguished honor of being recognized as a Best Place to Work.
Summary
As a Civil Plan Check professional, you will be responsible for meticulously reviewing plans for commercial, industrial, single-family, and multi-family projects. Your main task will be to ensure compliance with the codes and ordinances of the assigned county or surrounding counties, as well as City regulations. This involves a thorough examination of plans, including but not limited to Hydrology and Hydraulics, WQMP, LID, Site Grading, & SD (as necessary).
Your role will require excellent communication, technical writing, and presentation skills. You should be proficient in independently evaluating, selecting, and applying engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria to various projects.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

 * Reviews engineering plans, reports, and supporting calculations submitted for residential, commercial, and industrial developments to ensure compliance with city and county design guidelines and regulations (conditions of approval, master plans, low impact development, etc)
 * Checks for accuracy of design in conformance with City Standards and Check Lists.
 * Works independently and as a team member; recognizes and sets priorities and meets deadlines.
 * As needed, performs record keeping and documentation of plan check reviews.
 * As needed, monitors and updates plan check log on a weekly basis in Microsoft Excel.

Education and Experience

 * Requires bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in civil engineering or closely related field.
 * Requires 10+ years’ experience in civil engineering industry, preparing studies such as Hydrology and WQMP.
 * Preferred a minimum of 10 years’ experience as a plan checker reviewing plans and hydrology and WQMP reports and related grading or improvement plans.
 * Candidate must be familiar with computer operation (MS Office).
 * Successful completion of EIT or PE is preferred.

*

Join our Hazen team and make the world a better place providing exceptional client service in all things water® and superior technical solutions for our clients. Hazen is a creative, employee-owned company with minimal bureaucracy where employees thrive.

Hazen has outstanding opportunities for motivated, talented people that enjoy teamwork and collaboration, client service, and solving our clients’ most difficult challenges. You will be supported by multiple mentors on projects and local office leadership.

Hazen and Sawyer is seeking a candidate in one of our Denver, Colorado offices to provide site civil and/or conveyance design for water and wastewater conveyance projects. Qualified candidates should have an interest in hydraulics and hydrology, alignment analysis, pipeline design, pump station design, diversion and intake design, site civil, and condition assessment and rehabilitation. Candidate must also have good communication skills. Candidate will serve as a civil and conveyance designer on projects for water and wastewater conveyance projects. Responsibilities include executing redline markups, laying out pipeline horizontal alignment, laying out pipeline vertical profile, evaluating alternative alignments, pipeline material evaluation, design calculations, site layout and grading, and interaction with engineers from other disciplines.

Additional Qualifications/Skills:

 * Experience with AutoCAD is desirable.
 * Experience with Microsoft Office products is required.
 * Experience with hydraulic modeling software is desirable.
 * 0-4 years of experience required.

Passing or having the ability pass the Fundamentals of Engineering exam is desirable.

Educational Requirements:

 * Bachelor of Science in Engineering

Benefits: 401k employer contribution, performance bonus, comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance, employee assistance and wellness programs.

Main Responsibilities:

 * Knowledge of ADA requirements with ability to design facilities to comply with ADA.
 * Potable water system analysis, system design, specification writing, construction administration, sanitary sewer system analysis (pressure and gravity), on-site and community system design.
 * Site layout, grading, parking, utilities, roadway, and storm water management design.
 * Permit preparation and municipal coordination.
 * Support Municipal, Industrial, Commercial, Healthcare, Retail and Education developments.
 * Field work including site inspection and construction coordination.
 * Able to interact with clients, owners, developers, systems managers, government officials, engineering team personnel, etc.

Qualifications:

 * Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering.
 * Knowledgeable of the various professional surveying requirements (preferred)
 * Knowledgeable of the various methods of stormwater control (retention, detention, bioswales, rain gardens, erosion control, etc.) and conveyance, FEMA, OWR, etc.
 * Proficient with Auto CAD, Civil 3D, Microstation, Inroads, Arc GIS, Microsoft Office, KY Pipes, various hydraulic modeling software and other computer software (preferred).
 * Three years of relative Civil Engineering experience with knowledge of multi-disciplinary aspect of Civil Engineering (preferred).

Are you passionate about environmental sustainability and eager to make a positive impact on water resources? We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Junior Water/Wastewater Engineer to join our dynamic team. This position offers exciting opportunities for both local and international work, as you may be assigned to short projects all over the world, including locations such as Japan, Italy, Spain, Greece, Poland, Bahrain, Romania, and Hawaii. Embrace the chance to contribute to global water infrastructure solutions and gain invaluable experience in diverse cultural and professional settings.

In this role, you will work on a variety of projects related to the planning, design, and construction of water and wastewater systems.

Key Responsibilities:

 * Project Support: Assist in the planning and execution of water and wastewater projects under the guidance of senior engineers.
 * Design and Analysis: Contribute to the development of water and wastewater infrastructure designs, including pipelines, treatment plants, and pumping stations. Perform hydraulic and water quality analyses.
 * Regulatory Compliance: Stay abreast of environmental regulations and ensure project designs adhere to local, state, and federal guidelines.
 * Data Collection and Analysis: Gather and analyze data related to water and wastewater systems. Use data-driven insights to optimize system performance and efficiency.
 * Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including environmental scientists, geotechnical engineers, and project managers, to ensure seamless project integration.
 * Site Visits: Conduct field visits to project sites for data collection, assessment, and to ensure project specifications are met.
 * Documentation: Prepare comprehensive reports, drawings, and specifications for projects. Maintain accurate project records.
 * Continuous Learning: Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in water/wastewater engineering.

Qualifications:

 * Bachelor's degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering or a related field.
 * Strong academic foundation in water resources, hydraulics, and environmental engineering.
 * Proficiency in engineering software such as AutoCAD, GIS, and hydraulic modeling tools.
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 * Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
 * EIT/FE certification is a plus.

Benefits:

 * Competitive salary commensurate with experience and education ($60k-$100k per year)
 * Health and dental insurance
 * Retirement savings plan
 * Professional development opportunities

PROFILE OF COMPANY:

Gray & Osborne has provided professional engineering services to public agencies throughout Washington State since 1935. We specialize in the planning, design, and construction management of water, wastewater, transportation, and utility systems. We have a talented and motivated staff that is well respected in the municipal civil engineering community.

We have openings in both our Wenatchee office located at 11 Spokane Street and in our Yakima office located at 180 Iron Horse Court. Eastern Washington has an ideal climate, warm in the summer with mild winters and almost 200 days of sunshine each year. The area has many opportunities for outdoor recreation including biking, hiking, fishing, hunting climbing, camping, skiing, and golfing.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Primary responsibilities are project engineering and/or project management for water, wastewater, and utility projects for municipalities and special purpose districts in Eastern Washington. Work would include the preparation of engineering reports, preparation of plans, specifications, and estimates, and construction administration for public works projects.

This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys working in a creative and collaborative environment where you are can be part of a design team in providing service to communities throughout Eastern Washington.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ABILITIES:

 * 4-year Civil Engineering degree.
 * P.E. License.

About Us

VCI LLC, a Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business the provides Program, Project, Construction Management and Engineering services throughout the United States and select foreign countries. VCI’s clients include U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Veterans Affairs, National Cemetery Administration, National Park Service, National Institutes of Health, and others. We provide certified construction managers, project management professionals, professional engineers, certified cost engineers that provide our clients with the full spectrum of services.

VCI is currently providing Construction Management services to the Veterans Affairs and US Army Corps of Engineers in Puerto Rico.

Project

The Veterans Affairs Caribbean Health Care System in San Juan Puerto Rico will build a New Parking Structure (Phase 5) be located north of and connected to the earlier Phase 4 Parking Structure located west of the VAMC loading dock and shall accommodate a minimum of 776 vehicles within the structure (Phase 5). The proposed structure shall consist of augured concrete piles, cast-in place post-tensioned concrete beams and slabs, cast-in-place concrete columns and shear walls, and seven (7) PT parking decks.

Purpose

VCI is seeking a qualified On-site full time Civil/Structural Engineer to assist the VA in managing the construction contract.

Duties

The Construction Manager Civil/Structural Senior Engineer shall be required to perform services including, but not limited to, the following (in no order).

Individual professionals shall focus on their areas of assignment or expertise:

 * The work requires regular and recurring field and construction inspection, investigation, and surveys in which there is a considerable amount of walking, stooping, bending, and climbing. Such activity will potentially result in exposure to adverse weather and construction hazards.
 * The candidate shall perform inspections of site work, and building construction work; document discrepancies, code violations, improper materials or techniques in the application of materials, substandard or poor-quality workmanship; monitor schedules on various aspects of ongoing daily construction activities to identify and mitigate project deficiencies, slippage and potential safety concerns.
 * The candidate shall review the contractor's Submittals and RFIs and provide appropriate technical action to the SRE; identify progress delays and recommend appropriate corrective measures to the SRE toward mitigating delays and maintaining the progress schedule.
 * The candidate shall ensure that installed work is consistent with the contract requirements in order to make recommendations to the SRE for final approval of installed work. Evaluate the testing/inspection reports submitted by the Contractor and provide approval/disapproval recommendations to the SRE.
 * Maintains an inventory of materials, supplies, and equipment and monitors the quantity of materials used in the contract administration and conduct of the project.
 * Assist in the documentation, administration, and preparation of construction contract changes (issues proposal requests, preparing cost estimates, reviewing cost proposals, assisting VA in negotiations, preparing change order packages for the Contracting Officer and/or the VA Resident Engineer).
 * Maintaining list(s) of observed defects and omissions. Prepare inspection punch lists and coordinate resolutions and correction of outstanding deficiencies/omissions and errors
 * Available to work different shifts and weekends, as coordinated with the SRE and construction activity.
 * Reviewing contractor requests for payment for accuracy including the initial cost loading and then submitting a written recommendation to the SRE for final approval authority on the payment.
 * Maintaining accurate and complete files relating to the CM services on the project that the Government may inspect at any time.

Education/ Certification/Qualification

 * Candidate must have a degree in Engineering, Architecture, or Construction Management with at least five years of experience in the Construction Industry (preferably in Parking Structure and/or Federal government Major Construction of buildings or cemeteries.
 * Knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulations, commercial practices, and construction standards.
 * Candidate must be fluent in Spanish and English.
 * Current Professional Engineering/Architect license registration and maintenance of same throughout tenure.
 * Unbonded Post-tensioned level 2 PTI certification will be a plus for the Civil/Structural Candidate.
 * Knowledge of local and federal environmental permitting will be required for the Architect CM.

Required Training

Candidate must meet the following training criteria:

(a) Completion of 10-hour OSHA Safety Training Class.

(b) Completion of VA Cyber Security Awareness Training.

(c) Completion of VA Privacy Awareness.

(d) Attend IT Training for Operation of VA Administration Software (KAHUA)

ISI is looking for an experienced construction manager – civil engineer (CM-CE) with a background in structural building construction systems engineering and expertise in the construction industry to provide owner's representative construction management services to a federal client in the healthcare industry. The CM-CE will support a federal client looking to plan, study, design, and manage ongoing construction projects of various sizes and complexity. Duties include providing analytical and planning, design, and construction management support services to assist the client. The position will support more senior government project managers and fellow contractor project managers, who will work as part of a more extensive design/construction program. The ability to lead and work as a team and independently is critical. ISI seeks an individual who communicates clearly, takes initiative, and embraces project ownership. This position will provide mentorship to junior teammates.




Responsibilities:

 * Quickly understand and master the requirements of the local state and federal jurisdictions and the requirements of each in relation to this Project.
 * Possess knowledge of construction contract documents, including front-end and technical specifications and drawings, to readily understand and assess the requirements.
 * Possess knowledge of engineering services, building codes, budgeting, and scheduling to lead to the project’s success.
 * Support the engineering and design efforts related to pre-construction. Support project managers who manage awarded construction projects. Experience in commercial/institutional facilities is required.
 * Support federal government acquisition efforts for both A/E services and Construction projects.
 * Proactively assist the government in conducting site evaluations, field surveys, and site visits to determine constructability and code compliance.
 * Develop draft scopes of work, RFPs, reviews change order proposals, and assists the client in negotiating a fair and reasonable price.

Provides reviews, analysis, professional opinions, ideas, alternative solutions, and recommendations.

Assesses schedule risk and recommends mitigation strategies.

About NorthStar

NorthStar Engineering Group, Inc. is a Civil Engineering, Land Planning, and Land Surveying firm that was founded in 2002 and is based out of Modesto, California. NorthStar has established a stellar list of successful projects and loyal clients throughout California. Our staff is committed to client satisfaction and dedicated to providing our clients with quality and value. We have become leaders in our industry and our community by providing innovative solutions and value for our clients. Our teamwork philosophy and industry experience allows us to provide our clients with a unique combination of professional benefits and exceptional service.

Position Summary

NorthStar has immediate openings for a Civil Engineering Project Manager. General responsibilities, duties and qualifications for these positions are identified below.

Qualifications, Responsibilities, and Duties

· Professionally communicate with clients, agencies, and co-workers (verbal and written).

· Attend meetings with clients, agencies, and project team members.

· Proactively work with clients to ensure their expectations are being met.

· Knowledge of permitting requirements for residential, commercial, and industrial sites.

· Problem solve designs and make sound judgement decisions on projects.

· Research and design of civil engineering scopes of work.

· Grading design, storm drainage design, sanitary sewer design, storm water treatment design, water system design, plan/profiles, report preparation, probable cost engineer’s estimates, project specifications, and calculations.

· QSP inspections; best management practices monitoring.

· Proficient with AutoCAD LDT and Civil-3D.

· Preferable – Proficient with StormCAD and WaterCAD

· Knowledge of codes and good engineering practices.

· Organized and able to multi-task and meet deadlines.

· Ability to effectively manage time and work independently or within a team.

· A strong desire for continuous professional and personal development and improvement.

Education, Licensure, and Certifications

· 3 Years of design experience in land development

· California Licensed Civil Engineer (PE)

· Preferable – Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering

Job Description


AECOM is seeking an Entry Level Civil Engineer to be based in San Antonio, Texas.

This position is expected to begin in June 2024.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

 * Builds analytic and design skills.

 * Creates designs, calculations, sketches, diagrams, schematic drawings, and final working drawings under the supervision of an experienced engineer.
 * Collects and analyzes data under the supervision of an experienced engineer.

Qualifications

JOB SUMMARYCSG Consultants Inc. (CSG), an established and thriving employee-owned civil engineering and municipal services consulting firm, is currently looking for an experienced Associate Engineer to join our Engineering Design team. This is a full-time, hybrid role for our Foster City, CA, Sacramento, CA or Central Valley, CA locations. The Associate Engineer is responsible for performing professional engineering design work related to the planning, design, construction, and maintenance of various public works projects. The Associate Engineer designs public works projects, coordinates with other project staff, activities and tasks, and provides technical support for internal and external stakeholders.
We only consider candidates living locally or within the State of CA. We do not pay any relocation expenses.
RESPONSIBILITIES

 * Prepare plans, specifications and estimates for the construction of public works projects.

 * Coordinate project activities with all stakeholders including but not limited to the project team, field personnel, agency staff, utility companies, other consultants, and contractors.
 * Work closely with the project teams.
 * Perform other related duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

 * 4+ years of progressive engineering experience.
 * Current California EIT License or PE License is desired but not required.
 * Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from an accredited college or university.
 * Proven track record for successfully completing roadway engineering projects – e.g. pavement rehabilitation, complete streets, bicycle/pedestrian facilities, intersection, safe routes to schools, drainage, and utility design.
 * Proficient in AutoCAD and Civil 3D.
 * Possession and maintenance of a valid Class “C” California driver’s license is required.

WORKING CONDITIONS

 * Driving occasionally to job sites.
 * Sitting / standing for extended periods of time.
 * Occasionally requires working in sitting position with computer for extended periods.
 * Working with detailed, finely printed documents.
 * Capacity to work in a fast-paced environment with deadlines and multiple projects.

*
PAY AND BENEFITS*
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and development resources you need to advance your career. When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a 300+ network of experts: community planners, environmental specialists, civil and structural engineers, building and safety experts, fire prevention and construction managers – leading the change to a more sustainable and equitable future.
The compensation for this position is $90,000 to $150,000 annually.
Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location.

*
BENEFITS OFFERED*
CSG’s comprehensive benefits package includes 401(k) plus company match, Employee Stock Ownership Program (Eligibility requirements must be met to qualify), 12 paid holidays, 3 weeks of paid time off (PTO), medical, dental, vision, FSA, EAP, Life/AD&D, LTD, voluntary life insurance, casual work environment and professional development program.
ABOUT US
CSG Consultants is an established and thriving, employee-owned municipal services consulting firm headquartered in Foster City, California with offices throughout California. Since 1991, CSG has exclusively served public agencies, providing a wide range of municipal services—from planning to community preservation. A trusted leader in the industry, CSG focuses on building long-term relationships with our client communities and stands by its commitment to the time-honored values of quality of service, integrity, and responsiveness.
Work Environment: We strive to offer the flexibility you need to do your best work. Whether you are working from a CSG office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment, where your integrity, enterprising spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, using your unique talents, backgrounds, and experience to create positive outcomes for our clients.
Career Growth: We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization, you can make a lasting impact on projects you work on, the teams and committees you join as a part of our business practices.

Company Description

Kjelstrom & Associates was started in 1995 by Kit Kjelstrom. Kit has worked in the construction materials industry for over 38 years: allowing him to understand the operations and needs of the industry. The company was incorporated in 2008 when Shaun Kjelstrom joined the company.

Kjelstrom & Associates, Inc helps construction materials companies from "start to finish" on all aspects necessary to operate. “Start to finish” means that we assist in obtaining use and operational permits (start), we design process flow and engineer the structures, we project manage the construction of these facilities, and we help reclaim/revegetate the disturbed land (finish). Some of the "start to finish" projects we have completed have included sand and gravel mines, ready mix concrete plants, and asphalt concrete plants.

We specialize in industrial design, including site layouts, civil design, structural design, permits (e.g. Use permits, building permits), compliance documents (e.g. SWPPP, SPCC, etc.), and many other processes that require a registered engineer's oversight.

Please see the company website:

Essential Job Functions

A Civil Engineering Assistant is responsible for the following essential functions: prepares plans, specifications and cost estimates for steel structures, concrete structures, architectural elements, and similar projects utilizing commonly used software applications and specialized engineering software applications such as Computer Aided Design and Drafting (CADD); assists in field investigations and studies and in the preparation of preliminary and final plans, specifications, and cost estimates for a variety of construction and maintenance engineering projects; performs calculations requiring knowledge of algebra, trigonometry, calculus, elementary mechanics, strength of materials, statics, geodesy, and structural analysis; compiles data for and assists in making studies or tests relating to the location, size and capacity of other engineering structures or facilities; and assists in the review portions of plans for engineering structures prepared by public agencies or by other private firms to determine if they conform to local building codes, laws, and regulations, and sound engineering principles.

Requirements

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTSA Bachelor's degree or higher* from an accredited college or university in a civil engineering curriculum approved by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET).**

Pass Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) or Engineer in Training (EIT) exam. LICENSEA valid Driver’s License or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions. Considerable walking, hiking, stair climbing and ladder climbing may be involved.SPECIAL REQUIREMENT INFORMATION*A qualifying postgraduate degree is one where either the undergraduate or postgraduate civil engineering curriculum is accredited by ABET.

University diploma or transcripts must indicate the degree major, degree level, and degree confer date. Unofficial transcripts are acceptable; however, an official copy of the diploma or transcripts will be verified at the time of appointment. Applications submitted without the required information will be rejected as incomplete.

Applications from persons with degrees from foreign universities will be accepted ONLY if evaluated and deemed to be equivalent to degrees from United States accredited institutions by an academic credential evaluation agency recognized by The National Association of Credential Evaluation Services or Association of International Credential Evaluation, Inc. (AICE).

DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS

The Civil Engineer is responsible to plan, coordinate, and direct land surveying, civil engineering, and utility locating projects. The Civil Engineer will lead and oversee designated projects, striving to complete projects within agreed budgets and timelines. The Civil Engineer performs and/or coordinates all aspects of civil engineering projects, both in the field and in the office, including preparing technicians for field and office duties, and performing advanced level professional engineering work in design, construction, and maintenance of private and public works projects. The Civil Engineer is responsible to establish and maintain friendly, professional relationships with project managers during course of work on a project and must be able to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Additional responsibilities include mentor, support, and coach growth and improvement in the civil design capabilities of junior staff, and special projects as directed by supervising manager.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Project Management, including oversight, direction and support of field and office work associated with Civil Design and Land Survey projects

a. Research, gather and supply essential documents and materials to direct the completion of field and/or office work

b. Delegate and supervise Civil and Survey techs on assigned tasks

 * Verify the work performed by assigned Technicians for accuracy, proper work methods, techniques and compliance with applicable engineering standards and specifications
 * Guide and direct technician staff to stay on course with project schedules and budgets by monitoring completion of assigned field and office tasks
 * Be available to troubleshoot and/or provide guidance to Civil and Survey Technicians when issues arise with assigned work

c. Drive completion of survey projects within contracted budgets and timeframes; provide regular updates to management and ownership on project budget and/or timeline slippage

d. Effectively manage scope creep through timely communication and negotiation of Extra Work requirement when scope and/or client needs change

e. Maintain project files and include all notes, communications, research and design documents

2. Prepare and oversee detailed civil engineering design in connection with municipal public works and private capital improvement projects

a. Perform advanced professional engineering design that includes civil/site, roadway, drainage, stormwater management, pipelines, municipal and transportation structures, and signalized intersections

b. Generate professional engineering plans, specifications, technical calculations, and engineering reports as dictated by assigned projects

c. Conduct and oversee site observations, existing conditions backchecking, and written field reports

d. Check plans and specifications to ensure a high level of standard for accuracy and completeness

e. Review development plans and capital improvement plans and make recommendations regarding design, constructability, maintenance, and traffic related issues

 * Meet with developers and/or consultants to resolve issues

f. Sign and stamp deliverables

3. Build and enhance Bedrock’s brand reputation and client relations

a. Ensure clients have a clear understanding of their rights, responsibilities, and obligations in relation to survey requirements by providing quality, timely advice and information

b. Promote frequent and open channels of communication by providing project status updates when sensible, keeping the client “looped in” on work progress

c. Manage client expectations to execute project deliverables on time

4. Proactively communicate relative workload to Operations Manager and plan work to attempt to balance existing workload.

a. Hold existing clients in high regard and be ready to assist in finding solutions

5. Professionally interact over the phone, via email, and in-person with all Bedrock clients, documenting all project notes in the Ajera system

6. Continually upgrade your Project Management and professional skillset through company-provided training and other outside learning opportunities

NON-ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Perform special projects upon request.

2. Monitor phone calls and e-mails and respond within 24 hours.

3. Perform other duties as assigned.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

1. Principles and practices of applied civil engineering to estimates, studies, technical reports, design, plans, specifications, and professional recommendations for a variety of engineering activities.

2. Land development, including planning and analysis of engineering systems needed for the use of land including streets, sewage, water facility, storm drain, grading, land use and utilities

3. Thorough understanding of design and drafting methods, including proficiency with AutoCAD Civil 3D

4. Communicate effectively both orally and written

5. Able to take decisive action and document rationale for training/backup purposes

6. Results driven with the ability to function independently and multi-task

7. Able to pivot, focus and manage time well ensuring deadlines are met

8. High attention to detail, resourcefulness, and analytical skills

9. Ability to lead, manage and hold employees accountable

10.Demonstrates a positive, can-do attitude and is solutions oriented.

11.Collaborative and dedicated to serving team members and clients

Supervisory Responsibilities

Engineer will be supervising and directing others

Experience

Minimum of 5 years of professional engineering experience

Education/Certification

Significant training in civil engineering, or a related field. Bachelor of Science degree preferred. PE preferred

WORKING CONDITIONS

Work is primarily performed indoors in an office environment, with occasional work outdoors as site visits or field work is required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Visual: Normal activity required daily for making color distinction, depth of sight, preparing/analyzing figures, computer use, and written records up to 8 hours per day.

Communication: Able to express thoughts and ideas in an accurate and understandable manner through verbal and written format with internal and external contacts up to 8 hours per day.

Hearing: Able to hear well enough to communicate with co-workers and outside contacts up to 8 hours per day.

Movement: Ability to maneuver within an office setting and in a variety of locations up to 8 hours per day.

Use of fingers/Grasping/Holding: Have hand movement and finger dexterity to operate field equipment such as a data collector and office equipment such as a computer, fax, phone, and copier up to 8 hours per day.

Travel: Travel on public transportation, including but not limited to public airlines, may be required up to 10 percent of the time.

At Baird, Hampton & Brown, our mission is building partners through creative, sustainable engineering solutions, and honest, long-term relationships. With over 30 years in the business, we understand that a solid foundation is necessary in every aspect of what we do. We support our team members in pursuing excellence in their fields and balancing their lives. At every stage, we serve our clients with integrity, communication, and involvement. As a team member, you can trust BHB to champion our core values, which leads to healthy, mutually beneficial relationships as well as services of the highest caliber.



We are currently seeking a full-time, exempt Civil Engineer in Training (EIT) in the Fort Worth office. As a Civil EIT, you will work on civil projects for municipal governments and private developments. The ideal candidate will work closely with Designers and Professional Engineers to create civil drawings under the direction of Project Managers as you learn skills to become one yourself.



In this role you can expect to perform the following tasks. This is not an exhaustive list:

 * Analyze and interpret survey reports, maps, drawings, blueprints, aerial photography, and other topographical or geologic data to plan projects.
 * Plan and design transportation or hydraulic systems and structures, following construction and government standards using design software.
 * Analyze and produce designs for stormwater, sewer, pipeline, parking, sidewalks, roadway, etc. using design software.
 * Prepare site grading and utility plans, coordinating with municipal parties. Perform hydraulic calculations and prepare construction documents for permitting.
 * Compute load and grade requirements, water flow rates, or material stress factors to determine design specifications.
 * Communicate project status with the Project Manager, client, and other relevant parties, including preparing reports, data, and project activities.



Required Education & Experience:

 * Degree in Civil Engineering from an ABET-accredited program
 * 2-3 years of experience in designing civil projects; commercial, industrial, retail, education, municipal, roadways, & utilities.
 * Engineer in Training certification
 * Proficiency in AutoCAD Civil 3D and Microsoft Office.
 * Excellent interpersonal & communication skills



Physical Demands

This position is primarily sedentary with long periods of sitting, but occasional walking and lifting up to 25lbs may occur. Occasionally bending, squatting, and reaching overhead may also occur. Additionally, extensive computer usage is required daily.

Position Type and Schedule

This is a full-time, exempt position, with an expectation to work 40 hours per week. Overtime may be requested at times to meet project deadlines. The standard schedule for this position is Monday – Friday 8:00am – 5:00pm and flexible scheduling is offered.

About Anderson Pine

Founded in 2016, Anderson Pine is an engineering services firm that focuses on solar, water, and land developments. More information is available at www.Andersonpine.net. Our projects include ground-mount solar developments, hydrology and hydraulic studies, scour analyses, hydraulic structures design, civil and foundation design.

Our Mission

Our mission is to plan and design, optimized photovoltaic solar power plants, land developments, and water resource projects with thorough due diligence and extremely professional service.

Vision

We envision a world of clean, healthy, and highly functional, natural and built environments.

Values

Integrity, Focus, Collaboration, Curiosity.

The Position

Anderson Pine is seeking a Civil Engineer to support the development and design of photovoltaic solar power plants, stormwater and water resource projects. The position will include the development of site layouts, hydrology and drainage studies, site grading and drainage design, sediment and erosion control plans, and SWPPP development. The Civil Engineer will manage CAD standards and develop drawings for a variety of projects. Drawings will include conceptual, permitting, and issue-for-construction. In addition to possessing the requisite technical skills and experience, a prime candidate will demonstrate a strong work ethic and communications skills, integrity, customer focus, and a strong sense of ownership.

Principle Responsibilities/Key Results Areas

Production

 * 2-D hydrology analyses and reports using FLO-2D, HEC-RAS, or similar.
 * Pre and post-development drainage analysis and design.
 * Develop conceptual, permitting, and issue-for-construction site grading and drainage drawings, and maps using AutoCAD and GIS software.
 * Site plans, sections, and elevation drawings.
 * Civil construction details.
 * Basis of design reports / memoranda.
 * Issue-for-construction specifications and cost estimates.
 * Provide quality control and quality assurance for all drawings, developed and received, to ensure that all requirements and specifications are met prior to issuance to clients and project stakeholders.

IT Software and Equipment

 * Research, purchase, and manage structural analysis software.
 * Manage software vendors and licensing.

Business Development

 * Attend networking and project pre-bid meetings.
 * Identify key engineering services opportunities by reviewing existing project database(s), networking with industry professionals, and monitoring publications.
 * Outreach to target clients via email, telephone conversations, social media, and in-person meetings.
 * Update and expand the target client database based on web research, telephone conversations, and industry knowledge.

Outreach

 * Support Anderson Pine’s commitment to STEM.
 * Coordinate activities, presentations, and engagements with STEM associations.
 * Attend outreach events and co-facilitate engineering projects such as, straw tower, egg drop, etc.

Subconsultants

 * Support engagements and agreements with external consultants such as external CAD support, land surveyors, etc.

B.I.G.

 * Diligence in support of Anderson Pine’s long-term growth objectives.

Requirements

Experience & Skills

 * Minimum 2 to 3 years of experience working as a civil engineer.
 * MS Office suite, Google Earth, Adobe Acrobat, AutoCAD, Civil 3D, Global Mapper, HydroCAD, and FLO-2D or HEC-RAS.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 * Ability to effectively communicate with clients and project stakeholders.
 * Ability to work independently and prioritize deliverables.

Education

 * B.S. Civil Engineering.

Travel

 * Valid driver’s license.
 * Occasional travel to project sites, networking, and STEM outreach events.

 * Valid driver's license with a good driving record

Civil Engineering Position

PACLAND is seeking individuals who want to be part of a company where their voice is heard and hard work is recognized. If you’re in a current position where you aren’t a larger part of a project team or feel your skills are under-utilized, come join us so we can get you on a proper career path. If your company is downsizing because of workloads, make the change now to keep your benefits in-place.

Ideal opportunity for a well-rounded, driven, experienced civil engineering professional seeking increased responsibility, career growth opportunities, and new challenges in a fast-paced, high-energy, team-oriented consulting environment. Our office is located in the Phinney Ridge/Greenwood community of North Seattle, in a family-friendly neighborhood close to Green Lake, Ballard, and the Woodland Park Zoo.

Founded in 1994, PACLAND is recognized as one of the best, growing, full-service onsite and development consulting/engineering firms in the western part of the nation. PACLAND is the right place for bright, creative, innovative, energetic people who seek an opportunity to accelerate their careers at an entrepreneurial firm where the only limitation to an aspiring professional’s career progression is their own ability, desire and vision.

Civil engineering staff are responsible for the work associated with technical calculations, reports, design and coordination of civil engineering site work. Engineers are involved with various elements of site design. Design elements may include erosion control, grading, drainage, sewer, water, stormwater and franchise utilities. Project Managers will manage staff, clients, and projects.

Desired Qualifications for this position include:

 * Communication skills to be an integral part of a team and to meet with agencies and clients
 * BS in Civil Engineering
 * Engineer-In-Training (EIT) certification and 2+ years of experience for Design Engineer position
 * Washington State Professional Engineer (PE) certification and 4+ years of experience for Engineer and Project Manager positions
 * Knowledge of AutoCAD 2016 and earlier (Civil3D preferred)

 * Experience with cost estimating, site planning, permitting in local agencies, storm/sewer/water/grading design

PACLAND’s compensation program recognizes and rewards employees for their hard work, and employee bonuses can be substantial and are awarded regularly for outstanding performance. Benefit Programs include 401(K) with employer match; health, vision, dental, life and long-term disability insurance; and three weeks of paid time-off.

McCall Thomas Engineering Company, Inc. is seeking an experienced full-time Substation Design Civil Engineer. This will be a remote position requiring some travel in order to attend client and internal team meetings. South Carolina candidate preferred.




Job location: Remote




Work schedule options: M-TH 4X10 or M-F 5X8




At McCall-Thomas Engineering we have been providing quality engineering and technical services since 1945. With a storied history of over 78 years and more than 200 clients, McCall-Thomas continues to take great pride in utilizing our experience and efficiency to provide the highest quality engineering and technical services for the ultimate success of our valued clients.




McCall-Thomas Engineering is a multi-faceted employee-owned engineering firm housing multiple divisions including the Communications Engineering Division, the Electrical Engineering Division, the Electric Utility Service Division, the Electric Field Operations & UAS, as well as the McT Learning Center and Print Services.




A McCall-Thomas Substation/Transmission (Civil) Engineer will provide civil-structural engineering and technical expertise to Transmission Line and Transmission Substation engineering and design teams for the purpose of delivering safe, cost-effective, and quality engineering and design services. The Engineer will also provide direction on complex engineering and technical challenges for the projects. This role requires both direct billable client work and project management support for projects. The Engineer is expected to take initiative on discipline-specific work for projects, perform assigned engineering duties and manage project schedules and budgets. The Engineer will also support proposal development and project cost estimating.




The primary responsibilities for this role include:




 * Understanding and creating substation civil-structural drawing packages (foundations, structural steel, bus and cable) utilizing national code, industry standards and best practices
 * Identifying, analyzing, and resolving engineering, technical and design problems
 * Planning, organizing, estimating, scheduling, and monitoring of work activities
 * Assuming project lead responsibilities such as assigning work to other engineers and to technicians
   
 * Producing thorough, timely, and accurate technical reports, correspondence, documentation, calculations, and sketches
 * Signing and sealing drawings and reports
 * Monitoring deliverables and schedules, and presenting solutions to the client
 * Continually improving job-related engineering, technical and professional knowledge, skills, process development, and performance
 * Representing the company positively and professionally, and developing and maintaining professional relationships with clients.
 * Interacting with client’s internal engineering staff and technical personnel on a day-to-day basis

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may be tasked with other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.




What You Will Need:

 * Eligibility to work in the US without sponsorship (required)
 * Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from an ABET-accredited engineering program
 * PE registration in SC required within 120 days
 * 7+ years experience in substation design (for remote work eligibility)
   
 * Experience must include preparation of scopes of work, development of conceptual designs, determination of design basis, the selection of equipment and materials, and the preparation and assembling of calculations and specifications
   
 * Knowledge of engineering standards including NESC, IEC, ASCE, ACI, IEEE and ANSI
   
 * Valid driver’s license




What We Offer:

At McCall-Thomas, we offer employees the chance to work with great people on exciting projects, with opportunity for growth. We also provide a full range of benefits for regular full-time employees, such as:

 * Competitive compensation
 * 100% company-paid medical insurance
 * Company-paid long-term disability insurance
 * Company-paid life insurance
 * 401k plan with employer match up to 5%
 * Paid time off and holiday leave
 * Stock ownership opportunities

JOB SUMMARY
CSG Consultants Inc. (CSG), an established and thriving employee-owned civil engineering and municipal services consulting firm, is currently looking for an experienced Senior Engineer (Roadway Design) to join our Engineering Design team. This is a full-time, hybrid role and can be based out of our Foster City, CA, Sacramento, CA or Central Valley, CA locations.

The Senior Engineer is responsible for the planning, management, supervision, and coordination of professional engineering work related to the planning, design, construction, and maintenance of various public works projects. The Senior Engineer manages multiple public works projects simultaneously, supervises project staff, activities and tasks, coordinates project development and progress with clients, and provides technical support for internal and external stakeholders.

*
RESPONSIBILITIES*

 * Develop and supervise teams of engineers for the preparation of plans, specifications and estimates for the construction of public works projects.
 * Direct engineering staff to perform complex engineering work for public works projects, ensuring technical competence and compliance with governing regulations.
 * Monitor project budget and schedule to ensure timely project delivery.
 * Coordinate project activities with all stakeholders including but not limited to the project team, field personnel, agency staff, utility companies, other consultants, and contractors.
 * Work closely with the clients and project teams.
 * Perform other related duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

 * 6+ years of progressive engineering experience.
 * Current California PE License is required. Specialty certifications are highly desired.
 * Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from an accredited college or university.
 * Experience with and ability to mentor junior design staff.
 * Proven track record for successfully completing roadway engineering projects – e.g., pavement rehabilitation, complete streets, bicycle/pedestrian facilities, intersection, Safe Routes to Schools, drainage, and utility design.
 * Proficient in AutoCAD and Civil 3D.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 * Possession and maintenance of a valid Class “C” California driver’s license is required.

WORKING CONDITIONS

 * Driving occasionally to job sites.
 * Sitting / standing for extended periods of time.
 * Occasionally requires working in sitting position with computer for extended periods.
 * Working with detailed, finely printed documents.
 * Capacity to work in a fast-paced environment with deadlines and multiple projects.

PAY AND BENEFITS
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and development resources you need to advance your career. When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a 300+ network of experts: community planners, environmental specialists, civil and structural engineers, building and safety experts, fire prevention and construction managers – leading the change to a more sustainable and equitable future.
The compensation for this position is $120,000 to $165,000 annually.
Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location.

_
We only consider candidates living locally or within the State of CA. We do not pay any relocation expenses._

*
BENEFITS OFFERED*
CSG’s comprehensive benefits package includes 401(k) plus company match, Employee Stock Ownership Program (Eligibility requirements must be met to qualify), 12 paid holidays, 3 weeks of paid time off (PTO), medical, dental, vision, FSA, EAP, Life/AD&D, LTD, voluntary life insurance, casual work environment and professional development program.
ABOUT US
CSG Consultants is an established and thriving, employee-owned municipal services consulting firm headquartered in Foster City, California with offices throughout California. Since 1991, CSG has exclusively served public agencies, providing a wide range of municipal services—from planning to community preservation. A trusted leader in the industry, CSG focuses on building long-term relationships with our client communities and stands by its commitment to the time-honored values of quality of service, integrity, and responsiveness.
Work Environment: We strive to offer the flexibility you need to do your best work. Whether you are working from a CSG office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment, where your integrity, enterprising spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, using your unique talents, backgrounds, and experience to create positive outcomes for our clients.
Career Growth: We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization, you can make a lasting impact on projects you work on, the teams and committees you join as a part of our business practices.

_
CSG Consultants is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions and provides employment opportunities based on merit, qualifications, potential and competency. We want to have the best available people in every job. CSG policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship status, military and veteran status, age, disability, genetic information, or medical condition or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. CSG Consultants, Inc. is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. Any applicant who requires accommodation to apply for or perform the essential functions of a job should contact the Human Resources Department and request such accommodation._

Job Title: Structural Engineer

Company: New Horizons Telecom, Inc.

About Us

Headquartered in Palmer, Alaska, New Horizons is a telecommunications infrastructure company providing turnkey solutions to clients across all major commercial sectors and industries.

Why Join Our Team?

New Horizons offers a dynamic and rewarding work environment with opportunities for career advancement and growth. Apply now to become a part of New Horizons’ dedicated team, driving innovation in the telecommunications industry.

Job Summary

New Horizons is seeking a highly motivated, qualified individual to join our team as a licensed and experienced structural engineer. The structural engineer will provide complete designs, develop construction documents and support structural projects. Projects typically include but are not limited to tower and shelter foundation design, equipment anchoring, platform and shelter design, site plan development, utility coordination, fiber route design and rigging plans. This position also requires day-to-day collaboration with a multi-disciplinary team of varying experience levels and the ability to mentor and train where appropriate.

Key Responsibilities

· Develop complete structural designs and construction documents from project initiation to project completion.

· Conduct site visits and assessments as necessary.

· Develop various written documents as required by customers such as feasibility studies, structural analysis reports with supporting calculations and site visit assessment reports.

· Collaborate on designs and drawings with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, subcontractors, project managers and construction managers.

· Maintain effective working relationships with diverse groups, including company employees at various levels, clients, vendors, government regulators and other outside companies and individuals.

· Make educated decisions on engineering ethics, costs, procedures and standards that adhere to all required regulations and codes.

· Effectively communicate with AutoCAD technicians to produce drawings.

· Mentor junior engineers.

Minimum Requirements

· Licensed by the State of Alaska as a Professional Structural Engineer (SE).

· 2+ years of design experience after SE licensure.

· Familiar with AutoCAD drafting procedures.

· Experienced with standard construction practices and national building code and design standards including but not limited to OSHA, IBC, ASCE 7, NDS, and ACI 318.

 * Experience with TIA 222 is preferred.

· Foundation design experience in permafrost, rock and conventional soils using piles, rock anchors and concrete pads is preferred.

 * Design experience using steel, aluminum, wood and concrete materials.

· Proficient with standard office software (MS Excel, MS Word, Teams and Outlook).

· Experience with Bluebeam, AutoCAD, Mathcad, Enercalc, Hilti or Simpson Anchor Design Software and RISA3D is preferred.

· Highly articulate and able to deliver verbal and written reports.

· Must possess a valid driver’s license.

· Available and able to travel for site visits (up to 15% of the time).

Benefits

· Excellent medical, dental, vision and prescription drug plan.

· Retirement (Pension & 401K).

· Competitive compensation, paid vacation & holidays.

· Challenging and rewarding work environment with career development opportunities.

Salary

· Base salary starting at $135,000.00 per year (pay is dependent on experience)

job_title: Civil Engineer - Mid to Senior Level
job_description:
POSITION: Mid to Senior-Level Civil Engineer

Tigerbrain Engineering is seeking Mid to Senior-Level Civil Engineers. This position will be leading and mentoring junior technical team members in the design of DoD airfields, heavy industrial intermodal facilities and sea ports, both domestic and international. Travel is minimal for this position, usually consisting of site visits for evaluations. Experience in airfields would be extremely helpful. Prefer experience in multiple states or countries. The position is based at Tigerbrain’s corporate office in Oviedo, FL. Assistance with relocation costs, if applicable, will be provided.

COMPANY OVERVIEW: Tigerbrain Engineering is a global airfield and heavy pavement civil engineering design firm. Our team provides powerful and effective pavement solutions in unique and challenging regions to include locations in North America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia, Africa, and the Caribbean. Clients primarily include the US Government, all branches of the Department of Defense, and private sector commercial customers.

COMPANY CULTURE: Tigerbrain Engineering maintains an impeccable reputation for quality and employs those looking to execute challenging projects to the fullest extent. We are the industry leader and the very best at what we do. Tigerbrain provides state-of-the-art tools, automation, and training, which includes hands-on experiences, in the field and in-office, to enable each employee to excel. Employees are encouraged to be proactive and creatively solve problems through an “Adapt, Improvise, and Overcome” philosophy. Tigerbrain delivers excellence through its “Run it Like You Own it” style and drive to ensure each employee maintains a strong work-life/personal-life balance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Prepare scopes of work and manage subconsultants for survey and geotechnical disciplines

· Design geometry, grading, drainage, permitting, site utilities markings, and phasing

· Delineate limits of construction based upon visual and testing data

· Generate construction plans, reports, cost estimates, specifications

· Mentor junior staff in design principles

· Visit sites and meet with clients; participate in design review meetings

· Direct and oversee plans production by design team

· Edit or create technical specifications per Federal Aviation Administration criteria and Unified Facilities Guide Specifications

· Generate design reports documenting complete studies, analysis, recommendations and capturing all relevant supporting documentation

· Occasional travel to domestic and international project sites in support of short term data gathering and review meeting

· Be present during key construction activities, respond to RFIs and resolve construction conflicts

· Answers directly to the VP of Operations

· Other duties as may be assigned

REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS:

· Ability for minimal travel to work at domestic and international project sites

· Must have a BS in Civil Engineering; a Masters or Doctorate considered a plus

· Must have a PE license

· 4 to 10 years of experience for Mid-Level

· 10 years plus experience for Senior-Level

· DoD related experience is preferred but not required

· Knowledge of UFGS or FAA specifications a plus but no required

· AutoCAD experience is preferred but not required

· Must have strong writing and communication skills

· Must have advanced Excel and Word software usage skills
