job_description:
Tectonic is actively seeking full-time Office Engineers to work on upcoming projects in the Hudson Valley and Catskill areas, including Ulster County, Orange County, Rockland County, Dutchess County, Putnam County, Westchester County, Sullivan County, and Delaware County. These positions offer a competitive salary and benefits package, and opportunities to work on challenging and exciting projects.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Essential functions of the Office Engineer position include the review of inspector’s daily reports for accuracy, the preparation and maintenance of monthly estimate and material certification books using CEES or other applicable software, the preparation of change orders as needed, monitoring of the budget and schedule, submittal tracking, maintenance of project files and documentation, and the preparation of meeting minutes and job-related correspondence. The Office Engineer will work under the Resident Engineer’s guidance and ensure successful execution, completion, and close-out of the project, as well as perform all other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

 * Must possess a HS Diploma/Equivalent, and must possess and maintain at least one of the following:
 * Valid NICET Level III or IV Certification;
 * Valid Professional Engineering License;
 * BS Degree in Civil Engineering or an acceptable field;

 * A minimum of 3 years of related experience; NYSDOT experience required;
 * Ability to review Inspector’s Daily Reports for accuracy of various work elements on projects involving highways and bridges;
 * Familiarity with the Manual for Uniform Recordkeeping (MURK) and Site Manager, and Computerized Engineers Estimate System (CEES and APPIA); must also have NYSDOT recordkeeping experience;
 * Excellent organization, interpersonal, and oral and written communication skills;
 * Must be detail oriented and have the ability to multi-task;
 * Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, and ability to learn project specific software as needed;
 * Requires a valid, clean driver’s license and personal vehicle to travel to and within project sites as needed.

PAY RANGE

Our advertised pay ranges are representative of our good faith effort to provide a reasonable anticipated salary range. job_description:
Staffing Alternatives, Inc, is excited to partner with the US Navy NAVFAC Pacific Northwest in supporting the outreach efforts to recruit qualified and motivated Civil Structural Engineers to join the US Navy civilian team.

Positions are located at one of the three Navy installations in the Puget sound region and offer a flex work schedule with potential for telework. As these are Federal positions, they include a solid benefit package including generous time-off, retirement, healthcare (health, vision, dental), and opportunities for training and advancement.

Being a Navy civilian makes you a valuable member of the Navy team. As part of the team, you will support the mission to strengthen the Navy and Marine Corps combat readiness worldwide through facilities lifecycle support focused on the Fleet, Fighter, and Family.

Positions available are both supervisory and non-supervisory with supervisory positions being a quasi-role of design and the oversight of a small team.

The position responsibilities include:

1 Design structural engineering systems (deep and shallow foundations, superstructure ) utilizing steel, concrete, masonry, and wood materials for Supported Command facilities and create complete construction document packages (design drawings and specifications),

2 Design structural engineering from gravity loads and lateral forces such as wind, seismic, and blast,

3 Detailed structural engineering review of proposed design-bid-build construction documents and design-build requests for proposal to accomplish facility construction, repair, maintenance, and renovation project execution,

4 Apply structural engineering knowledge to new and refurbishment projects and/or issues to determine the correct course of action,

5 Prepare design contract scopes, design fee estimates, and fee reconciliations to facilitate contracting consulting services.

6 Prepare design-build Requests for Proposal,

7 Maintain ongoing knowledge of applicable structural codes & regulations (International Building Code, AISC 360, ACI 318, ACI 530, NDS, etc…) and Department of Navy criteria & policies (Unified Facility Criteria and Unified Facility Guide Specifications) to effect good business decisions and compliance,

8 Provide continual management of client, project manager, and design team to maintain schedule adherence,

9 Participate in resolving complex construction and contractual problems,

10 Conduct field investigations with other team members and consultants to verify design, engineering and construction conformance,

11 Perform structural system studies, calculations, and evaluations, and write technical reports documenting findings.

12 Contribute to advance planning activities for facility construction, repair, maintenance, and renovation projects planned for up to 5 years in the future,

13 Prepare for, manage, and lead major project meetings, and

14 Perform computer aided drafting, calculations, and studies in support of design-bid-build construction document preparation.

REQUIREMENTS for eligibility:

 * You must be a US Citizen.
 * You must be able to travel occasionally
 * You must be registered for Selective Service if male.
 * You must obtain and maintain a US Government Secret level security clearance.
 * You must be able to obtain Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA) ETM / Foundational certification within 24 months of employment. Certification requirements are at https://www.dau.edu/functional-areas/engineering/
 * You must have a valid driver’s license in a US state or territory and be able to drive a car.

Requirements:

 * Bachelor's degree in engineering or equivalent license
 * Minimum 3 years of civil engineering experience related to the field.
 * Strong organizational, analytical, communication skills and design skills
 * Experienced user of AutoCAD and Civil3D
 * You must be able to obtain Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA) ETM / Foundational certification within 24 months of employment. Certification requirements are at https://www.dau.edu/functional-areas/engineering/

Preferred:

 * Master’s degree, License, or Certification related to or closely related to field
 * Prior Federal/DOD experience

If interested in discussing further and seeing how your experience and goals align with a position as a UN Navy civilian, please reach out with your resume and we can set something up!

Are you an experienced site civil engineer drawn working on complex projects? Consider an essential role as a Lead Engineer with The Kleingers Group. Our Louisville Development Group is looking for a Lead Engineer who can take professional responsibility for the outcome of design plans, setting the design strategy, leading others in the implementation of the design, and with final stamping and sealing of construction drawings. Our Development Group features engineers who bring years of experience working on the side of the developer/owner equation. The team applies this extensive knowledge and understanding of the latest retail development trends, market conditions, governmental regulations, and land development issues to every project. The Development Group enhances communities with civil & transportation engineering, and landscape architecture for neighborhood and regional shopping centers, hospitals, and individual retail buildings. We bring a creative perspective that develops a project’s identity and creates an appealing shopping environment.
The Lead Civil Engineer will provide technical leadership to project teams who will be working on planning, evaluation, design and implementation of civil engineering projects. The successful candidate will lead the study-phase and/or design-phase of projects related to the civil, environmental, construction and industrial fields. The Lead Civil Engineer would regularly have interaction with employees outside of their department, regularly have interaction with clients, regularly interact with the public (agencies, government entities, etc.), and occasionally participate in selling to clients. The lead civil engineer is expected to manage assigned employees, while being an example of professional presence, representing the Company and the department in a positive light, and have expert level of software knowledge of at least two (2) engineering software packages. A Professional Engineering license is required for this role.

*
Duties & Responsibilities*

 * Consults with and provides guidance to project stakeholders and managerial staff regarding engineering requirements for construction of various designs, and modifications.
 * Uses design software and drawing tools to accurately render and communicate designs; plans and designs other necessary improvement related to type of project assigned.
 * Sets design specifications by computing appropriate engineering requirements (i.e. – water flow rates, traffic demand, earth work balance, etc.).
 * Plans projects based on the analysis of relevant materials such as drawings, blueprints, aerial photography, survey reports, maps, and other geologic and topographical data.
 * Drafts and presents reports on topics related to projects such as detention reports and engineering due diligence reports.
 * Perform calculations for materials, equipment, and labor needed to determine probable construction cost.
 * Collaborates with architects, contractors, and other engineers to ensure projects progress properly.
 * Collaborates with surveyors (or directs and participates in surveying) to establish installations or reference points, grades, elevations, and other factors that will affect construction.
 * Monitors project progress and ensures design specifications and standards are met.
 * Able and willing to review other projects for QA/QC and stamp projects as appropriate.
 * Able to complete complex assigned projects independently as assigned with minimal oversight beyond initial handoff.
 * Able to teach and explain to others the methodologies used by The Company.
 * Advanced level of understanding of design tools and civil engineering practices. Capable other teaching others as necessary.
 * Complex design of projects.
 * Develop, mentor, train, evaluate, coach/discipline, acknowledge, and thank assigned staff.
 * Helping refine the methodologies being used for design.

*
Qualifications, Education, & Experience*

 * Civil Engineering Degree (or related)
 * Minimum 15 consecutive years of Civil Engineering experience
 * Public speaking ability, desired
 * Routinely serves as technical expert for complex projects, for which they have prior experience and execute independently. And reflect The Company in a positive light to public and private entities.
 * Assign Co-Ops, Graduate Civil Engineers, and Associate Civil Engineers projects/pieces of projects aligned with their abilities.
 * Proactively implementing regulatory requirement based on knowledge of state and local regulations

*
Required Skills/Abilities*

 * Basic understanding of civil engineering principles, practices, and tools.
 * Proficient in computer-assisted design (CAD) and other design, data recording, and analyzation software.
 * Basic understanding of materials, methods, and tools involved in the construction or repair of site and transportation infrastructure improvements.
 * Ability to identify and solve complex problems.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 * Ability to be both creative and analytical.
 * Extremely detail-oriented and accurate.

*
Physical Requirements*

 * Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
 * Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
 * Must be able to travel to various project sites.
 * Must be able to access and navigate job sites and construction areas.

Job Description

Established in 1974, Sidock Group is a full-service multi-disciplined firm with offices throughout Michigan. Sidock
Group, Inc. is a service-based organization whose primary mission is to provide innovative, engineered solutions tailored to our clients' individual needs. To further this mission, we promote long-term client relationships, remain closely involved with our clients and their projects, and assemble qualified and dedicated teams for each project in an effort to assure that our clients receive the services they expect and deserve.

Sidock Group offers competitive salaries with an excellent benefits package including health, dental, and life insurance, medical and dependent care flexible spending accounts, and a 401(k) Tax-Deferred savings plan.

Sidock Group, Inc. has employment opportunities for a Senior Civil Project Engineer in our Novi, MI office. Ideal candidates will have an experience level of 10 years plus.

Responsibilities:

 * Technical site engineering for commercial, industrial, governmental, and aviation projects.
 * Prepare drawing packages for all stages of projects from initial concept, studies, site plan, and client approval, through permitting, bidding, & construction.
 * Develop drawing packages utilizing AutoCAD & Civil 3D for geometric layout, grading, drainage, underground utilities, and details.
 * Review local zoning ordinances to develop site layouts and meet special requirements.
 * Design site grading, pavement, landscaping, and site utilities (storm, sanitary, water) in accordance with local, state, & federal standards.
 * Review and incorporate client specific design standards to projects.
 * Coordinate civil site design with other disciplines, both within the firm and partnering consultants, to meet project deliverables.

About Delaware Engineering, D.P.C.

Delaware Engineering, D.P.C. is engaged in civil engineering for municipalities in the Capital District, Mohawk and Hudson River valleys as well as the Southern Tier and North Country of New York State for the past 35 years. Our municipal work involves primarily public water, sewer and drainage systems, as well as public buildings and related facilities. We also support planning and zoning boards including application review and the conduct of environmental review.

Delaware Engineering, D.P.C. provides civil and environmental engineering services primarily to municipal entities in the following areas: potable and process water, wastewater collection and treatment, stormwater management, hydraulic modeling, community planning, economic development analysis, geographic information systems, environmental studies, permitting and SEQRA/NEPA, public infrastructure grant writing, construction engineering and inspection. In addition, we provide infrastructure engineering for industry, including planning, permitting, design, and construction management as well as facility start-up.

Our staff is comprised of approximately 70 professional and technical personnel with offices in Albany (Albany County), Oneonta (Otsego County), Red Hook (Dutchess County), Goshen (Orange County), Port Chester (Westchester), and Monticello (Sullivan County).

We are deeply engaged with our communities, supporting Make-A-Wish in the construction of several tree house wishes, and support of Veterans through the American Legion Riders.

We are growing!!

Would you like to work for a growing company where your efforts are acknowledged, you make a difference, and have upward mobility in the company? Then Stephens may be a great match for you! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. continues our expansion to become a national forensic engineering company! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. (STEPHENS) is a respected company that specializes in forensic engineering. Stephens is a growing company with our corporate office located outside of Houston, Texas. Our experienced engineers provide a wide range of expertise to our clients.

Job Description

We are searching for a full-time Forensic Engineer, PE (Civil/Structural) based in the Charlotte, North Carolina metropolitan area. The candidate may also service STEPHENS's clients in other states, particularly in the surrounding states.

Benefits of a career in Forensic Engineering

 * Not being confined to an office all day.
 * Getting out and seeing new things.
 * Regularly meeting new people.
 * No daily commute.
 * Problem solving and providing expert opinions.
 * More time with family.

Job Responsibilities

 * Prior forensic engineering experience is not required as STEPHENS provides on-the-job training.
 * Perform forensic (investigative) evaluations residential, commercial, and industrial buildings for including (but may not be limited to) storm related damage to roofing and exterior claddings, moisture intrusion, impact damage (tree, vehicle, etc.), foundation settlement, construction defects, etc.
 * Prepare precise and unbiased written reports of findings for your site investigations based on field inspections and research consistent with the company’s standards and guidelines.
 * Prior report writing skills are a plus.
 * Consistently and effectively communicate with clients, the engineering team, and the home office on daily work.
 * Must be customer service and team oriented, with professional and timely communication with company clients for assigned projects.
 * Must be flexible with scheduling, daily work, and quality control.
 * Consistently meet all of the required company expectations and deadlines, particularly during times of heavy workload.
 * Provide depositions and expert testimony, if necessary, on assigned work.
 * Additional duties assignment by management.
 * Must be willing to work additional hours during period of peak business demand as deemed necessary.
 * Must be proactive, a self-starter, and be able to work with minimal supervision.
 * Must be able to accurately type 30 wpm and be knowledgeable with Microsoft Office, particularly MS Word.
 * Proficient writing skills using proper English spelling and grammar.
 * Must be able to park a company vehicle at your residence.
 * Be willing to learn and adapt to inevitable company policy and procedural changes.

Education and Licensing Requirements

 * A minimum of a Bachelor of Science in Civil/Structural Engineering or engineering related discipline (Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial, etc.)
 * Possess and maintain an active professional engineer (PE) license in the state of employment or the ability to become licensed within two months.
 * An NCEES Record is preferred.
 * Have a valid driver’s license without travel time restrictions and the ability to be insured by the company to use the company vehicles.

Travel Requirements

 * This is a home-based position.
 * Residence in the Charlotte, North Carolina metropolitan area is required. Daily reporting to an office will not be required.
 * Willing to work from home or a remote location, particularly when travelling.
 * Travel to and from the site inspections provided by the home office. Some inspections may be located in the surrounding states.
 * Extended travel times may be required for this position depending on the location of the investigation.
 * Be willing to drive long distances, if necessary, which occasionally may require longer than 8-hour days.
 * Overnight travel may be required depending on the location and number of sites to investigate in an area.
 * Up to 50% of the time may be required for regular travel in your assigned region.

Physical Requirements – Must be willing and able perform the physical tasks associated with performing forensic investigations which may include (but not be limited to):

 * Standing, walking, sitting, or driving for extended periods of time.
 * Climbing stairs, ladders, and scaffolding.
 * Walking on flat, uneven, and pitched roof slopes, some which may be over 2-stories.
 * Crawling through confined spaces (attics, crawlspaces, etc.).
 * Working outside in the heat or cold.
 * The ability to lift and move objects weighing 50 to 100 lbs.

Overtime Requirements – The position provides a competitive salary with overtime and a yearly bonus. The employee must comply with working overtime during periods of heavy workload.

Stephens is an EEO Employer.

We are growing!!

Would you like to work for a growing company where your efforts are acknowledged, you make a difference, and have upward mobility in the company? Then Stephens may be a great match for you! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. continues our expansion to become a national forensic engineering company! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. (STEPHENS) is a respected company that specializes in forensic engineering. Stephens is a growing company with our corporate office located outside of Houston, Texas. Our experienced engineers provide a wide range of expertise to our clients.

Job Description

We are searching for a full-time Forensic Engineer, PE (Civil/Structural) based in the Piedmont Triad (Greensboro–Winston-Salem–High Point), North Carolina metropolitan areas. The candidate may also service STEPHENS's clients in other states, particularly in the surrounding states.

Benefits of a career in Forensic Engineering

 * Not being confined to an office all day.
 * Getting out and seeing new things.
 * Regularly meeting new people.
 * No daily commute.
 * Problem solving and providing expert opinions.
 * More time with family.

Job Responsibilities

 * Prior forensic engineering experience is not required as STEPHENS provides on-the-job training.
 * Perform forensic (investigative) evaluations residential, commercial, and industrial buildings for including (but may not be limited to) storm related damage to roofing and exterior claddings, moisture intrusion, impact damage (tree, vehicle, etc.), foundation settlement, construction defects, etc.
 * Prepare precise and unbiased written reports of findings for your site investigations based on field inspections and research consistent with the company’s standards and guidelines.
 * Prior report writing skills are a plus.
 * Consistently and effectively communicate with clients, the engineering team, and the home office on daily work.
 * Must be customer service and team oriented, with professional and timely communication with company clients for assigned projects.
 * Must be flexible with scheduling, daily work, and quality control.
 * Consistently meet all of the required company expectations and deadlines, particularly during times of heavy workload.
 * Provide depositions and expert testimony, if necessary, on assigned work.
 * Additional duties assignment by management.
 * Must be willing to work additional hours during period of peak business demand as deemed necessary.
 * Must be proactive, a self-starter, and be able to work with minimal supervision.
 * Must be able to accurately type 30 wpm and be knowledgeable with Microsoft Office, particularly MS Word.
 * Proficient writing skills using proper English spelling and grammar.
 * Must be able to park a company vehicle at your residence.
 * Be willing to learn and adapt to inevitable company policy and procedural changes.

Education and Licensing Requirements

 * A minimum of a Bachelor of Science in Civil/Structural Engineering or engineering related discipline (Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial, etc.)
 * Possess and maintain an active professional engineer (PE) license in the state of employment or the ability to become licensed within two months.
 * An NCEES Record is preferred.
 * Have a valid driver’s license without travel time restrictions and the ability to be insured by the company to use the company vehicles.

Travel Requirements

 * This is a home-based position.
 * Residence in the Piedmont Triad (Greensboro–Winston-Salem–High Point), North Carolina metropolitan areas is required. Daily reporting to an office will not be required.
 * Willing to work from home or a remote location, particularly when travelling.
 * Travel to and from the site inspections provided by the home office. Some inspections may be located in the surrounding states.
 * Extended travel times may be required for this position depending on the location of the investigation.
 * Be willing to drive long distances, if necessary, which occasionally may require longer than 8-hour days.
 * Overnight travel may be required depending on the location and number of sites to investigate in an area.
 * Up to 50% of the time may be required for regular travel in your assigned region.

Physical Requirements – Must be willing and able perform the physical tasks associated with performing forensic investigations which may include (but not be limited to):

 * Standing, walking, sitting, or driving for extended periods of time.
 * Climbing stairs, ladders, and scaffolding.
 * Walking on flat, uneven, and pitched roof slopes, some which may be over 2-stories.
 * Crawling through confined spaces (attics, crawlspaces, etc.).
 * Working outside in the heat or cold.
 * The ability to lift and move objects weighing 50 to 100 lbs.

Overtime Requirements – The position provides a competitive salary with overtime and a yearly bonus. The employee must comply with working overtime during periods of heavy workload.

Stephens is an EEO Employer.

Banning Engineering is a civil engineering and surveying firm that offers a wide variety of services that includes transportation, municipal services, site engineering, hydraulics and hydrology, land surveying, and asset management. Our Transportation is rapidly becoming a significant portion of our business by offering our clients full-service, comprehensive municipal road design and geospatial applications. Banning is a multiyear award winner of “Best Places to Work” in Indiana. As an Employee-Owned company, we strive to build a culture where employee owners are valued and know they can make a difference.

Summary: The Project Manager provides design and oversight on transportation and geospatial projects. This position reports to the Director level, Specific duties include meeting with clients with the director, preparing proposals, tracking project budgets, lead the design team effort, working closely with project engineers to develop the design, coordinate with other internal departments and sub-consultants, attending public meetings as needed, invoice clients, manage the public bid process, coordinate with contractors and internal inspectors and communicate progress with the director and clients.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.

Project/ Practice Management

 * Creates, executes, and revises project work plans as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.
 * Identifies resources needed and assigns individual responsibilities.
 * Manages day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope.
 * Reviews deliverables prepared by team before passing to client.
 * Effectively applies our methodology and enforces project standards.
 * Ensures QA/QC procedures are followed.
 * Minimizes our exposure and risk on project.
 * Ensures project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately.

Project Accounting

 * Ensures project is set up in Vision with adequate information on contract, client contact, terms, etc.
 * Tracks and reports team hours and expenses on a weekly basis.
 * Manages project budget and reports project results to management as directed.
 * Determines appropriate revenue recognition, ensures timely and accurate invoicing, and monitors receivables for project.
 * Follows up with clients, when necessary, regarding unpaid invoices.
 * Analyzes project profitability, revenue, margins, bill rates and utilization on an ongoing basis but no less than monthly and at project completion.

Financial Management

 * Understands basic revenue models, P/L, and cost-to-completion projections and makes decisions accordingly.
 * Understands our pricing model and billing procedures.
 * Accurately forecasts revenue, profitability, margins, bill rates and utilization.
 * Assures project legal documents are completed and signed.
 * Manages project scope and modifies pricing and agreements, as applicable due to scope changes.

Communication

 * Facilitates team and client meetings effectively.
 * Holds regular status meetings with project team.
 * Keeps project team well informed of changes within the organization and general corporate news.
 * Effectively communicates relevant project information to superiors.
 * Delivers engaging, informative, well-organized presentations.
 * Resolves and/or escalates issues in a timely fashion.
 * Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.

Qualification/Requirements:

 * BS in Civil Engineering or similar field of study preferred.
 * 5+ years’ experience in project management
 * Experience with AutoCAD Civil 3D is preferred.
 * Strong written and oral communications.

Summary

Assists Project Manager and Superintendent in contract administration and coordination of work.

Works with

Superintendent, Field Engineer, Foreman, Field Clerk, and Subcontractors.

Specific Responsibilities

General

 * Ensures all utility locate tickets are submitted and maintained.
 * Prepare work plans prior to the start of major activities of work and distribute to Project Team for review.
 * Achieves deadlines on time or early; if deadline will not be met on time, communicates to supervisor prior to the deadline providing status and requesting a specific time extension.
 * Provide and Update Project Server with Daily Progress Photos or Videos.
 * Assist Superintendents with field activities; ERF's, MRF's, etc.
 * Assist with gathering and organizing all documents necessary for the submission of a change order, RFI or a claim.
 * Communicate with foreman production goals, means and methods.
 * Organizes and maintains project tracking in accordance with corporate policy.

Technical

 * Able to produce sketches to better communicate problems, solutions, or identify items that need clarification.
 * Clear and concise writer (Emails & Letters) using applicable vocabulary, grammar, and punctuation so that all communication is direct and unambiguous.
 * Critical thinker that applies field knowledge or experience to daily challenges to provide solutions to the project team.
 * Analytically strong, making sure that math or science supports every decision they make
 * Ability to use Excel, Google, AutoCAD, and technical literature to break down a problem to root cause and make recommendations for action.

Schedule

 * Supports project manager and superintendent in the preparation of schedules.

Subcontractor

 * Assist project engineer with subcontractor coordination.

Survey

 * Ensure all As-Builts are kept up to date each month, this includes but not limited to (Drainage, Signalization, Lighting, Roadway, Structures, etc)

Material

 * Take-off from contract documents to ensure correct quantities for estimating, material orders, production reporting, and monthly payment requests.
 * Prepare/Submit material request forms (MRF) and allocate costs to applicable budgets; request purchase orders from accounting and create purchase scopes; initial review of invoices in pVault to ensure proper backup with delivery ticket and cost code accuracy.
 * Manages material order and deliveries, tracking and releasing long lead items and assuring compliance with approved submittals to meet or beat the project schedule.
 * Ensures all Material Tickets are submitted timely, and are Cost Coded correctly, so the Clerk can enter into HeavyJob.

Document Control

 * Material is released timely to the vendor/subcontractor per the approved submittal to not impact the project.
 * Maintaining and generating meeting minutes for Owners and Subcontractors meetings; documenting items concisely and accurately, distributing in a timely manner.
 * Organize all files and computer directories in accordance with Company Policy.
 * Assist Project Team with any RFI, Submittal, etc needs.

Cost

 * Reviews and Processes pVault invoicing on a timely basis.
 * Prepares/Reviews Subcontractor Monthly Requisitions for PM review/approval, and Processes them to Accounting Timely.

Safety

 * Safety driven, and utilizes safety know-how to monitor, instruct, and ensure that all work on the project is done with safety planned for and foremost in each team members mind.
 * Develop and distribute Activity Hazard Analysis (AHA) for all major activities of work.

Quality

 * Track all rework in HeavyJob; produce and distribute re-work summary sheets.

Heavy Job

 * Review Daily and Timecards submitted by Foreman for accuracy. Ensure that the Foreman are submitting them by 9am the following day. Ensure all Production Quantities, Notes, Cost Codes, Hours, Equipment, Labor, etc are accurate.
 * Allocates equipment hour usage to the appropriate cost code, highlighting whether it was active or idle, on a weekly basis using GPS reports and equipment department utilization reports.
 * Review all daily diaries to ensure foreman's descriptions are accurate and they are being submitted by 9am the following day.
 * Ensures labor and equipment payroll reports are submitted by 12pm on Mondays.
 * Reviews Daily/Weekly Cost Analysis reports for accuracy.

Extra Curricular Corporate Involvement

 * Participates regularly in continuing education, personal training, professional improvement to continually improve Project Management skills.
 * Participates in corporate, community and/or networking causes and gatherings to promote corporate and personal exposure and community involvement.

Skills/Knowledge

 * Self-motivated, highly organized, on-track to future project management position.
 * Ability to communicate effectively and professionally, both in writing and verbally.
 * Understands the functions of the different components of a computer hardware system.
 * Knowledgeable on MS Windows, Outlook, Word and Excel, Primavera (P6 ) HCSS -Heavy Job and Expedition.

Qualifications and Experience

 * A four (4) year degree (Engineering or Construction Management) or equivalent office/field experience.
 * Two (2)+/- years of experience in similar area of construction.

The above description covers the principal tasks and responsibilities of the job. The description shall not, however, be construed as a complete listing of all miscellaneous, incidental or similar duties which may be required from day to day.

Global Water Resources, Inc. Global Water is an elite team of professionals that continues to transform its fast-growing utilities into highly automated and most efficient water resource management systems. Global Water owns and operates water and wastewater utilities in the state of Arizona serving more than 80,000 people. Global Water is a private utility, traded on the NASDAQ, that is at the forefront of Total Water Management, and is paving the way for the future of efficient utility operations, sustainability, and conservation. Global Water welcomes and encourages experienced professionals from all industries, especially those with strong science, engineering, and technical backgrounds.

The company’s service areas are located primarily in growth corridors around metropolitan Phoenix. Global Water recycles over 1 billion gallons of water annually.

BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE JOB

Licensed Engineer with a strong background in civil design with an emphasis on water and wastewater infrastructure. The ideal candidate should possess strong communication skills, be highly organized, a good problem solver, efficient, have a good attention to detail and be a team player. The role of the position will focus on planning, design and construction management of water and wastewater infrastructure. This position is based out of Maricopa, AZ.

Duties/Responsibilities:

 * Lead multidisciplinary technical consulting engineering teams executing the planning, design and construction management of water and wastewater projects.
 * Manage multiple projects, schedules, and budgets.
 * Deliver complete design and project bid packages.
 * Prepare internal layout and preliminary planning and design of systems.
 * Review and critique reports, plans, and specifications
 * Prepare internal cost estimates for budgeting.
 * Review and critique consultant scopes of work and invoices as well as manage consultant communications.
 * Assesses infrastructure needs based on current demands and projected future growth.
 * Conduct cost-benefit analyses and value engineering for projects.
 * Effectively communicate with construction management department and contractors utilizing different construction delivery methods
 * Effectively communicate with governmental agencies for permitting and approval of various systems
 * Ensure infrastructure complies with applicable local, state, and federal guidelines and codes.
 * Provide operations with support and subject matter expertise on operational issues.
 * Maintains knowledge and subject matter expertise on latest technologies.

Required Skills/Abilities:

 * Experience with wells and water treatment, distribution, and storage systems
 * Experience with wastewater treatment, collection, and pumping systems
 * Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 * Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software, computer-aided Design (CAD) software, and other relevant analytical, scientific, or monitoring software.
 * Strong leadership, people, and communication skills
 * Knowledge of current Arizona water and wastewater regulations and the ability to effectively communicate with multiple agencies.

Education and Experience:

 * Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering required.
 * Licensed as a Professional Engineer in the State of Arizona required.
 * At least 10 years of related water and wastewater experience
 * Prefer prior consulting engineering design experience of municipal water and wastewater projects.
 * Prefer prior construction management and field experience.

Minimum Requirements

Education or Experience: Bachelor’s degree in relevant field or equivalent education and experience in management, communications, in a highly technical, regulated, and fast-paced environment. Advanced degrees and certifications a plus. At least ten years’ experience working in a rate regulated utility or a municipal utility, or similar setting.

Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including drafting reports and presentations and public speaking.

Social Skills: Must act in a respectful, knowledgeable, and professional manner. Work requires regular interaction involving exchange and receipt of complex information; adjusting actions in relation to others’ actions; trying to reconcile differences; actively looking for ways to help people and Global Water be successful. Will interact with employees at all levels and represent Global Water externally.

Physical Demands: Must be able to perform the following on a regular basis: Sitting for extended periods; prolonged periods of time with repetitive motions of hands and fingers; close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to thirty pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Core Values: Applicant must understand, identify with, and adhere to the Global Water Core Values:

1. Believe in the Mission and Each Other

2. Be Disciplined: People, Thought, and Action

3. Take Ownership

4. Maintain a Positive Mindset

Salary: Salary commensurate with experience

General: Must have satisfactory outcome of drug testing, criminal record checks, motor vehicle record, and employment records prior to starting employment.

Licenses: Must have a valid Arizona driver’s license.

job_title: Civil or Structural Engineer Diver 2-8yrs exp
job_description:
Childs Engineering provides professional engineering services to private, state, and federal clients related to the design and rehabilitation of piers, docks, marinas, dry docks, seawalls, ferry terminals, public boat landings, bridges and any other structure that can be found on the waterfront.

We have a very team focused atmosphere with our Engineers traveling thought out the USA and internationally providing support to our valued clients wherever they need us. We are a small, close knit company that values our employees work-life balance and creates a relaxed and fun work environment.

Typical Duties and Responsibilities

 * The role will involve working on a mix of projects located on the waterfront including Piers, Wharves, Bridges, and Marine Terminals, under the guidance of a Project Manager.
 * The work will involve a blend of field and office engineering work with travel within the United States and overseas.
 * The field work will include above and underwater inspection, destructive and non-destructive testing, topographic and hydrographic surveying, and construction oversight.
 * The office work will include structural analysis and design, preparation of drawings and specifications, quantity and cost estimating, and report writing.

Minimum Requirements

 * B.S. degree or higher in Civil, Structural, or Ocean Engineering.
 * 2-8 years of waterfront engineering and inspection experience.
 * EIT or PE registration.
 * Commercial diving certification (ADCI or equivalent) or a willingness to take training.
 * Familiarity with AutoCAD.
 * Ability to work and communicate effectively as part of a team.
 * Ability and willingness to travel, including overnight, as required.
 * Valid driver’s license

Preferred Qualifications

 * Familiarity with structural analysis software such as STAAD.
 * Experience with topographic or hydrographic surveys.
 * NHI Bridge Inspector Course.
 * US Citizen.

Location

 * The position is located out of our Bellingham, MA.
 * All field staff will ideally be located within driving distance of the office location.

Benefits

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including health, short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, and 401(k) and employer matching. Additional benefits include 10 paid holidays, 10-20 paid time off days (depending on experience), and many more. Our work environment is dynamic, has flexible schedules, with a variety of diverse projects for a broad range of experience.

Childs Engineering is committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to age, race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy), physical or developmental disability, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Job Title: Civil Engineer in Training

Location: San Antonio, TX

Company: Valdez Engineering

We are seeking a highly motivated and talented individual to join our team as a Civil Engineer in Training. As a growing civil engineering firm specializing in municipal infrastructure, we offer an exciting opportunity for someone who is eager to learn, grow, and contribute to our success. If you are passionate about delivering high-quality projects, committed to client satisfaction, and eager to grow your career in civil engineering, this opportunity is for you!

Responsibilities:

- Assist in the design and analysis of civil engineering projects, focusing on municipal infrastructure.

- Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to develop innovative solutions that meet client requirements.

- Support project managers in ensuring timely project delivery and gain valuable exposure to project management processes and assist in the coordination of project deliverables, including cost estimation, resource allocation, and schedule management.

- Conduct site visits, perform field investigations, and gather data to inform engineering designs.

- Prepare engineering drawings, specifications, and technical reports.

- Participate in quality control processes to ensure adherence to standards and client expectations.

- Stay updated with industry trends, advancements, and best practices in civil engineering.

- Engage in marketing and business development activities to contribute to the growth of the firm.

- Foster a collaborative and positive work environment by actively contributing to teamwork and knowledge sharing.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering (Masters in Civil Engineering is a plus).

- 2-4 years of experience in civil engineering or relevant internships.

- Proficient in CAD software and other engineering design tools.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and meet project deadlines.

- Commitment to delivering high-quality work and exceeding client expectations.

- Self-motivated with a passion for learning and professional growth.

- Knowledge of municipal infrastructure design and regulations is preferred.

- EIT certification.

Additionally, we understand the importance of providing our team members with the necessary exposure and opportunities to develop the most valuable skills needed to become successful civil engineers. Here are some additional exposure opportunities we offer:

- Collaborative Project Environments: Engage in collaborative project environments where teamwork and knowledge sharing are encouraged. This fosters a supportive atmosphere that allows you to learn from experienced professionals and gain insights into different project approaches and techniques.

- Client Interaction and Business Acumen: Engage directly with clients, understanding their needs, and developing solutions that meet their objectives. Participate in client meetings, proposal development, and client presentations to build strong client relationships and develop a comprehensive understanding of project management and business development. This exposure helps you understand the broader aspects of the industry, client expectations, and project acquisition strategies.

- Project Leadership Opportunities: As you progress in your career, we provide opportunities for you to take on project leadership roles. This allows you to develop essential skills in project management, including team coordination, budgeting, scheduling, and client communication.

- Continued Education and Certifications: We support and encourage our team members to pursue further education and certifications relevant to their career development. This may include attending specialized training programs, obtaining advanced degrees, or acquiring professional certifications in areas such as project management, sustainable design, and data analysis.

- Industry Involvement and Networking: We encourage active involvement in professional organizations and industry events. This provides exposure to the latest advancements, industry trends, and networking opportunities with experts and peers, further enhancing your professional growth and knowledge.

- Mentorship Programs: Our firm believes in the power of mentorship. We offer mentorship opportunities where experienced professionals provide guidance, advice, and support throughout your career journey. This mentorship helps you navigate challenges, develop your skills, and gain valuable insights from industry veterans.

We offer a competitive salary commensurate with experience and a comprehensive benefits package. Join our team and be part of a dynamic firm that values integrity, quality, innovation, teamwork, and client commitment. As we grow, you will have the opportunity to be involved in marketing, business development, and project management, allowing you to build a well-rounded knowledge base and advance your career.

To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant work samples to evaldez@vtgec.com. We look forward to reviewing your application.

job_title: Heavy Civil Construction Project Engineer - Tucson, AZ
job_description:
Heavy Civil Construction Project Engineer- Tucson Arizona


Rummel Construction, Inc. is seeking Heavy Civil Construction Project Engineers to support our projects near Tucson, Arizona.

For 25 years Rummel Construction, Inc. has been providing high quality earthmoving and heavy civil construction services throughout Arizona and the Greater Southwest. We're most well known for our capability in moving massive amounts of earth safely and efficiently, but we're also involved in work at airports, in the mining industry, transportation sector and more. We don't just manage the work of others, we do most of it ourselves. With over 600 employees and more than 300 pieces of heavy equipment, we've got the tools and experience to get the job done right.

About You

In our work, details matter. As a Project Engineer, assigned to one or more of our projects, you'll be responsible to keep track of the details. From monitoring production quantities to reviewing budgets and schedules, Project Engineers are the hub of information between the field and the office. They're ordering materials, setting up subcontractors, attending customer meetings, supporting the field superintendent and relaying crucial information back to the office. You'll find yourself in the field most days, watching the work unfold in front of you.

You'll be working on the following:

 * Creating and maintaining budgets
 * Developing Schedules
 * Processing Change Orders
 * Managing Subcontractors
 * Writing Purchase Agreements and Purchase Orders
 * Track material quantities
 * Source and order materials
 * Communicate with owners and inspectors
 * Collaborate with Rummel Project Managers and Administrative Staff

This position requires the safe operation of a company vehicle and is therefore a safety-sensitive position, and requires a clean driving record.

**This position is located in Arizona, relocation is available for candidates that are applying from out of state**

What are your Qualifications?

 * College degree in construction management, civil engineering, or a related field, preferred
 * Willing to work on projects near Tucson, Arizona
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 * Strong personal organizational skills
 * Able to manage time appropriately and assign priority to your work duties

When and Where Do We Work?

We work with the sun. That means during the summer, we start earlier (think 5:30 or 6 AM). During winter we start a little later. Our business is outside, so you should be able to work effectively in all weather conditions (summer heat, winter cold, even the rainy and humid days).

Flexibility and the ability to travel, if needed, is the key. We're a regional company, so don't expect to travel out of the state very often, but expect to drive between projects and the office throughout the week.

Why Work With Us?

We are strong believers in opportunity and promotion from within our organization. We want you to be successful in your career and we want you to grow with us. We'll give you the opportunities to put in the work and provide you with the tools to be successful. All that and an excellent benefits package. As a Project Engineer, you will also have use of applicable job tools including a company vehicle, credit card, computer and cell phone.

We offer an excellent work environment including a competitive salary, subsidized health insurance, paid-time off, paid holidays, 401k plan, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) and voluntary dental and supplemental benefits. Rummel Construction is 100 % employee owned.

Rummel Construction, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, age, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, sexual orientation, status as a protected veterans and/or individuals with disability to any position for which the applicant or employee is qualified. ROC114845 ROC114846

Do you feel like there should be more to your work and career? Do you seek balance between career and family goals? Do you desire work with purpose? You deserve a place to thrive and grow professionally that recognizes engineering is what you do, not who you are.

Main-Land is seeking an experienced site civil engineer to fill a senior level project management and design position. A successful candidate will quickly take on project and client management, technical staff mentoring, and some business development.

A note from the Director: “I am always watching for a team member who could be our next generation of leadership. Management experience is not required, but leadership qualities and the motivation to learn are. At Main-Land we operate at the speed of trust and grow at the pace of our team.”

What do you need?

About Main-Land Development Consultants, Inc.

Main-Land is a fun loving, close knit, consulting firm that has a small company feel but has the horsepower to tackle large scale private and public sector site civil engineering and development, land planning, water and wastewater utilities, road and infrastructure projects, and a whole lot more.

We value work/life balance and lots of fun while working hard. Main-Land is a Maine Best Places to Work award winner five years running and company culture is no accident!

Main-Land provides full-service consulting to our clients, including surveying, environmental mapping and study, geotechnical engineering, site civil design, permitting, bidding and construction management, and inspection.

Main-Land has formed an Employee Stock Ownership Plan. In a short time, Main-Land will sell stock to the ESOP. Get into the ESOP at the ground level and be an Employee Owner!

ElevenTen Systems LLC manufactures load-bearing cold formed steel wall panels for midrise structures, apartment buildings, hotels, commercial buildings and single-family residences. We also construct curtain wall panels for high rise buildings and other buildings.

We are seeking a full-time structural engineer to be part of the growing ElevenTen design team. The responsibilities of the engineer would include design of cold formed steel structures, including, wall panel design, composite slab design, cold-formed & hot rolled steel column design, joist design and other ancillary structural design. Familiarity with wind and seismic lateral design is necessary. The candidate will also help develop BIM models and shop drawings.

The candidate would be required to have a Professional Engineering license, or equivalent, and have substantial experience designing mid-rise and commercial structures. The candidate will be required to meet with and coordinate the structural design with project architects, project EOR, general contractor/ construction manager, building official, and the special inspector. Site visits and travel will be required but is not anticipated to be extensive. While not expected to be the primary task of the candidate, knowledge of wood design principles and concrete / foundation design principles is a plus.

The candidate needs to be familiar with AISI, IBC, ASCE 7, AISC and ACI standards. The candidate should also be proficient using RISA products, and cold-formed steel design software (i.e. Steel Smart System, Simpson CFS Designer, RSG CFS). Knowledge of Microsoft Office products is necessary, particularly Excel, since it is used frequently in our structural calculation procedures. Proficiency in Autodesk Revit is a bonus.

Position Description

Structural Engineer - Joint Base Andrews, Camp Springs, MD

The base Structural Engineer is specialized in reviewing, analyzing, and monitoring design and engineering proposals for various proposed structures as submitted by contracted engineering design staff. They verify and ascertain the detailed calculations about the strength and stability of structures like bridges and buildings. Additionally, a Structural Engineer researches advanced technology regarding best practices in the field and determines the most cost-effective solution. The Structural Engineer will work alongside the other base engineering professionals to create concepts to meet client needs. A bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or related engineering fields is required for the position.

Duties

 * Work closely with the base engineering staff to ensure plans, equipment, hardware and other required resources for projects are available and working properly.
 * Define clear goals for all aspects of a project and develop steps for their proper execution.
 * Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including time and scope involved.
 * Account for possible project challenges or constraints and proactively seek to manage challenges.
 * Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team.
 * Work alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of initiatives.
 * Establish a framework for necessary contributions from various departments and facilitate their collaboration.

Requirements

 * Must be a US Citizen
 * Must be determined suitable for federal facilities access.
 * Must qualify for a military issued civilian Common Access Card (CAC) from the Department of the Air Force for base facility and Government Furnished Equipment access.
 * Must successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
 * You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.

Qualifications

 * Master's degree in Structural Engineering preferred.
 * Experience developing schematics for structures in accordance with client specifications and safety standards.
 * Project leadership skills are essential.
 * Professional work experience in developing blueprints and designs for proposed structures.
 * Extensive knowledge and experience working with various operating systems.
 * Ability to work with various departments to facilitate the orderly execution of proposed project plans.
 * Experience with software engineering, customer experience and design architecture.
 * Advanced understanding of mechanical structures, building materials, techniques and processes.
 * Up to date understanding of best practices regarding building safety measures.

Job Title: Structural Design Specialist
Department: Engineering
Reports To: Discipline Leader
Approved Date:
FLSA Status: Exempt

SUMMARY
Plans, conducts, and coordinates the various phases of structural engineering work for assigned projects. Performs work which involves conventional structural engineering practice but may include a variety of complex features. Work requires a broad knowledge of concrete, steel, and masonry design, and a good working knowledge of food processing and food distribution facilities. Mission Focus: Professional Development, Excellence in Structural Design Services, Leading Edge Technology, Client Satisfaction.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 * Must be an effective communicator with client, design team, and contractors in resolving and maintaining project direction.
 * Works independently and is technically capable of providing most detailed structural calculations and specifications required to develop and define packaging and processing systems and layouts.
 * Evaluates and recommends most design philosophies for project and determines engineering systems to be provided to meet the project program and client needs.
 * Proficient with RISA, RAM and/or similar structural design software. Must have the ability to become proficient in RISA and RAM.
 * Can clearly outline design alternatives and provide summary of associated benefits/concerns.
 * Works with other engineers and designers that may be assigned to the project team within the same discipline.
 * Researches and applies code requirements in design including all necessary contacts with the appropriate local officials to ensure proper code compliance.
 * Prepares most project specifications. Prepares addenda and bulletins to correct/clarify/alter contract documents when necessary.
 * Responsible for review of project submittals and shop drawings.
 * Conducts site surveys to determine conformance with design intent during construction and to evaluate existing conditions during design. Prepares reports to document surveys.
 * Evaluates and responds to field questions and interprets drawing and specification conflicts; evaluates contractor alternates during bidding and construction. Makes recommendations for the resolution of conflicts.
 * Evaluates, advises, and implements improvements to project delivery system including design procedures, construction materials, standard designs, etc.
 * May assist the Structural Team Leader in training other engineers and designers on technical related issues.
 * Must be familiar with the capabilities and limitations of Revit and AutoCAD
 * Possesses discipline specific knowledge of regulatory agency guidelines including USDA, FDA, PMO, 3A standards, HACCP, and related issues.
 * Experience and a working understanding of Windows programs such as Word and Excel as well as discipline specific programs.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

 * A bachelor’s degree in civil or architectural engineering is required at a minimum. Also, the successful candidate must possess five (5) years, or more, of structural engineering experience.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
FE (Fundamentals of Engineering) certification required. Being a Registered Professional Engineer is a plus.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, and sit. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus. Must be able to make site visits (travel utilizing air, train, and car) and move freely in customer facilities and construction sites.

job_title: Civil Transportation/Highway Engineer (Entry to Senior Levels)
job_description:
CEC has immediate openings for Highway Engineers – all levels of experience from entry level, new graduate to experienced veterans.

CEC offers a secure and relaxed work environment, flexible work schedules, fantastic compensation, and a great benefit package. We take great pride in our work and our team. CEC is growing and there are many opportunities for quick advancement!

This job will provide an opportunity to work on conventional, unique, and complex projects for IDOT, county highway departments, local public agencies/municipalities, and more, involving rural and urban roadway reconstruction/rehabilitation, intersections, geometric design, storm drainage, multi-use paths, sidewalks, signing, pavement marking, culvert and bridge replacements, railroad crossings, traffic engineering, corridor studies, and safety studies.

Responsibilities include:

 * Meet with clients to determine project scope, schedule, and budget.
 * Prepare estimates of construction costs and determine the cost of engineering.
 * Prepare and negotiate engineering agreements and contracts.
 * Coordinate with structure department and sub-consultants, as required.
 * Coordinate the review, and completion of design calculations, plans, specifications, cost estimates, reports, and contracts.
 * Perform analysis of alternatives
 * Design roadway and drainage improvements
 * Detail bridge approaches and roadway transitions
 * Review for quality assurance and quality control and ensure compliance with quality standards.
 * Coordinate and communicate, in-person and remotely, with clients, technicians, engineers, sub-consultants, and contractors.
 * Participate in planning, cost development and management, and scheduling for assigned projects.

Other possible duties, if you have an interest:

 * Work under a Project Manager in construction observation, which may include:
 * Field-required concrete or asphalt testing
 * Documenting material reports, test results
 * Maintaining daily log of inspections
 * Reviewing/preparing pay reports

Qualifications

 * BS Degree in Civil Engineering
 * Professional Engineer License or have the ability to become licensed within a 2 year period is desired, but not required
 * Experience in the planning and design of transportation projects including highways, roads, streets, bike trails, intersections, bridges, culverts, drainage improvements, safety assessments, etc. is desired, but not required.
 * Valid driver's license

Skills

 * Excellent computer and communication skills
 * Experience with Microstation/Power Geopak/Inroads (OpenRoads Designer) and/or AutoCAD Civil 3D; or willingness to train/learn is also acceptable.
 * Must be able to collaborate remotely.

CEC Culture

 * CEC fosters a culture of inclusivity/family with a relaxed dress code and flexible work schedules. Team members frequently collaborate with each other and transportation clients, both in person and remotely.
 * Mentorship opportunities

Compensation and Benefits

CEC staff receive generous compensation and benefits in exchange for their dedication and skills.

Structural Project Engineer (5+yrs exp REQ)

MUE is an energetic, full service structural engineering and inspection firm. We are committed to providing creative and high-quality design solutions and we are driven to construct innovative, sustainable, and practical designs that meet and exceed both our clients’ and building owners expectations and needs.

We are looking to appoint a Senior Structural Engineer to join our team. Do you possess 5 to 7+ years of structural engineering and design experience of commercial and residential building structures? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to take the next step in your career. If you believe you can thrive in a leadership driven role and can play a real part in the growth of this company, Apply Now.

Key Responsibilities

The key responsibilities of a Senior Structural Engineer include, but are not limited to:

 * Direct the design team with suitable field's concepts, practices, and procedures to apply in design.
 * Preparation of structural analysis finite element models and calculation reports
 * Review of structural analysis finite element models developed by junior engineers
 * Review Structural 3D models of building systems and coordinate models with other disciplines.
 * Evaluation of building and structural system performances (vibrations, drifts, accelerations, deflections, and load carrying capacities)
 * Preparing construction documents and ensure design is being coordinated with other disciplines
 * Direct the design team with suitable field's concepts, practices, and procedures to apply in design.
 * Review of engineering documents and specifications.
 * Review code compliance of design
 * Assessment of existing structures & determine cause of structural failures, deficiencies, accidents, etc.
 * Provides reports detailing investigations and assessment of damages to the structure
 * Construction administration (attend project meetings, review structural related Submittals, respond to structural related RFI; review structural related change orders, etc.)
 * Perform site visits and inspections
 * Responsible for maintaining project schedules and achieving all project deadlines and milestones within the project budget

The Person

The key skills and qualities of a Senior Structural Engineer:

 * Strong understanding of all commonly used construction materials (concrete, steel, aluminum, wood, light gauge framing, and reinforced masonry)
 * Masters in Structural Engineering
 * Florida P.E. License
 * Extensive knowledge of standard and local construction practices and national and state design codes and design standards
 * Extensive design experience utilizing structural design software such as Risa Floor, Risa-3D & Risa Foundation, ETABS, Adapt Builder, Adapt PT/ RC and Wood Works Design Suite
 * Proficient using Revit Design Suite 2023 and later

KL Engineering is an award-winning Wisconsin based consulting engineering firm, located in Madison,
Wisconsin with offices in Menomonie, Green Bay, and Germantown. We provide our clients with a full range of services that include transportation engineering, planning and design, structural engineering, traffic engineering, electrical design, site design, parks/trails/recreation design, municipal and utility design, environmental studies, surveying/GIS, construction management, and more. We are committed to offering [A] Better Experience to our employees and clients through innovation and collaboration to create transportation engineering infrastructure solutions that benefit the public. Before we build roads, we build relationships with an unwavering customer service ethic.

At KL Engineering, we work on diverse and challenging transportation related projects within a team of talented and experienced engineers in an inclusive, collaborative, and flexible work environment. Company Description


Work with Us. Change the World.

At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.

There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.

We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.


Job Description


AECOM is seeking a Civil Engineer - Structure Representative to be based in Orange, CA.

Job Responsibilities:

 * Ensure compliance with the construction contract requirements and shop drawing prepared by contractor
 * Verify field dimension including vertical and horizontal field control for structures
 * Oversee staff performing daily field inspections
 * Prepare Daily diaries and maintains inspection records
 * Ability to review submittals including shop drawings, product data, samples, test samples, QA plans submitted by the contractor
 * Assist Resident Engineer with response to Request for Information from Contractor for structure related items
 * Verify compliance with applicable regulations controlling work including CAL/OSHA
 * Inspects construction progress which may include ensuring procedures and materials comply with specifications; observes work in progress to assure conformance with requirements and acceptable workmanship
 * Prepare reports, opinions, and recommendations for review by team leaders prior to submission to clients concerning the structures
 * Ensure conformance with standards, established engineering practices, applicable codes and technical adequacy of design and construction
 * Keep abreast of new methods and developments
 * General office administration, including report reproduction, collation and deliveries will also be expected
 * Performing calculation and acceptance of temporary structures as used in construction of bridges and structures including falsework, temporary shoring, working platforms, temporary supports.
 * Asist with preparing Change Order
 * Preparation of final as-builts
 * Perform constructability reviews.

Job Duties:

 * Assist in inspections to assure compliance with contract plans, specifications, and special provisions on all phases of structural construction such as bridges, foundations, walls, falsework, shoring, and drainage structures.

 * Make grade, alignment, quantity, falsework, and shoring calculations.

 * Assist in the preparation of contract change orders, contract estimates, progress pay estimates, and other documents or reports required for the Project. Coordinate the sampling and testing of construction materials to monitor compliance with contract specifications.

 * Monitor and track Contractor progress. Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports, as required.

 * Coordinate with Resident Engineer, as well as the Construction Staking and Material Testing consultants.

 * Direct the daily activities of subordinate inspectors.




Qualifications


Minimum Requirements:

 * BA/BS + 8 Years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education
 * Licensed Professional Civil Engineer in the State of California.
 * Driving is required for this position

Preferred Qualifications:

 * A minimum of six (6) years with bridge or structural construction inspection as related to major public works projects and a four-year degree in civil engineering is desired.
 * A minimum of two (2) years as a Structural Representative on major public works projects.
 * Knowledge of stress analysis, structural mechanics, and strength of materials.
 * A thorough understanding of Cal-OSHA practices and procedures.
 * Knowledge of Caltrans and Greenbook construction practices and the physical characteristics and properties of various bridge construction materials including concrete.
 * Experience in the following areas: foundations, pile driving, concrete pre-stressing, bridge deck construction, cast-in-place wall construction, falsework, and shoring.
 * Ability to work independently. Ability to perform duties in the construction field office and effectively make decisions concerning construction work in progress and solving field problems.
 * Ability to direct the efforts of subordinate inspectors.
 * Ability to use an automatic level and transit for the purpose of verifying line and grade.
 * Thorough understanding of Caltrans field methods, practices, and construction office procedures. The Structural Representative shall assume the following functional responsibilities:


Additional Information

 * All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
 * Offered rate of compensation (CA locations only) will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The salary range for this position is $122,820.39 - $227,217.73.
 * AECOM is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits program to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D, disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absences, voluntary benefits, perks, U.S and global well-being programs, employee assistance program, business travel insurance, service recognition awards, retirement savings plan, and employee stock purchase plan.



About AECOM

AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.




Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity

AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
