Traffic Engineer/Superintendent

Department: Public Works/Traffic Maintenance

Type of Position: Full-Time

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: A bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering with emphasis on transportation and/or related experience in the field is required. Must possess a valid driver’s license.

REQUIREMENTS: Must pass a criminal background investigation, pre-employment physical, and drug test.

NATURE OF WORK PERFORMED: This position is responsible for managing the Traffic Maintenance Bureau staff and operations including reviewing traffic studies, overseeing preparation and permitting of traffic signal plans, reviewing technical drawings for installation or modification of traffic controls or other transportation and public works infrastructure, and managing field activities for the installation and maintenance of traffic controls citywide.

EXAMPLES OF WORK PERFORMED: Coordinates and manages daily activities of staff in the installation and maintenance of traffic controls; coordinates with city Bureaus to establish traffic control and detours; coordinates with contractors working within City rights-of-way to ensure work is being done safely; prepares traffic signal plans and permits; reviews technical drawings for installation or modification of traffic controls and other transportation and public works infrastructure; performs computations per published technical manuals; coordinates and determines applicable rules and regulations relating to traffic and implements required measures; reviews and comments on land development site plans; attends and presents information to planning, zoning boards and other community groups or organizations; reviews and evaluates traffic studies submitted by traffic consultants; coordinate and manages traffic controls for street closings and traffic pattern modification for the special events; maintains Traffic controls GIS database and fabricates traffic and parking control signs; computer skills; conducts and interprets speed and traffic studies; Ability to prepare annual budgets and make necessary purchases of all signs, paint, replacement and new parts, and hardware to operate Traffic Bureau; manages traffic related design projects; applies for and manages grant applications for traffic improvements.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: Must possess good management and communication skills; good knowledge of Pennsylvania Title #67 and traffic control regulations; good knowledge of Title #75, Pennsylvania Motor Vehicle Code; ability to prepare or oversee/manage preparation of and permitting of traffic signal plans; ability to react and coordinate efforts during emergencies; must possess graphic and computer skills; ability to read and understand site plan reviews, traffic signal reviews; basic knowledge of specialized painting equipment; ability to carry out duties and follow technical, oral and written instructions.

HOW TO APPLY: Applicants should submit a resume and cover letter outlining how they meet the specific requirements of the position. While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

Position Overview: 
EVstudio is hiring for experienced engineers in training for our Residential Studio. Candidates will be responsible for structural engineering design development and for preparation of structural engineering construction documents.

 * Applies broad knowledge of principles and practices in a specific practice area.
 * Independently evaluates, selects, and adapts standard techniques, procedures, and criteria.
 * Acquires general knowledge of principles and practices of related fields, and ability to function on multidisciplinary teams.
 * Works on multiple projects.

Technical Responsibilities:

 * Designs a complete project, system, component, or process.
 * Prepares complete project documents.
 * Formulates and solves problems

Direction Received:

 * Receives general direction on key objectives.
 * Receives guidance when necessary on unconventional or complex problems, direction on modified techniques, and new approaches on assignments with conflicting criteria.

Communication Responsibilities:

 * Interacts with team members
 * Opportunity to interact with clients, customers, officials, contractors and others

Minimum Qualifications:*

 * Bachelor’s degree in Structural Engineering or Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures from an accredited program is required
 * 2-3 years of experience in engineering and on the path to P.E. licensure
 * Experience with Revit is required
 * Experience with AutoCAD
 * Residential design experience is preferred
 * Familiar with common structural analysis software
 * Familiar with International and Residential Building Codes

 * Design experience with wood, concrete, steel, and masonry – experience with post-tensioned concrete a plus
 * Passionate about the art of engineering and self-motivated
 * Ability to work in a team approach environment
 * Willing to adapt to different project types and tasks on a daily basis
 * Excellent verbal communication and writing skills

 * Able to perform physical field work, including climbing ladders, performing visual observations from afar/rooftops/scaffolding/confined spaces, using precision instruments, etc.

Experience: 2-4 years

Licensure and Certification: E.I.T.

Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to talk and hear. The employee is often required to stand, walk, sit and use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel objects and to manipulate keys on a keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment:

Work is generally performed within an office environment where the noise level is usually quiet to moderate. When work is performed outdoors on construction sites, conditions may vary by client and facility. Adherence to all health and safety requirements within the office, on construction sites is essential.

Job Description

Ficcadenti Waggoner and Castle Structural Engineers, Inc.

Job Position: Structural Design Engineer

Location: Concord, CA

Firm Description:

Ficcadenti Waggoner and Castle Structural Engineers (FWC) was established in 1991 to provide structural engineering services to a diverse group of high-quality clients. FWC has over 70 employees with 4 offices nationwide.

Throughout our company, we believe that knowledge, experience, and education are the key components to be a successful partner with our clients.

FWC designs parking structures, theme parks, theaters, large retail centers, fitness centers, hotels, multifamily residential buildings, university facilities, airport facilities, and commercial buildings. We design using concrete, steel, aluminum, masonry, timber, cold formed steel, fiber reinforced plastic, and other materials.

Our qualifications and experience enable us to back our creative solutions with fundamental engineering principles. Our engineers use the latest analytical software combined with a hands-on approach with significant contractor interaction. Our design and graphics departments utilize the latest drafting and three-dimensional modeling packages to develop quality designs, reports, and construction documents.

Job Responsibilities:

We are seeking applicants with 5-10 years of experience to join our team. The job responsibilities include:

1. Designing significant structures using concrete,

steel, wood, masonry, timber, cold-formed steel, and fiber reinforced

plastic.

2. Developing designs using prefabricated construction

3. Interacting with clients

4. Conducting site inspections and interacting with contractors

5. Developing client relationships

Job Qualifications:

Applicants must have the following qualifications:

1. BS degree required; MS degree preferred

2. PE license preferred

3. Knowledge of software such as SAP, ETABS, RISA, Enercalc, Bluebeam and Revit are preferred

4. Be self-motivated

5. Be team oriented

6. Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills

7. Have ability to develop innovative solutions for complex problems

Benefits and Pay:

FWC offers the following benefits and pay:

1. Base Salary: Negotiable

2. Overtime: 1.5 times base rate

3. Bonuses: Semi-annual

4. Tax deferred profit sharing for all employees: 7.5% of total annual gross compensation with 5-year vesting. 100% employer paid

5. Medical and dental: 100% employer paid

6. 401K program

7. Selected employee seminars or professional organizations: 100% paid

8. Annual retreat (Recent retreats have been at various winter or summer

resorts): 100% paid

FWC is an equal opportunity employer.  FWCSE is not accepting applicants that require sponsorship for an H-1B visa. Local candidates are preferred.

job_title: Civil or Structural Engineer Diver 2-8yrs exp
job_description:
Childs Engineering provides professional engineering services to private, state, and federal clients related to the design and rehabilitation of piers, docks, marinas, dry docks, seawalls, ferry terminals, public boat landings, bridges and any other structure that can be found on the waterfront.

We have a very team focused atmosphere with our Engineers traveling thought out the USA and internationally providing support to our valued clients wherever they need us. We are a small, close knit company that values our employees work-life balance and creates a relaxed and fun work environment.

Typical Duties and Responsibilities

 * The role will involve working on a mix of projects located on the waterfront including Piers, Wharves, Bridges, and Marine Terminals, under the guidance of a Project Manager.
 * The work will involve a mix of field and office engineering work with travel within the United States and overseas.
 * The field work will include above and underwater inspection, destructive and non-destructive testing, topographic and hydrographic surveying, and construction oversight.
 * The office work will include structural analysis and design, preparation of drawings and specifications, quantity and cost estimating, and report writing.

Minimum Requirements

 * B.S. degree or higher in Civil, Structural, or Ocean Engineering.
 * 2-8 years of waterfront engineering and inspection experience.
 * EIT or PE registration.
 * Commercial diving certification (ADCI or equivalent) or a willingness to take training.
 * Familiarity with AutoCAD.
 * Ability to work and communicate effectively as part of a team.
 * Ability and willingness to travel, including overnight, as required.
 * Valid driver’s license

Preferred Qualifications

 * Familiarity with structural analysis software such as STAAD.
 * Experience with topographic or hydrographic surveys.
 * NHI Bridge Inspector Course.
 * US Citizen.

Location

 * The position is located out of our Hainsport, NJ office.
 * All field staff need to be located within driving distance of the office location.

Benefits

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including health, short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, and 401(k) and employer matching. Additional benefits include 10 paid holidays, 10-20 paid time off days (depending on experience), and many more. Our work environment is dynamic, has flexible schedules, with a variety of diverse projects for a broad range of experience.

Childs Engineering is committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to age, race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy), physical or developmental disability, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

job_title: Experienced Senior Civil/Environmental Engineer (10 yr exp req)
job_description:
Employment Opportunity

Senior Civil/Environmental Engineer

Weber, Hayes & Associates

Our well-established Monterey Bay-located environmental and hydrogeologic consulting firm (www.weber-hayes.com) is seeking a full time California Registered Civil/Environmental Professional Engineer with experience in drinking water systems design and engineering to collaborate with our Engineering Group who specialize in potable water system design and engineering, construction management, and operations & management services for a wide range of clients. The ideal candidate is an intelligent, motivated, and detail-oriented team player who is at least 10 years into their career as an environmental engineer.

Minimum Requirements

 * Is a California Registered Professional Engineer
 * Possession of a valid Class C California driver's license

Senior Engineer Responsibilities and Duties

 * Collaborate with the Engineering Group and manage multiple projects at any one given time, including the preparation and management of project budgets, meeting project deadlines, and ensuring effective client and regulatory agency communication and relation
 * Supervising and directing all aspects of the design and engineering of potable water systems, primarily groundwater-sourced small, disadvantaged and underserved communities - the core work of the Engineering Group - as the Engineer in Responsible Charge
 * Supervising and directing water system construction monitoring and management services
 * Supervising and directing the management, operation and maintenance of a portfolio of small community water systems
 * Directing and mentoring junior staff

Familiarity with the State Water Board’s Technical Assistance Program and the Drinking/Clean Water State Revolving Fund a plus, but not required, as is California Drinking Water Operator Certification. Knowledge and experience in soil and groundwater remediation beneficial, but not required.

Compensation

Annual salary starts at $105K to $115K based on experience and pay increases are based on performance. This position includes medical, dental and prescription plan health benefits, profit-sharing bonuses, and 401(k) plan with employer match. Other benefits include 9.5 paid holidays per year, paid vacation time, and use of a company vehicle.

Application

To apply for the position, please email your resume along with at least two (2) professional references to the attention of Jered Chaney at jered@weber-hayes.com. If selected, within approximately 2 weeks of submittal you will be invited for an in-person or teleconference interview.

Senior Civil Right Legal Support Specialist

Ancon is a government contracting firm and has an immediate need for a Senior Civil Rights Legal Support Specialist to provide support s services to satisfy the overall operational objectives of the civil rights office of a government agency in Washington DC. This position is fulltime remote supporting the Washington DC team; 8:am-4:30

All candidates MUST have documented civil rights discrimination experience to include investigations, adjudications, FAD’s etc., as well as provide writing samples.

Qualifications of Senior Legal Support Specialist

Legal Support Specialist shall:

 * Read and analyze all letters and documents to determine responsible action, subject matter(s), and signature level.
 * Review and be familiar with recent decisions out of the EEOC and the MSPB
 * Reviewing Reports of Investigation.
 * Maintaining communication with investigators with regard to the types of evidence needed to make a determination of discrimination or harassment.
 * Write Final Agency Decisions that state whether discrimination or harassment has occurred.
 * Issue the Correct "Rights of Appeal" to all Complainants.
 * Draft acceptance or challenges to orders that have been issued by the EEOC or MSPB (Final Orders).
 * Research case law, law reviews and treatise on Westlaw when needed.
 * Review the FADs of adjudicators for spelling, grammar, and punctuation errors, where necessary, review the relevant ROI to ensure the law has been correctly applied to facts.
 * Research relevant case-law and regulations
 * Provide compliance support for Title VI and VII
 * Draft of a well thought out and concise opinion as to the presence of discriminatory employment practices.
 * Prepare a draft of a Recommendation of Discipline to be imparted upon offending Agency Officials and address the relevant Agency Civil Rights Director and Human Resource Officer.

CERTIFICATIONS, LICENSE, PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER EXPERTISE REQUIRED. The contractor must have:

 * MUST have demonstrated experience with Investigations, writing FAD’s and ROI’s .
 * MUST Be well versed of Title VI, VII, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act, Americans with Disabilities Act, the Rehabilitation Act and relevant federal case law.
 * Must have great writing and editing skills, to write legal memos, talking points, finding from legal research.
 * Must be experience in working with C-Suite type, senior executives and have a professional appearance.
 * Must be self-motivated, have the ability to problem solve with little direction and be well organized.
 * Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and able to quickly adjust to short deadlines and last-minute request.
 * Be well versed of Title VI, VII, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act, Americans with Disabilities Act, the Rehabilitation Act and relevant federal case law.
 * Juris Doctorate (required) (4 years or more years’ experience)
 * Read and analyze all letters and documents to determine responsible action, subject matter(s), and signature level. Identifies documents requiring urgent handling and brings such documents to the immediate attention of the respective Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Specialists and/or the Civil Rights (CR) Management for prompt action.
 * Use barcode scanning devices to log in new material, charge-out existing files, and locate specifically identified files. Determine file numbers and classifications to be assigned, using caution to ensure that information is not classified in more than one area and that one number is not assigned to more than one case file.
 * Quarterly review documents to determine if materials should be filed, updated, merged, or retired. If it is determined that such material should be retired, uses Departmental records plan and disposal procedures to transfer records to the Federal Archives Records Center.
 * Examine materials to identify primary subject matter and assign proper classification from among numerous overlapping possibilities.
 * Receive requests for information and resolve requests and/or direct requests appropriately for resolving inquiries and complaints.
 * Receive and review correspondence. When appropriate, prepares response, submits response for government approval or refers for proper action.
 * Organize and maintain files, records and draft correspondence.
 * Review outgoing correspondence, ensuring proper format and grammar. Prepares statements of fact, position statements and management report and submits for approval.
 * Receive and process internal customer requests and perform copy jobs as requested in a timely manner.
 * Compile and forward monthly reports on budget recovery and job ticket information.

We are currently seeking a talented Project Engineer to join our team and contribute to our continued success.

Job Description: As a Project Engineer at Roen Salvage Company, you will play a vital role in coordinating and monitoring heavy civil marine construction activities. Your responsibilities
will include:

 * Coordinating work procedures with the superintendent, crew, and subcontractors.

About us

Sanchez & Associates, P.C. is a small business in Elk Grove Village, IL. We are agile, professional and our goal is to be a leader in the geospatial and engineering industry in the Chicagoland and surrounding areas..

Our work environment includes:

 * Modern office setting
 * Food provided
 * Modern office setting
 * Growth opportunities

Company Overview:

We are a dynamic and growing medium-sized business poised to expand into the field of civil engineering, with a focus on construction inspection and design. Our company is committed to excellence, innovation, and sustainable practices in all aspects of our operations. As we embark on this exciting journey of growth, we are seeking a talented and experienced individual to lead our Civil Engineering Department.

Position Overview:

The Civil Engineer will play a key role in supporting the development and execution of civil engineering projects, with a focus on construction inspection and design. This position will involve collaborating closely with project teams, conducting site assessments, preparing design drawings and specifications, and ensuring the successful delivery of projects in accordance with client requirements and regulatory standards.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Work collaboratively with project managers, architects, and other stakeholders to understand project objectives, requirements, and constraints.

2. Conduct site visits and assessments to gather data, evaluate existing conditions, and identify engineering challenges and opportunities.

3. Prepare detailed design drawings, plans, and specifications using CAD software and other relevant tools, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and adherence to project guidelines.

4. Perform calculations, analyses, and simulations to support engineering design and decision-making processes, considering factors such as structural integrity, drainage, and environmental impact.

5. Assist in the preparation of project proposals, bids, and cost estimates, providing technical expertise and input as needed.

6. Collaborate with regulatory agencies, contractors, and subcontractors to obtain necessary permits and approvals, and ensure compliance with applicable codes and regulations.

7. Monitor project progress, identify potential risks and issues, and propose solutions to mitigate delays or challenges.

8. Prepare and maintain project documentation, including progress reports, meeting minutes, and as-built drawings, ensuring accurate and up-to-date record-keeping.

9. Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders, providing updates, addressing inquiries, and facilitating collaboration throughout the project lifecycle.

Qualifications:

1. Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field required; Master's degree preferred.

2. Engineer-in-Training (EIT) certification preferred; Professional Engineer (PE) license a plus.

3. 2-5 years of experience in civil engineering, with exposure to construction inspection, design, and project management.

4. Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, Civil 3D) and other engineering software tools.

5. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to perform calculations and analyses accurately and efficiently.

6. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams and external stakeholders.

7. Detail-oriented approach with a commitment to producing high-quality work and delivering projects on time and within budget.

8. Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining a positive attitude and adaptability to changing requirements.

Benefits:

- Competitive salary and benefits package

- Opportunities for professional development and advancement

- Exposure to diverse projects and industries

- Collaborative and inclusive work environment

- Chance to contribute to the growth and success of a dynamic company

Please include any relevant certifications, portfolio samples, or project experience that demonstrate your qualifications for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Job Description – Geotechnical Engineer

General Description

The Geotechnical Engineer is involved in a variety of structural engineering projects with a focus on foundation engineering, emphasizing design-build delivery methods for electrical transmission and distribution projects. The Structural Staff Engineer, EIT interfaces with a multi-disciplinary engineering team consisting of civil, structural, geotechnical, and various construction management personnel. This position is responsible for supporting design production including calculations and construction drawings. The position may also coordinate with outside design consultants in the preparation and delivery of design projects.

Key Responsibilities and Skills

· Perform assignments requiring application of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria to carry out engineering tasks. Assignments are designed to further develop judgement and understanding of professional and ethical responsibilities.

· Exercise judgment limited to developing details of work in making preliminary selections and adaptations of engineering alternatives.

· Prepare design calculations and analysis for various specialty foundation types including Helical Piles, Drilled Shafts, Micropiles, Rock and Soil Anchors, Driven Piles, etc.

· Prepare preliminary foundation designs for use in project bidding.

· Develop broad knowledge and skills in foundation design and gain understanding of applicable design codes and standard practice design guides.

· Work under supervision of Senior Project Engineer or Project Manager.

Required Experience and Education

· Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering.

· EIT Eligible.

· Proficient with Microsoft Office particularly Excel and Word.

· Experience with computer programs such as AutoCAD, Inventor, LPILE, GROUP, FADTools, SAP2000, RISA 3D, Enercalc, and MathCAD preferred.

· Excellent written and communication skills.

· Highly organized.

· Able to work effectively within a team environment.

· Knowledge of design standards including ASCE, IBC, ACI, AISC, FHWA, AASHTO, NESC and ASTM.

Travel Requirements

· Overnight travel should be expected (approximately 10 to 20%).

Physical Requirements

We are currently looking for a Project Manager who can join our dynamic Northern California management team. BSC uses design, engineering, science, and technology to Build, Support, and Connect with our co-workers and communities. We recognize different passions and perspectives and strive to inspire and empower each other to create meaningful change. As a trusted advisor and neighbor, our team is personally invested in every action we take. We remain focused on diversity, sustainability, and social accountability in the services we provide to our clients.

A successful team member must:

 * Enjoy a challenge! Internal debates keep us learning and growing.
 * Be passionate about seeking, sharing, and applying new knowledge and skills to improve individual, team, and company performance.
 * Be committed to continuous upskilling and lifelong learning
 * Maintain a high standard for being ethical, respectful, and fair with your BSC team, clients, and communities.
 * Have the courage and strength to show character. Bring your whole self to work!

BSC is currently seeking a Waterfront Engineer to strengthen BSC’s coastal services practice.

The ideal candidate for this position will have technical experience in designing and permitting a variety of coastal projects and must be a licensed or registered professional engineer in MA, NH or CT, and have the ability to acquire licenses in the other New England states. As a technical expert, the candidate will work with a staff of interrelated professionals dedicated to providing high-level expertise on a broad range of coastal engineering projects.

The candidate who fills this position will join a high performing team that provides clients with multi-disciplinary engineering and science-based solutions to coastal management challenges including coastal engineering, structural review and design of coastal structures, and preparing plans and details. Responsibilities of this position include both leading and supporting the technical execution of projects along the New England coastline.

Exceptional candidates of any experience level will be considered.

Primary Job Responsibilities:

 * Assist in the development of SOQs and proposals for coastal infrastructure-related projects.
 * Manage and perform engineering analysis, preliminary, and detail design of coastal structures.
 * Manage projects (scope, budget, schedule) and work with sub-consultants and BSC team members and assure quality control of work throughout project execution, including:
 * all aspects for the design and permitting of waterfront developments including piers, marinas and boardwalks;
 * analysis and design of structures for flood and erosion control such as seawalls, bulkheads, revetments and breakwaters, wave fences and fendering, and private and waterfront recreation structures such as fishing piers, marina docking structures, and boat launch ramps;
 * contributing to beach nourishment and erosion solutions;
 * conducting/reviewing technical analyses/calculations;
 * completing mooring and berthing analyses and design;
 * preparation of project specifications, bid and contract documents;
 * construction contract administration; and
 * site inspections and reports;

 * Demonstrated technical and analytical skills, including technical writing and presentation skills.
 * Familiarity with industry standard analysis and design software.

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

 * Demonstrated teamwork and leadership skills.
 * Experience working on multidisciplinary teams involving surveyors, environmental scientists, structural engineers, civil engineers, landscape architects and planners.
 * Support regional dredged material management and coastal restoration efforts
 * Knowledge of FEMA’s National Flood Insurance Program and experience implementing FEMA’s coastal flood hazard analysis and mapping methodologies.
 * Minimum of a bachelor’s degree with a focus on coastal/ocean, waterfront engineering, oceanography, or related field.
 * Proven experience with project delivery for multiple Federal, State and local coastal agencies/clients, specific experience with USACE, FEMA, USGS, NOAA strongly preferred.

We understand each BSC team member is unique, as are definitions of work-life balance. Some of our team members are 100% remote and some enjoy an office environment. However, the majority of BSC’s workforce embraces a hybrid model, which allows people to work from home, job sites, and other remote locations, as well as any of our office locations when necessary.

BSC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to diverse representation on our teams, in our services, and all layers of leadership. We are focused on identifying and dismantling barriers that lead to a more diverse workforce including working diligently to expose underrepresented groups to engineering, science, and design through STEM programs, education and outreach, and industry involvement. We continue to strive to maximize benefits to the communities we impact through diversity and inclusion in strategy and design.

job_title: EI IV - Bridge Inspection Team Leader
job_description:
Engineering Operations, LLC (eO) is a civil engineering firm focused in field engineering operations mainly consisting of bridge inspection and structural assessment. eO is a quality-first company, with a diverse multidisciplinary team that is committed to providing our clients with the best possible services. We take great pride in what we do, both in the office and in the field.

Experienced Engineer Intern (EI) Job Description

We are currently seeking an NBIS Certified Team Leader with a valid Engineering Intern (EI) certification to work out of our Manhattan, Montana Office. This individual should have 3-4 year's experience working in an engineering field under a licensed engineer to be eligible for this role. The candidate should be actively pursuing their Professional Engineering License and have a strong motivation to achieve this goal in the near future. The individual shall also possess a team-oriented attitude and be a reliable and dependable employee who has a passion for producing quality engineering deliverables and working outdoors. This position will include company-paid travel ranging from single day trips to multi-week trips – so a desire to travel is a requirement. Responsibilities will include leading field inspections of vehicular bridges, load ratings, reporting, and detailed drawing assignments that require construction-plan reading abilities. This candidate will serve as a bridge inspection team leader in the field and will assist with project scheduling, planning, coordination, team management, and general project management for bridge inspection projects.

Responsibilities

 * Complete load ratings for bridges using AASHTO specifications and various load rating software.
 * Perform field inspections and bridge safety inspections for various Departments of Transportation in Montana, Wyoming, Colorado, Florida, Louisiana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Texas, and Arkansas as well as local government and private clients.
 * Perform structural analyses of primary structural elements with deterioration models based off field measurements.
 * Utilize various non-destructive evaluation (NDE) equipment in field environments including Ultrasonic Flaw Detection, Dye Penetrant testing, Magnetic Particle testing, Resistograph testing to determine deterioration of structural elements.
 * Interpret data from field inspections and test results to create comprehensive bridge inspection reports that detail bridge conditions and defects regarding the structural integrity of bridge inventory.
 * Coordinate with Deputy and Senior Project Managers
 * Assist project managers with scheduling, team coordination, report progress tracking, deliverables organization and submittals.

Required Qualifications:

 * Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering from an ABET-accredited university
 * Registration as an Engineering Intern (EI) or Engineer in Training (EIT)
 * Strong foundation in structural analysis
 * Clear communication and organizational skills – both written and oral
 * Proficiency in Microsoft Office Products
 * CAD Drafting Skills (Bentley or AutoDesk Products)
 * Professional Rope Access Certification is a plus
 * Commercial Diver Certification is a plus

Percentages of Job Duties:

 * 25% - Field Inspections
 * 50% - Field Inspection Reporting
 * 15% - Project Management Assistance
 * 10% - Load Rating/Structural Analysis

job_title: Structural Engineer - Licensed (California Civil PE) Fresno, CA
job_description:
Advanced Structural Design, Inc.

ASDi is seeking to add a PROJECT ENGINEER to our growing team of structural engineers in Fresno, CA. We are a full-service structural engineering firm dedicated to serving the needs of our clients in the Central Valley and beyond. We specialize in the structural design of new buildings as well as the modernization and retrofit of existing buildings. For over 35 years, ASDi has been providing structural designs across a multitude of building industries and locations, and we draw upon that experience throughout the design process. Our team is dedicated to going above and beyond to meet the needs of our clients on each and every project we are a part of.

At ASDi, we believe our people are our greatest asset, and we strive to ensure all our engineers have the tools they need to produce exceptional work. We offer a great opportunity to learn from our three licensed Structural Engineers with a combined 60+ years of experience. We encourage open communication amongst our staff, and take a collaborative approach on our projects to ensure everyone makes an impact on the work we produce. As engineers, we continue learning throughout our entire careers, and ASDi provides exposure to a diverse range of projects and experiences to foster growth.

Job Description and Duties

We are seeking talented engineers who are motivated and passionate about building design. At ASDi you will have the opportunity to play a significant role in the design of noteworthy projects across the state of California, including the future Terry Bradley Education Center for Clovis Unified School District (Clovis South complex). A PROJECT ENGINEER will be involved in:

 * Preparation of structural calculations using both hand calculations and computer analysis software
 * Preparation of structural drawings using AutoCAD and Revit software
 * Sketching of construction details for drafters
 * Review of shop drawings and responding to field requests
 * Field visits and report writing for projects throughout the state
 * Communicate with Contractors and Architects regarding design and construction activity

Qualifications

The ideal candidate for this position will meet the qualifications listed below, however all applicants will be considered.

 * BS Degree in Civil Engineering or Architectural Engineering required
 * Ideal candidate has 3+ years of experience in Structural Engineering
 * Licensed in State of California as a PE is required
 * Experience using AutoCAD, Revit, and RAM Structural System is a plus
 * Experience with DSA is a plus
 * Practical detailing and problem solving skills
 * Ability to work as part of a team environment

Company Benefits

We invest in your quality of life by providing a benefit program designed to balance your personal and professional lives. ASDi offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including:

 * Full health coverage (medical, dental, and vision) for the employee and family
 * Year-end bonuses
 * Profit sharing in the form of a SEP-IRA program
 * Paid vacation
 * Paid holidays
 * Company outings and team-building activities

For more information about our firm or this position you may visit our website at www.asdiengr.com

About us

Headwaters Engineering is an established, yet growing civil engineering firm based in beautiful Bozeman, MT. We provide an environment which allows employees to grow and advance as fast as they desire. Our goal as a company is to create long lasting relationships by providing our clients with an innovative, high quality product every time.

Headwaters Engineering offers experience in a large range of projects, allowing engineers to hone their skills and become well rounded professionals.

Headwaters Engineering, Inc. is seeking to hire an entry level engineer or a field engineer with 0 -3 years of experience to join our Bozeman, MT office.

At Headwaters, you’ll work on impactful and diverse projects, important to the communities in and around the Gallatin Valley area. You will make use of precision GPS equipment, AutoCAD, Civil 3D, HEC-RAS, WaterCAD, and other flow modeling software to complete infrastructure plans for developments ranging from 5 to 100 lots, subdivision entitlements, commercial & residential site plans, septic systems, waterway restoration projects, pond design & more. Duties may include construction observation, civil design work, subdivision entitlements, engineer estimates, review of shop drawings, drafting, topographic surveying, and construction stakeout on both private and public projects. You’ll grow to be able to take a conceptual sketch through the design phase and into a real, physical part of the built environment.

Prospective candidates should possess a BS or MS in Civil Engineering, with an emphasis in development and/or construction engineering, and shall possess the following qualifications:

· 0 – 3 years of experience in the Civil Engineering field

· A willingness to perform general engineering tasks under close supervision,

· A driver's license with a clean driving record,

· A working knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook, AutoCAD, Civil3D

· A service-oriented attitude and ability to work within a team environment,

· Interest in pursuing a career as a Professional Engineer,

· Strong organizational skills and attention to detail,

· Ability to interact with staff, engineers, & contractors in a professional, positive manner,

· Proficient oral and written communication skills.

· Ability to lift up to 50 pounds, swing a hammer and walk several miles per day.

· Interest in working greater than 50% of time in the field.

The work environment at Headwaters is the cornerstone of our success. While we pride ourselves in hard work, we hold paramount the value of fostering a workplace that is enjoyable and rewarding for everyone.

The salary range is $65,000 - $80,000 for this position, depending on experience and qualifications. Offer includes 8 paid holidays, 120 hours paid time off, health insurance allowance, Employer IRA Match, and a great work environment. If you meet the above qualifications and are looking to grow your civil engineering career in a dynamic environment, please submit your resume and cover letter to career@headwatersmt.net today.

McClelland Consulting Engineers (MCE) is seeking a Project Manager/Engineer to join our team. This position is responsible for engineering design and other duties for a wide variety of infrastructure improvements including roadway, water, wastewater, stormwater, and site development projects across Arkansas and parts of Oklahoma. This position will have the opportunity to work on challenging projects with an effective design team while also gaining valuable knowledge from experienced Civil Engineers.

We are seeking an experienced, driven individual who wants to work as part of a team committed to making a positive impact on local community infrastructure. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently and within teams are essential.

MCE is a full service regional civil engineering firm primarily serving municipal and state government clients, as well as higher education institutions, and residential and commercial developers. We are a client-focused company that practices excellence in design and provides responsive customer service.

MCE is an equal opportunity employer offering a competitive benefits package and opportunity for career growth.

Summary

Project managers are first point of contact for any issues or discrepancies arising from within the heads of various departments in an organization before the problem escalates to higher authorities, as project representative.

This position will be responsible for water/wastewater projects across Arkansas and parts of Oklahoma. The Project Manager manages the development, implementation, and evaluation of complex designs. The Project Manager approves changes that substantially impact the scope, budget, or schedule of a project. In addition, the Project Manager monitors progress and performance against the project plan, and provides input to strategic decisions that affect the functional area of responsibility. Mentoring entry and mid-level engineers within the department. This position is also responsible for developing the project budget.

Essential Functions

 * Planning, development, implementation, and evaluation with the management of a wide variety of projects
 * Resolving escalated issues arising from operations and requiring coordination with other departments
 * Maintain the progress, mutual interaction, and tasks of various parties in such a way that reduces the risk of overall failure, maximizes benefits, and minimizes costs
 * Prepares preliminary engineering reports, feasibility studies, master plans, environ- mental information documents and project performance work plans and reports
 * Prepares NPDES, ARDOT, ADEQ, and various railroad and other permits
 * Prepares engineering design drawings using field surveying data, reports, maps, drawings, and topographical and geologic data
 * Conducts pre-construction meetings, pre-bid meetings, periodic construction meetings, prepares contractor pay requests
 * Manages CAD, surveying, clerical and other support staff directly involved with the project to ensure adherence to standards and delivery of project on schedule and within budget

Competencies

 * Knowledge of ADEQ and ADH regulations, policies, and procedures
 * Understanding of Ten States Standards
 * Thorough understanding of water and wastewater system infrastructure design
 * Shows initiative, creativity, problem solving and critical thinking skills, and exercises independent judgment
 * Ability to manage project schedules and budgets
 * Strong communication, writing, technical and analytical skills
 * Ability to interact with private and municipal clients
 * Proficient in Microsoft Office
 * Able to work with the AutoCad software suite, with an emphasis on Civil 3D

Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment and outside for site visits. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and other office equipment.

Travel

Most travel is limited to short or day trips to visit sites, meet clients, etc. Overnight trips are generally not required.

Required Education

 * Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or related engineering field from an ABET accredited college.

Preferred Experience

 * 5 years of design experience
 * Arkansas and/or Oklahoma P.E. licensure preferred

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance

Must be eligible to work in the United States

Summary

CST Engineering, Inc. is seeking a full-time, highly-motivated Senior Traffic/Transportation Engineer to join our Traffic Engineering Department.

CST Engineering, Inc. is a multi-disciplinary civil engineering firm headquartered in Columbia, MD that employs a staff of experienced professionals within the civil engineering field. The firm is MBE/DBE certified with various jurisidictions within Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, D.C., and Pennsylvania, including the Maryland Department of Transportation (MDOT) and the City of Baltimore.

Primary Responsibilities

A successful candidate will be expected to perform the following duties:

 * Perform traffic engineering designs including preparation of signing and pavement marking, signal, lighting, and maintenance of traffic (MOT) plans in accordance with latest design standards.

 * Maintain awareness of project scope, schedules, and budgeting.

 * Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering from an ABET accredited university.
 * Proficient in MicroStation V8/V8i.
 * Knowledge of Maryland Department of Transportation's State Highway Administration (MDOT-SHA) design manuals and standards.
 * Ability to attend local site visits, meetings/conferences, office collaborations as required.
 * Excellent reading, writing, and verbal skills.
 * Valid driver’s license.
 * US Citizen or Permanent Resident.

Position Overview: As a Heavy Civil Project Manager, you will be responsible for the overall management,

coordination, and successful execution of heavy civil construction projects. Your leadership and expertise

will ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.

Key Responsibilities:

 Project Management:

 Lead all phases of heavy civil construction projects, from pre-construction planning to project

closeout.

 Develop and manage project budgets, schedules, and resources effectively.

 Ensure compliance with contractual obligations and regulatory requirements.

 Client Relations:

 Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, architects, engineers, and subcontractors.

 Foster positive relationships with clients through effective communication and problem-solving.

 Manage client expectations and provide regular project updates.

 Risk Management:

 Identify potential risks and challenges and develop strategies to mitigate and manage them.

 Implement effective change management processes as needed.

 Quality Control:

 Oversee and enforce quality control measures to ensure work meets or exceeds industry

standards.

 Conduct regular inspections and coordinate testing to verify compliance with project

specifications.

Qualifications:

 Minimum of 5 years of experience successfully managing projects pertaining to DOT, heavy civil

construction, commercial or industrial projects.

 Proven track record of successfully managing large-scale projects from conception to

completion.

 Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and workmanship of civil and Deep

Foundation Scopes

 Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.

 Familiarity with construction management software and tools.

Responsibilities and Essential Duties include the following (other duties may be assigned):

 Develop project business plan

 Work with field management to generate job specific safety plan for the project.

 Serve as the main point of contact for the Engineer and Architect

 Work with Pre-Construction and Field Supervision to identify and implement all contract

deliverables, quality testing, and reporting requirements

 Create staging, logistics, and phasing plan for project

mobilization

scheduling meetings

- Understand quantity updating and work with Superintendents to maintain accurate labor

forecasts

change orders, and RFI’s)

report, and final accounting)

Project Manager – Civil Construction

Kinney Construction, LLC (KCS Civil) is seeking a Project Manager for Civil Construction. This position will be based out of our corporate headquarters in Flagstaff, Arizona. This individual will be responsible for the management and execution of all phases for civil construction projects.

Position Responsibilities

In this role, you will be responsible for:

· Serving as Project Manager to expertly manage all project phases for civil construction projects.

· Calculating and managing crew production rates.

· Ensure compliance with contractual obligations and regulatory requirements.

· Reviewing and approving material and equipment needs.

· Developing, tracking, and controlling the project schedule and associated costs to achieve project completion on schedule and within budget guidelines.

· Foster positive relationships with clients, engineers, and subcontractors through effective communication and problem solving.

· Foster a collaborative and positive work environment.

· Oversee and enforce quality control measures to ensure work meets or exceeds industry standards.

· Identify potential risks and challenges and develop strategies to mitigate and manage them.

· Ensure compliance with safety protocols and promote a culture of safety on-site.

Requirements

· Four-year degree in Civil engineering or Construction Management.

· 7+ years of recent experience serving as Project Manager with a heavy Civil Contracting firm or a commercial General Contracting firm.

· Demonstrated strong analytical skills required to expertly bid, plan, and manage projects.

· Knowledge of construction cost control and basic accounting procedures.

· Familiarity with Alternative Project Delivery Methods (APDM), including Construction Manager at Risk (CMAR), Design-Build and Job Order Contracting (JOC).

· Solid proficiency in construction software use - experience with Primavera, Procore and

Viewpoint V6 Construction Software is a plus.

Benefits & Perks

· Comprehensive health, dental & vision coverage.

· Paid vacation, holidays, personal, and sick days.

· 401(k) + company match.

· Continuous education and training opportunities.

· Employee volunteer opportunities.

· Company-wide events, i.e., houseboat trips, spring training games, BBQs, holiday parties, and more.

About KCS

KCS is northern Arizona’s premier construction services firm, specializing in commercial building construction, civil construction, and renewable energy projects. KCS promotes a positive team environment, continuous improvement culture, and high standards of integrity and quality in all areas of operation. Our team is committed to Building Better Together, which signifies our shared commitment and passion to building environments and experiences that enable our communities to thrive. And we have fun doing it.

KCS Civil Overview

Our Civil Construction Company was formed under our sister company Kinney Construction Services, Inc. (KCS). KCS Civil self-performs excavation, grading, underground utilities, storm water, process piping, asphalt, concrete, and general sitework scopes of work. We are equipped with an extensive heavy equipment line to provide comprehensive civil construction services for building construction, road construction, utilities, and water and wastewater treatment facilities. Kinney Construction contracts directly with public entities, private owners, and general contractors.

Choose Flagstaff

Perched at 7,000 feet elevation and nestled at the base of the San Francisco Peaks, our mountain community offers a mecca for outdoor enthusiasts and those valuing quality of living over quantity of access. Our four-season climate is unique in Arizona, and when you combine it with our charm, you’ll understand why people come here from all over the world. We choose Flagstaff and hope you do too. Orbital is seeking a Civil/Structural Engineer to assist with single and multi-discipline projects in our Baton Rouge, LA office. The nature of the role involves conceptual and detailed engineering design, project estimation, project engineering, project execution, technical support, and customer relationship development.

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly motivated Civil Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, planning, and overseeing civil engineering projects. They will be responsible for ensuring that projects are completed on time and in compliance with all applicable regulations and safety standards.

Essential Job Functions:

· Contributes actively with project teams to ensure timely fulfillment of various milestones. Assigns work and coordinates with technicians/interns. Stays organized and keeps Project Managers informed of progress.

· Performs basic storm water calculations including: Detention, Water Quality, Conveyance and TESC. Understands basic water and sewer layout and design.

· Contributes to various sections of storm water reports and is familiar with SEPA reports.

· Basic knowledge of King County and DOE storm water manuals and acknowledges differences between different jurisdictions.

· Reads and understands topographic surveys and civil drawings. Performs basic plan markups and interprets other disciplines drawings.

· Uses design aids and other in-house resources effectively; helps improve standards.

· Other duties and projects as assigned.

· Bachelor of Science degree in relevant discipline required.

· 0-4 years of directly related experience.

· Must have initiative, be resourceful, and able to work independently.

· Must be able to effectively prioritize, manage time and projects, and multi-task in a demanding, fast-paced environment.

· Works effectively as an individual or as part of a project team.

· Requires fluency in English with strong verbal and written skills.

· Must be able to effectively collaborate with all levels of management, staff, and clients in diverse environments.

· Must be proficient in the MS Office Suite of software.

· Adherence to our core values.

· Ability to drive locally and travel domestically as needed.

Physical requirements:

· Ability to drive as needed to client project locations (primarily in the greater Seattle area).

· Able to travel by airplane domestically as needed for client projects (outside the greater Seattle area), campus recruiting, conferences, etc.

· Requires sitting for extended periods of time at a computer, keying and reading content.

· Will be required to stand, reach, bend, twist, squat, and move about freely in an office environment. May need to be able to lift up to 25 lbs.

· Able to use office equipment such as phone, copier, printer, etc.

This leader will manage and supervise a geotechnical department of staff dedicated to support projects in the Tulsa Metropolitan and surrounding areas. Projects include major freeways, interchanges, bridges, parkways, and commercial construction. These are high-profile projects that get recognition throughout our nationwide company.

The successful candidate will supervise or monitor all projects to ensure that work is executed on time and in accordance with the client’s requirements and within company policies, procedures, and standards. They will also oversee the preparation of proposals and cost estimates to clients to ensure proper scoping of services, availability of manpower and pricing to achieve desired profitability.

You will direct the daily operations of a department including staff training, development, and performance review, utilization of equipment and facilities, safety oversight, quality of services and work product, timely delivery of services and deliverables, and adherence to policies and procedures. Other responsibilities include planning for and participating in business development activities to identify, develop, win, and execute project opportunities and build and maintain client relationships.

If you're interested in belonging to a 100% employee-owned organization that allows us to set our course together and benefit when our hard work creates financial success, then Terracon is your kind of company! Come explore with us!

 * Promote continuous quality monitoring and improvement on projects; monitor quality standards and practices; engage APRs on projects at their onset

We are growing!!

Would you like to work for a growing company where your efforts are acknowledged, you make a difference, and have upward mobility in the company? Then Stephens may be a great match for you! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. continues our expansion to become a national forensic engineering company! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. (STEPHENS) is a respected company that specializes in forensic engineering. Stephens is a growing company with our corporate office located outside of Houston, Texas. Our experienced engineers provide a wide range of expertise to our clients.

Job Description

We are searching for a full-time Forensic Engineer, PE (Civil/Structural) based in the Charlotte, North Carolina metropolitan area. The candidate may also service STEPHENS's clients in other states, particularly in the surrounding states.

Benefits of a career in Forensic Engineering

 * Not being confined to an office all day.
 * Getting out and seeing new things.
 * Regularly meeting new people.
 * No daily commute.
 * Problem solving and providing expert opinions.
 * More time with family.

Job Responsibilities

 * Prior forensic engineering experience is not required as STEPHENS provides on-the-job training.
 * Perform forensic (investigative) evaluations residential, commercial, and industrial buildings for including (but may not be limited to) storm related damage to roofing and exterior claddings, moisture intrusion, impact damage (tree, vehicle, etc.), foundation settlement, construction defects, etc.
 * Prepare precise and unbiased written reports of findings for your site investigations based on field inspections and research consistent with the company’s standards and guidelines.
 * Prior report writing skills are a plus.
 * Consistently and effectively communicate with clients, the engineering team, and the home office on daily work.
 * Must be customer service and team oriented, with professional and timely communication with company clients for assigned projects.
 * Must be flexible with scheduling, daily work, and quality control.
 * Consistently meet all of the required company expectations and deadlines, particularly during times of heavy workload.
 * Provide depositions and expert testimony, if necessary, on assigned work.
 * Additional duties assignment by management.
 * Must be willing to work additional hours during period of peak business demand as deemed necessary.
 * Must be proactive, a self-starter, and be able to work with minimal supervision.
 * Must be able to accurately type 30 wpm and be knowledgeable with Microsoft Office, particularly MS Word.
 * Proficient writing skills using proper English spelling and grammar.
 * Must be able to park a company vehicle at your residence.
 * Be willing to learn and adapt to inevitable company policy and procedural changes.

Education and Licensing Requirements

 * A minimum of a Bachelor of Science in Civil/Structural Engineering or engineering related discipline (Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial, etc.)
 * Possess and maintain an active professional engineer (PE) license in the state of employment or the ability to become licensed within two months.
 * An NCEES Record is preferred.
 * Have a valid driver’s license without travel time restrictions and the ability to be insured by the company to use the company vehicles.

Travel Requirements

 * This is a home-based position.
 * Residence in the Charlotte, North Carolina metropolitan area is required. Daily reporting to an office will not be required.
 * Willing to work from home or a remote location, particularly when travelling.
 * Travel to and from the site inspections provided by the home office. Some inspections may be located in the surrounding states.
 * Extended travel times may be required for this position depending on the location of the investigation.
 * Be willing to drive long distances, if necessary, which occasionally may require longer than 8-hour days.
 * Overnight travel may be required depending on the location and number of sites to investigate in an area.
 * Up to 50% of the time may be required for regular travel in your assigned region.

Physical Requirements – Must be willing and able perform the physical tasks associated with performing forensic investigations which may include (but not be limited to):

 * Standing, walking, sitting, or driving for extended periods of time.
 * Climbing stairs, ladders, and scaffolding.
 * Walking on flat, uneven, and pitched roof slopes, some which may be over 2-stories.
 * Crawling through confined spaces (attics, crawlspaces, etc.).
 * Working outside in the heat or cold.
 * The ability to lift and move objects weighing 50 to 100 lbs.

Overtime Requirements – The position provides a competitive salary with overtime and a yearly bonus. The employee must comply with working overtime during periods of heavy workload.

Stephens is an EEO Employer.

Position Description

Structural Engineer - Joint Base Andrews, Camp Springs, MD

The base Structural Engineer is specialized in reviewing, analyzing, and monitoring design and engineering proposals for various proposed structures as submitted by contracted engineering design staff. They verify and ascertain the detailed calculations about the strength and stability of structures like bridges and buildings. Additionally, a Structural Engineer researches advanced technology regarding best practices in the field and determines the most cost-effective solution. The Structural Engineer will work alongside the other base engineering professionals to create concepts to meet client needs. A bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or related engineering fields is required for the position.

Duties

 * Work closely with the base engineering staff to ensure plans, equipment, hardware and other required resources for projects are available and working properly.
 * Define clear goals for all aspects of a project and develop steps for their proper execution.
 * Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including time and scope involved.
 * Account for possible project challenges or constraints and proactively seek to manage challenges.
 * Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team.
 * Work alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of initiatives.
 * Establish a framework for necessary contributions from various departments and facilitate their collaboration.

Requirements

 * Must be a US Citizen
 * Must be determined suitable for federal facilities access.
 * Must qualify for a military issued civilian Common Access Card (CAC) from the Department of the Air Force for base facility and Government Furnished Equipment access.
 * Must successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
 * You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.

Qualifications

 * Master's degree in Structural Engineering preferred.
 * Experience developing schematics for structures in accordance with client specifications and safety standards.
 * Project leadership skills are essential.
 * Professional work experience in developing blueprints and designs for proposed structures.
 * Extensive knowledge and experience working with various operating systems.
 * Ability to work with various departments to facilitate the orderly execution of proposed project plans.
 * Experience with software engineering, customer experience and design architecture.
 * Advanced understanding of mechanical structures, building materials, techniques and processes.
 * Up to date understanding of best practices regarding building safety measures.

Job Summary:

NHWL Engineering provides design and analysis services to pulp and paper and the associated mining and chemical industry. We deliver engineered solutions for new and modified systems within existing facilities and completely new facilities. This position involves concrete and steel design and analysis for modified and new configurations of mill building, conveyor structures, tank support structures and ground supported tanks and equipment. Client facilities are primarily located in the southeastern US which normally require consideration of high wind conditions. Some clients are also located in high seismic areas. NHWL also provides design services for mill equipment vendors with worldwide distribution.

Responsibilities and Duties:

-Analytical responsibilities include static and dynamic analysis of combinations of existing and new structural steel and concrete, NHWL uses Tekla Structures with interface to STAAD.Pro for most projects.

-Job responsibilities involve conceptual design of concrete and steel with equal consideration of code compliance, engineering fundamentals and construction costs and schedule. Design solutions are developed and tested against 3D point cloud models to ensure fit and function (Design is a shared responsibility with other disciplines).

-The civil / structural engineer is expected to use 3D visualization tools (Navisworks) for project coordination within the design office, with steel and concrete design typically performed in 3D within Tekla Structures.

-NHWL uses a delegated approach (Option 2) for connections that limits the amount of connection design performed in-house.

-Engineers interface with the client and participate in project review meetings.

Required Qualifications:

 * 5+ years relevant experience
 * Bachelor of Science/Engineering Degree
 * Although not a requirement for employment we expect the candidate to pursue professional licensure.

Mission

We have concentrated on positioning our firm to be able to effectively compete on large projects and remain competitive on small maintenance type projects. We believe our continued success as a company is being able to balance obtaining large project work and maintaining client contact and service through the implementation of smaller projects.

Culture

We strive to provide our staff with steady, loyal employment and in return offer to our clients a team of people who are experienced in industrial work and who have consistently worked together.

Benefits

- Flexible work environment

- Group health insurance – NHWL pays for the employee’s insurance (minus a nominal employee payment - $50/pay period), and other coverages are available.

- NHWL’s 401(k) plan. The plan includes a guaranteed 3% match after 1 year of employment.

- Competitive PTO

- 9 paid holidays per year

Work Remotely

 * No

Role and Responsibilities

 * Manage geotechnical field investigations: This includes scheduling field work for specific scopes of work provided by senior management, executing field work, and understanding health and safety issues associated with the work, geotechnical drilling and sampling, visual field reconnaissance, and soil and rock logging.

Additional Notes

This role is with RippleMatch's partner companies.

About RippleMatch

RippleMatch is the recruitment automation platform changing how Gen Z finds work. By replacing job boards with matching and automation, RippleMatch eliminates the most time-intensive parts of the recruitment process for both employers and job seekers. Leading employers such as eBay and Teach For America leverage RippleMatch to build diverse, high-performing teams and Gen Z job seekers across the country trust RippleMatch to launch and grow their careers.

Requirements for the role:

 * Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. A Master's degree or EIT (Engineer-in-Training) certification may be advantageous.
 * Internship or co-op experience in civil engineering or related fields is a plus.
 * Fundamental knowledge of civil engineering principles, including structural analysis, construction, and design.
 * Proficiency with industry-standard design and analysis software, such as AutoCAD, Civil 3D, or similar.
 * Understanding of relevant building codes, regulations, and compliance standards.
 * Ability to assist in the planning, design, and oversight of construction projects.
 * Basic experience in conducting site inspections and surveys to gather data for engineering projects.
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
 * Excellent organizational and project management skills, capable of managing multiple tasks and deadlines.
 * Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team.

Project CIP Engineer

We Offer…

An exciting role as a Project CIP Engineer located at our offices in Danbury, Connecticut. This function will develop and deploy cost effective, timely, high impact capital improvement projects to meet business growth, operational stability, EHS, and production quality needs. This involves a range of activities including:

You Offer…

 * Gather input and collaborate with key stakeholders from Operation, Maintenance, EHS, R&D, IT to identify capital project improvements to address operational deficiencies, meet business opportunity needs and progress in improvement manufacturing technology and quality.
 * Maintain relationships and awareness with operations, quality, EHS of ongoing operation challenges and opportunities to develop future state capital projects.
 * Develop staged project deliverables to drive early project feasibility decision making with least effort by leading activities such as scope development, HAZOP, value stream mapping, goal deliberation, process flow diagrams, staged design reviews, component and system bid specifications and scope of work, conceptual estimates, project business case presentations and project charters.
 * Execute high quality low risk projects through development of piping and instrumentation diagrams, detail component specifications, layout diagrams, instrument specifications, automated control descriptions.
 * Utilize education foundations in fluid dynamics, heat transfer, process control and unit operations as well as 3rd party expertise in mechanical, civil, structural, electrical and regulator code compliance for design development, system analysis and design comparisons.
 * Manage project costs through progressive estimate development, competitive bid analysis, coordinate with vendors and subcontractors, project cost management and timely communication with stakeholders in finance and operations.
 * Promote strong stakeholder communication and awareness by means of staged project reviews, goal deliberation, detail design reviews, business case development collaboration, project commissioning and close out planning.
 * Promote innovation in capital improvements by ongoing relationships with equipment, instrumentation, systems vendors, participation in professional development in chemical engineering, instrumentation, automation and project management and dissemination of knowledge to stakeholders.
 * Support facility process automation through training, collaboration on design of new processed and migration of existing processes into PLC (Automation Direct) or DCS (DeltaV) through development of P&ID’s, control logic, sequential function charts, interlocks, alarms and execute control configuration of logic, HMI, alarms, interlocks, recipe based controls and historization.
 * Provide engineering expertise in the manufacturing support of role by working with operations, maintenance, EHS to diagnoses operational performance issues and recommend, design and deploy solutions.
 * Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.
 * Comply with all BRI environmental, and safety policies and procedures.

You offer…

 * A Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering or related field.
 * Professional Engineering Licensure preferred.
 * Two to five years’ experience in chemical manufacturing capital project development, process engineering, and experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified
 * Use of AUTOCAD, ASPEN, proficiency in use of MS Project, Excel for design computational analysis of piping and unit operations. Experience in PLC/DCS control design and configuration.
 * Support in plan configuration upgrades or work in collaboration with 3rd party integrators.
 * Ability to navigate projects that will improve overall manufacturing environment which require commitment by operations to fund project, train operations and establish expectations with operators to support and use new systems properly.
 * Familiarity with safety system design, OSHA PSM elements and hazard analysis methods.
 * Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies in a diverse community.

We Offer… a competitive compensation and benefit package including medical, dental, Bonus program, profit sharing and 401k.

An Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace.
