About Us

VCI LLC, a Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business the provides Program, Project, Construction Management and Engineering services throughout the United States and select foreign countries. VCI’s clients include U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Veterans Affairs, National Cemetery Administration, National Park Service, National Institutes of Health, and others. We provide certified construction managers, project management professionals, professional engineers, certified cost engineers that provide our clients with the full spectrum of services.

VCI is currently providing Construction Management services to the Veterans Affairs and US Army Corps of Engineers in Puerto Rico.

Project

The Veterans Affairs Caribbean Health Care System in San Juan Puerto Rico will build a New Parking Structure (Phase 5) be located north of and connected to the earlier Phase 4 Parking Structure located west of the VAMC loading dock and shall accommodate a minimum of 776 vehicles within the structure (Phase 5). The proposed structure shall consist of augured concrete piles, cast-in place post-tensioned concrete beams and slabs, cast-in-place concrete columns and shear walls, and seven (7) PT parking decks.

Purpose

VCI is seeking a qualified On-site full time Civil/Structural Engineer to assist the VA in managing the construction contract.

Duties

The Construction Manager Civil/Structural Senior Engineer shall be required to perform services including, but not limited to, the following (in no order).

Individual professionals shall focus on their areas of assignment or expertise:

 * The work requires regular and recurring field and construction inspection, investigation, and surveys in which there is a considerable amount of walking, stooping, bending, and climbing. Such activity will potentially result in exposure to adverse weather and construction hazards.
 * The candidate shall perform inspections of site work, and building construction work; document discrepancies, code violations, improper materials or techniques in the application of materials, substandard or poor-quality workmanship; monitor schedules on various aspects of ongoing daily construction activities to identify and mitigate project deficiencies, slippage and potential safety concerns.
 * The candidate shall review the contractor's Submittals and RFIs and provide appropriate technical action to the SRE; identify progress delays and recommend appropriate corrective measures to the SRE toward mitigating delays and maintaining the progress schedule.
 * The candidate shall ensure that installed work is consistent with the contract requirements in order to make recommendations to the SRE for final approval of installed work. Evaluate the testing/inspection reports submitted by the Contractor and provide approval/disapproval recommendations to the SRE.
 * Maintains an inventory of materials, supplies, and equipment and monitors the quantity of materials used in the contract administration and conduct of the project.
 * Assist in the documentation, administration, and preparation of construction contract changes (issues proposal requests, preparing cost estimates, reviewing cost proposals, assisting VA in negotiations, preparing change order packages for the Contracting Officer and/or the VA Resident Engineer).
 * Maintaining list(s) of observed defects and omissions. Prepare inspection punch lists and coordinate resolutions and correction of outstanding deficiencies/omissions and errors
 * Available to work different shifts and weekends, as coordinated with the SRE and construction activity.
 * Reviewing contractor requests for payment for accuracy including the initial cost loading and then submitting a written recommendation to the SRE for final approval authority on the payment.
 * Maintaining accurate and complete files relating to the CM services on the project that the Government may inspect at any time.

Education/ Certification/Qualification

 * Candidate must have a degree in Engineering, Architecture, or Construction Management with at least five years of experience in the Construction Industry (preferably in Parking Structure and/or Federal government Major Construction of buildings or cemeteries.
 * Knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulations, commercial practices, and construction standards.
 * Candidate must be fluent in Spanish and English.
 * Current Professional Engineering/Architect license registration and maintenance of same throughout tenure.
 * Unbonded Post-tensioned level 2 PTI certification will be a plus for the Civil/Structural Candidate.
 * Knowledge of local and federal environmental permitting will be required for the Architect CM.

Required Training

Candidate must meet the following training criteria:

(a) Completion of 10-hour OSHA Safety Training Class.

(b) Completion of VA Cyber Security Awareness Training.

(c) Completion of VA Privacy Awareness.

(d) Attend IT Training for Operation of VA Administration Software (KAHUA)

We are growing!!

Would you like to work for a growing company where your efforts are acknowledged, you make a difference, and have upward mobility in the company? Then Stephens may be a great match for you! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. continues our expansion to become a national forensic engineering company! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. (STEPHENS) is a respected company that specializes in forensic engineering. Stephens is a growing company with our corporate office located outside of Houston, Texas. Our experienced engineers provide a wide range of expertise to our clients.

Job Description

We are searching for a full-time Forensic Engineer, PE (Civil/Structural) based in the Charlotte, North Carolina metropolitan area. The candidate may also service STEPHENS's clients in other states, particularly in the surrounding states.

Benefits of a career in Forensic Engineering

 * Not being confined to an office all day.
 * Getting out and seeing new things.
 * Regularly meeting new people.
 * No daily commute.
 * Problem solving and providing expert opinions.
 * More time with family.

Job Responsibilities

 * Prior forensic engineering experience is not required as STEPHENS provides on-the-job training.
 * Perform forensic (investigative) evaluations residential, commercial, and industrial buildings for including (but may not be limited to) storm related damage to roofing and exterior claddings, moisture intrusion, impact damage (tree, vehicle, etc.), foundation settlement, construction defects, etc.
 * Prepare precise and unbiased written reports of findings for your site investigations based on field inspections and research consistent with the company’s standards and guidelines.
 * Prior report writing skills are a plus.
 * Consistently and effectively communicate with clients, the engineering team, and the home office on daily work.
 * Must be customer service and team oriented, with professional and timely communication with company clients for assigned projects.
 * Must be flexible with scheduling, daily work, and quality control.
 * Consistently meet all of the required company expectations and deadlines, particularly during times of heavy workload.
 * Provide depositions and expert testimony, if necessary, on assigned work.
 * Additional duties assignment by management.
 * Must be willing to work additional hours during period of peak business demand as deemed necessary.
 * Must be proactive, a self-starter, and be able to work with minimal supervision.
 * Must be able to accurately type 30 wpm and be knowledgeable with Microsoft Office, particularly MS Word.
 * Proficient writing skills using proper English spelling and grammar.
 * Must be able to park a company vehicle at your residence.
 * Be willing to learn and adapt to inevitable company policy and procedural changes.

Education and Licensing Requirements

 * A minimum of a Bachelor of Science in Civil/Structural Engineering or engineering related discipline (Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial, etc.)
 * Possess and maintain an active professional engineer (PE) license in the state of employment or the ability to become licensed within two months.
 * An NCEES Record is preferred.
 * Have a valid driver’s license without travel time restrictions and the ability to be insured by the company to use the company vehicles.

Travel Requirements

 * This is a home-based position.
 * Residence in the Charlotte, North Carolina metropolitan area is required. Daily reporting to an office will not be required.
 * Willing to work from home or a remote location, particularly when travelling.
 * Travel to and from the site inspections provided by the home office. Some inspections may be located in the surrounding states.
 * Extended travel times may be required for this position depending on the location of the investigation.
 * Be willing to drive long distances, if necessary, which occasionally may require longer than 8-hour days.
 * Overnight travel may be required depending on the location and number of sites to investigate in an area.
 * Up to 50% of the time may be required for regular travel in your assigned region.

Physical Requirements – Must be willing and able perform the physical tasks associated with performing forensic investigations which may include (but not be limited to):

 * Standing, walking, sitting, or driving for extended periods of time.
 * Climbing stairs, ladders, and scaffolding.
 * Walking on flat, uneven, and pitched roof slopes, some which may be over 2-stories.
 * Crawling through confined spaces (attics, crawlspaces, etc.).
 * Working outside in the heat or cold.
 * The ability to lift and move objects weighing 50 to 100 lbs.

Overtime Requirements – The position provides a competitive salary with overtime and a yearly bonus. The employee must comply with working overtime during periods of heavy workload.

Stephens is an EEO Employer.

Job Description

As a member of our team, you will develop solutions for water authorities, municipalities, districts, and private clients addressing civil infrastructure, municipal and industrial water/wastewater treatment needs. Work sectors may include water and wastewater systems and treatment, preliminary engineering studies, and infrastructure improvements.

The right person for the job should be capable of efficient time management, should have active listening capabilities, be willing to be trained in unique office operations, and should possess a problem-solving attitude. Sound decision making, taking initiative and taking responsibility of projects will be a plus. Excellent verbal/written communication skills, “basic” Civil3D knowledge or experience, and “basic” AutoCAD knowledge or experience related to public works design regulations would also be a plus.

Responsibilities

 * Prepare proposals, budgets and client agreements
 * Lead and oversee design and technical aspects of the team(s) projects including detailed engineering design and calculations, report writing, permitting and presentations to clients
 * Develop and maintain professional relationships with clients, public agency officials and community leaders
 * Coordinate and monitor project tasks, budgets and schedules
 * Prepare creation reports and bond applications for municipal utility districts
 * Attend monthly board meetings for municipalities or water districts.
 * Ensuring project documents are complete, current and stored/filed appropriately.
 * Reporting project hours and expenses on a weekly basis
 * Having flexibility in managing job tasks as deadlines and project priorities change
 * Understanding how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully, both written and oral
 * Having the ability to manage multiple tasks on multiple projects.

Qualifications

 * B.S in Civil Engineering from an A.B.E.T Accredited School. B.S. in Environmental Engineering also considered.
 * Professional Engineer (P.E.) designation in the State of Texas (or currently transferring their license to Texas)

job_description:
Tectonic is actively seeking full-time Office Engineers to work on upcoming projects in the Hudson Valley and Catskill areas, including Ulster County, Orange County, Rockland County, Dutchess County, Putnam County, Westchester County, Sullivan County, and Delaware County. These positions offer a competitive salary and benefits package, and opportunities to work on challenging and exciting projects.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Essential functions of the Office Engineer position include the review of inspector’s daily reports for accuracy, the preparation and maintenance of monthly estimate and material certification books using CEES or other applicable software, the preparation of change orders as needed, monitoring of the budget and schedule, submittal tracking, maintenance of project files and documentation, and the preparation of meeting minutes and job-related correspondence. The Office Engineer will work under the Resident Engineer’s guidance and ensure successful execution, completion, and close-out of the project, as well as perform all other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

 * Must possess a HS Diploma/Equivalent, and must possess and maintain at least one of the following:
 * Valid NICET Level III or IV Certification;
 * Valid Professional Engineering License;
 * BS Degree in Civil Engineering or an acceptable field;

 * A minimum of 3 years of related experience; NYSDOT experience required;
 * Ability to review Inspector’s Daily Reports for accuracy of various work elements on projects involving highways and bridges;
 * Familiarity with the Manual for Uniform Recordkeeping (MURK) and Site Manager, and Computerized Engineers Estimate System (CEES and APPIA); must also have NYSDOT recordkeeping experience;
 * Excellent organization, interpersonal, and oral and written communication skills;
 * Must be detail oriented and have the ability to multi-task;
 * Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, and ability to learn project specific software as needed;
 * Requires a valid, clean driver’s license and personal vehicle to travel to and within project sites as needed.

COMPETITIVE SALARY AND BENEFITS PACKAGE

In addition to providing competitive salaries, Tectonic offers a wide range of benefit options, including:

 * Comprehensive group medical insurance, including health, dental, vision and life
 * Opportunities for professional growth and advancement
 * Tuition reimbursement
 * Paid time off, including vacation, sick and personal
 * Company–observed paid holidays
 * Short and long-term disability coverage
 * Flexible spending accounts for medical expenses and dependent care
 * Commuter benefit plan for public transportation costs
 * 401K retirement and profit-sharing plan.

PAY RANGE

Tectonic’s goal is to compensate employees fairly and equitably across all positions Companywide. Our advertised pay ranges are representative of our good faith effort to provide a reasonable anticipated salary range. The offered pay may be outside of the provided salary range based upon the selected candidate’s work location, experience, education, certifications, and capabilities compared to the advertised position.

Pay Range: $35.00 - $80.00 / hour

We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, and highly encourage resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected class. Tectonic participates in the USCIS E-Verify Program to verify that all new hires are authorized to work in the United States.

Job Summary:

NHWL Engineering provides design and analysis services to pulp and paper and the associated mining and chemical industry. We deliver engineered solutions for new and modified systems within existing facilities and completely new facilities. This position involves concrete and steel design and analysis for modified and new configurations of mill building, conveyor structures, tank support structures and ground supported tanks and equipment. Client facilities are primarily located in the southeastern US which normally require consideration of high wind conditions. Some clients are also located in high seismic areas. NHWL also provides design services for mill equipment vendors with worldwide distribution.

Responsibilities and Duties:

-Analytical responsibilities include static and dynamic analysis of combinations of existing and new structural steel and concrete, NHWL uses Tekla Structures with interface to STAAD.Pro for most projects.

-Job responsibilities involve conceptual design of concrete and steel with equal consideration of code compliance, engineering fundamentals and construction costs and schedule. Design solutions are developed and tested against 3D point cloud models to ensure fit and function (Design is a shared responsibility with other disciplines).

-The civil / structural engineer is expected to use 3D visualization tools (Navisworks) for project coordination within the design office, with steel and concrete design typically performed in 3D within Tekla Structures.

-NHWL uses a delegated approach (Option 2) for connections that limits the amount of connection design performed in-house.

-Engineers interface with the client and participate in project review meetings.

Required Qualifications:

 * 5+ years relevant experience
 * Bachelor of Science/Engineering Degree
 * Although not a requirement for employment we expect the candidate to pursue professional licensure.

Mission

We have concentrated on positioning our firm to be able to effectively compete on large projects and remain competitive on small maintenance type projects. We believe our continued success as a company is being able to balance obtaining large project work and maintaining client contact and service through the implementation of smaller projects.

Culture

We strive to provide our staff with steady, loyal employment and in return offer to our clients a team of people who are experienced in industrial work and who have consistently worked together.

Benefits

- Flexible work environment

- Group health insurance – NHWL pays for the employee’s insurance (minus a nominal employee payment - $50/pay period), and other coverages are available.

- NHWL’s 401(k) plan. The plan includes a guaranteed 3% match after 1 year of employment.

- Competitive PTO

- 9 paid holidays per year

Work Remotely

 * No

job_description:
Childs Engineering provides professional engineering services to private, state, and federal clients related to the design and rehabilitation of piers, docks, marinas, dry docks, seawalls, ferry terminals, public boat landings, bridges and any other structure that can be found on the waterfront.

We have a very team focused atmosphere with our Engineers traveling thought out the USA and internationally providing support to our valued clients wherever they need us. We are a small, close knit company that values our employees work-life balance and creates a relaxed and fun work environment.

Typical Duties and Responsibilities

 * The role will involve working on a mix of projects located on the waterfront including Piers, Wharves, Bridges, and Marine Terminals, under the guidance of a Project Manager.
 * The work will involve a blend of field and office engineering work with travel within the United States and overseas.
 * The field work will include above and underwater inspection, destructive and non-destructive testing, topographic and hydrographic surveying, and construction oversight.
 * The office work will include structural analysis and design, preparation of drawings and specifications, quantity and cost estimating, and report writing.

Minimum Requirements

 * B.S. degree or higher in Civil, Structural, or Ocean Engineering.
 * 2-8 years of waterfront engineering and inspection experience.
 * EIT or PE registration.
 * Commercial diving certification (ADCI or equivalent) or a willingness to take training.
 * Familiarity with AutoCAD.
 * Ability to work and communicate effectively as part of a team.
 * Ability and willingness to travel, including overnight, as required.
 * Valid driver’s license

Preferred Qualifications

 * Familiarity with structural analysis software such as STAAD.
 * Experience with topographic or hydrographic surveys.
 * NHI Bridge Inspector Course.
 * US Citizen.

Location

 * The position is located out of our Bellingham, MA.
 * All field staff will ideally be located within driving distance of the office location.

Benefits

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including health, short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, and 401(k) and employer matching. Additional benefits include 10 paid holidays, 10-20 paid time off days (depending on experience), and many more. Our work environment is dynamic, has flexible schedules, with a variety of diverse projects for a broad range of experience.

Childs Engineering is committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to age, race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy), physical or developmental disability, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Are you an experienced site civil engineer drawn working on complex projects? Consider an essential role as a Lead Engineer with The Kleingers Group. Our Louisville Development Group is looking for a Lead Engineer who can take professional responsibility for the outcome of design plans, setting the design strategy, leading others in the implementation of the design, and with final stamping and sealing of construction drawings. Our Development Group features engineers who bring years of experience working on the side of the developer/owner equation. The team applies this extensive knowledge and understanding of the latest retail development trends, market conditions, governmental regulations, and land development issues to every project. The Development Group enhances communities with civil & transportation engineering, and landscape architecture for neighborhood and regional shopping centers, hospitals, and individual retail buildings. We bring a creative perspective that develops a project’s identity and creates an appealing shopping environment.
The Lead Civil Engineer will provide technical leadership to project teams who will be working on planning, evaluation, design and implementation of civil engineering projects. The successful candidate will lead the study-phase and/or design-phase of projects related to the civil, environmental, construction and industrial fields. The Lead Civil Engineer would regularly have interaction with employees outside of their department, regularly have interaction with clients, regularly interact with the public (agencies, government entities, etc.), and occasionally participate in selling to clients. The lead civil engineer is expected to manage assigned employees, while being an example of professional presence, representing the Company and the department in a positive light, and have expert level of software knowledge of at least two (2) engineering software packages. A Professional Engineering license is required for this role.

*
Duties & Responsibilities*

 * Consults with and provides guidance to project stakeholders and managerial staff regarding engineering requirements for construction of various designs, and modifications.
 * Uses design software and drawing tools to accurately render and communicate designs; plans and designs other necessary improvement related to type of project assigned.
 * Sets design specifications by computing appropriate engineering requirements (i.e. – water flow rates, traffic demand, earth work balance, etc.).
 * Plans projects based on the analysis of relevant materials such as drawings, blueprints, aerial photography, survey reports, maps, and other geologic and topographical data.
 * Drafts and presents reports on topics related to projects such as detention reports and engineering due diligence reports.
 * Perform calculations for materials, equipment, and labor needed to determine probable construction cost.
 * Collaborates with architects, contractors, and other engineers to ensure projects progress properly.
 * Collaborates with surveyors (or directs and participates in surveying) to establish installations or reference points, grades, elevations, and other factors that will affect construction.
 * Monitors project progress and ensures design specifications and standards are met.
 * Able and willing to review other projects for QA/QC and stamp projects as appropriate.
 * Able to complete complex assigned projects independently as assigned with minimal oversight beyond initial handoff.
 * Able to teach and explain to others the methodologies used by The Company.
 * Advanced level of understanding of design tools and civil engineering practices. Capable other teaching others as necessary.
 * Complex design of projects.
 * Develop, mentor, train, evaluate, coach/discipline, acknowledge, and thank assigned staff.
 * Helping refine the methodologies being used for design.

*
Qualifications, Education, & Experience*

 * Civil Engineering Degree (or related)
 * Minimum 15 consecutive years of Civil Engineering experience
 * Public speaking ability, desired
 * Routinely serves as technical expert for complex projects, for which they have prior experience and execute independently. And reflect The Company in a positive light to public and private entities.
 * Assign Co-Ops, Graduate Civil Engineers, and Associate Civil Engineers projects/pieces of projects aligned with their abilities.
 * Proactively implementing regulatory requirement based on knowledge of state and local regulations

*
Required Skills/Abilities*

 * Basic understanding of civil engineering principles, practices, and tools.
 * Proficient in computer-assisted design (CAD) and other design, data recording, and analyzation software.
 * Basic understanding of materials, methods, and tools involved in the construction or repair of site and transportation infrastructure improvements.
 * Ability to identify and solve complex problems.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 * Ability to be both creative and analytical.
 * Extremely detail-oriented and accurate.

*
Physical Requirements*

 * Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
 * Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
 * Must be able to travel to various project sites.
 * Must be able to access and navigate job sites and construction areas.

The Kleingers Group provides design solutions for a wide range of public, private, institutional, and corporate clients. We focus on providing site civil engineering, athletic field design, transportation engineering, land surveying, landscape architecture and community planning services. With offices located in Cincinnati, Columbus, Louisville, Akron, and Tampa, we are able provide our clients with the personal attention and service that has become our trademark.

Job Title: Structural Engineer

Company: New Horizons Telecom, Inc.

About Us

Headquartered in Palmer, Alaska, New Horizons is a telecommunications infrastructure company providing turnkey solutions to clients across all major commercial sectors and industries.

Why Join Our Team?

New Horizons offers a dynamic and rewarding work environment with opportunities for career advancement and growth. Apply now to become a part of New Horizons’ dedicated team, driving innovation in the telecommunications industry.

Job Summary

New Horizons is seeking a highly motivated, qualified individual to join our team as a licensed and experienced structural engineer. The structural engineer will provide complete designs, develop construction documents and support structural projects. Projects typically include but are not limited to tower and shelter foundation design, equipment anchoring, platform and shelter design, site plan development, utility coordination, fiber route design and rigging plans. This position also requires day-to-day collaboration with a multi-disciplinary team of varying experience levels and the ability to mentor and train where appropriate.

Key Responsibilities

· Develop complete structural designs and construction documents from project initiation to project completion.

· Conduct site visits and assessments as necessary.

· Develop various written documents as required by customers such as feasibility studies, structural analysis reports with supporting calculations and site visit assessment reports.

· Collaborate on designs and drawings with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, subcontractors, project managers and construction managers.

· Maintain effective working relationships with diverse groups, including company employees at various levels, clients, vendors, government regulators and other outside companies and individuals.

· Make educated decisions on engineering ethics, costs, procedures and standards that adhere to all required regulations and codes.

· Effectively communicate with AutoCAD technicians to produce drawings.

· Mentor junior engineers.

Minimum Requirements

· Licensed by the State of Alaska as a Professional Structural Engineer (SE).

· 2+ years of design experience after SE licensure.

· Familiar with AutoCAD drafting procedures.

· Experienced with standard construction practices and national building code and design standards including but not limited to OSHA, IBC, ASCE 7, NDS, and ACI 318.

 * Experience with TIA 222 is preferred.

· Foundation design experience in permafrost, rock and conventional soils using piles, rock anchors and concrete pads is preferred.

 * Design experience using steel, aluminum, wood and concrete materials.

· Proficient with standard office software (MS Excel, MS Word, Teams and Outlook).

· Experience with Bluebeam, AutoCAD, Mathcad, Enercalc, Hilti or Simpson Anchor Design Software and RISA3D is preferred.

· Highly articulate and able to deliver verbal and written reports.

· Must possess a valid driver’s license.

· Available and able to travel for site visits (up to 15% of the time).

Benefits

· Excellent medical, dental, vision and prescription drug plan.

· Retirement (Pension & 401K).

· Competitive compensation, paid vacation & holidays.

· Challenging and rewarding work environment with career development opportunities.

Salary

· Base salary starting at $135,000.00 per year (pay is dependent on experience)

How to Apply

Please email a resume to humanresources@nhtiusa.com.

New Horizons is an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applications will be reviewed as they are received, and the position will be filled as soon as we have a satisfactory candidate pool.

Global Water Resources, Inc. Global Water is an elite team of professionals that continues to transform its fast-growing utilities into highly automated and most efficient water resource management systems. Global Water owns and operates water and wastewater utilities in the state of Arizona serving more than 80,000 people. Global Water is a private utility, traded on the NASDAQ, that is at the forefront of Total Water Management, and is paving the way for the future of efficient utility operations, sustainability, and conservation. Global Water welcomes and encourages experienced professionals from all industries, especially those with strong science, engineering, and technical backgrounds.

The company’s service areas are located primarily in growth corridors around metropolitan Phoenix. Global Water recycles over 1 billion gallons of water annually.

BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE JOB

Licensed Engineer with a strong background in civil design with an emphasis on water and wastewater infrastructure. The ideal candidate should possess strong communication skills, be highly organized, a good problem solver, efficient, have a good attention to detail and be a team player. The role of the position will focus on planning, design and construction management of water and wastewater infrastructure. This position is based out of Maricopa, AZ.

Duties/Responsibilities:

 * Lead multidisciplinary technical consulting engineering teams executing the planning, design and construction management of water and wastewater projects.
 * Manage multiple projects, schedules, and budgets.
 * Deliver complete design and project bid packages.
 * Prepare internal layout and preliminary planning and design of systems.
 * Review and critique reports, plans, and specifications
 * Prepare internal cost estimates for budgeting.
 * Review and critique consultant scopes of work and invoices as well as manage consultant communications.
 * Assesses infrastructure needs based on current demands and projected future growth.
 * Conduct cost-benefit analyses and value engineering for projects.
 * Effectively communicate with construction management department and contractors utilizing different construction delivery methods
 * Effectively communicate with governmental agencies for permitting and approval of various systems
 * Ensure infrastructure complies with applicable local, state, and federal guidelines and codes.
 * Provide operations with support and subject matter expertise on operational issues.
 * Maintains knowledge and subject matter expertise on latest technologies.

Required Skills/Abilities:

 * Experience with wells and water treatment, distribution, and storage systems
 * Experience with wastewater treatment, collection, and pumping systems
 * Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 * Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software, computer-aided Design (CAD) software, and other relevant analytical, scientific, or monitoring software.
 * Strong leadership, people, and communication skills
 * Knowledge of current Arizona water and wastewater regulations and the ability to effectively communicate with multiple agencies.

Education and Experience:

 * Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering required.
 * Licensed as a Professional Engineer in the State of Arizona required.
 * At least 10 years of related water and wastewater experience
 * Prefer prior consulting engineering design experience of municipal water and wastewater projects.
 * Prefer prior construction management and field experience.

Minimum Requirements

Education or Experience: Bachelor’s degree in relevant field or equivalent education and experience in management, communications, in a highly technical, regulated, and fast-paced environment. Advanced degrees and certifications a plus. At least ten years’ experience working in a rate regulated utility or a municipal utility, or similar setting.

Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including drafting reports and presentations and public speaking.

Social Skills: Must act in a respectful, knowledgeable, and professional manner. Work requires regular interaction involving exchange and receipt of complex information; adjusting actions in relation to others’ actions; trying to reconcile differences; actively looking for ways to help people and Global Water be successful. Will interact with employees at all levels and represent Global Water externally.

Physical Demands: Must be able to perform the following on a regular basis: Sitting for extended periods; prolonged periods of time with repetitive motions of hands and fingers; close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to thirty pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Core Values: Applicant must understand, identify with, and adhere to the Global Water Core Values:

1. Believe in the Mission and Each Other

2. Be Disciplined: People, Thought, and Action

3. Take Ownership

4. Maintain a Positive Mindset

Salary: Salary commensurate with experience

General: Must have satisfactory outcome of drug testing, criminal record checks, motor vehicle record, and employment records prior to starting employment.

Licenses: Must have a valid Arizona driver’s license.

Welcome to Donan Engineering, a leader in the property insurance intelligence industry. We are currently seeking a full-time professional Structural Engineer to join our growing team in Sacramento, California.

 * Required to have a valid driver’s license, with an acceptable driving record.

 * Frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel.

JOB SUMMARY
CSG Consultants Inc. (CSG), an established and thriving employee-owned civil engineering and municipal services consulting firm, is currently looking for an experienced Senior Engineer (Roadway Design) to join our Engineering Design team. This is a full-time, hybrid role and can be based out of our Foster City, CA, Sacramento, CA or Central Valley, CA locations.

The Senior Engineer is responsible for the planning, management, supervision, and coordination of professional engineering work related to the planning, design, construction, and maintenance of various public works projects. The Senior Engineer manages multiple public works projects simultaneously, supervises project staff, activities and tasks, coordinates project development and progress with clients, and provides technical support for internal and external stakeholders.

*
RESPONSIBILITIES*

 * Develop and supervise teams of engineers for the preparation of plans, specifications and estimates for the construction of public works projects.
 * Direct engineering staff to perform complex engineering work for public works projects, ensuring technical competence and compliance with governing regulations.
 * Monitor project budget and schedule to ensure timely project delivery.
 * Coordinate project activities with all stakeholders including but not limited to the project team, field personnel, agency staff, utility companies, other consultants, and contractors.
 * Work closely with the clients and project teams.
 * Perform other related duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

 * 6+ years of progressive engineering experience.
 * Current California PE License is required. Specialty certifications are highly desired.
 * Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from an accredited college or university.
 * Experience with and ability to mentor junior design staff.
 * Proven track record for successfully completing roadway engineering projects – e.g., pavement rehabilitation, complete streets, bicycle/pedestrian facilities, intersection, Safe Routes to Schools, drainage, and utility design.
 * Proficient in AutoCAD and Civil 3D.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 * Possession and maintenance of a valid Class “C” California driver’s license is required.

WORKING CONDITIONS

 * Driving occasionally to job sites.
 * Sitting / standing for extended periods of time.
 * Occasionally requires working in sitting position with computer for extended periods.
 * Working with detailed, finely printed documents.
 * Capacity to work in a fast-paced environment with deadlines and multiple projects.

PAY AND BENEFITS
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and development resources you need to advance your career. When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a 300+ network of experts: community planners, environmental specialists, civil and structural engineers, building and safety experts, fire prevention and construction managers – leading the change to a more sustainable and equitable future.
The compensation for this position is $120,000 to $165,000 annually.
Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location.

_
We only consider candidates living locally or within the State of CA. We do not pay any relocation expenses._

*
BENEFITS OFFERED*
CSG’s comprehensive benefits package includes 401(k) plus company match, Employee Stock Ownership Program (Eligibility requirements must be met to qualify), 12 paid holidays, 3 weeks of paid time off (PTO), medical, dental, vision, FSA, EAP, Life/AD&D, LTD, voluntary life insurance, casual work environment and professional development program.
ABOUT US
CSG Consultants is an established and thriving, employee-owned municipal services consulting firm headquartered in Foster City, California with offices throughout California. Since 1991, CSG has exclusively served public agencies, providing a wide range of municipal services—from planning to community preservation. A trusted leader in the industry, CSG focuses on building long-term relationships with our client communities and stands by its commitment to the time-honored values of quality of service, integrity, and responsiveness.
Work Environment: We strive to offer the flexibility you need to do your best work. Whether you are working from a CSG office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment, where your integrity, enterprising spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, using your unique talents, backgrounds, and experience to create positive outcomes for our clients.
Career Growth: We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization, you can make a lasting impact on projects you work on, the teams and committees you join as a part of our business practices.

_

PROFILE OF COMPANY:

Gray & Osborne has provided professional engineering services to public agencies throughout Washington State since 1935. We specialize in the planning, design, and construction management of water, wastewater, transportation, and utility systems. We have a talented and motivated staff that is well respected in the municipal civil engineering community.

We have openings in both our Wenatchee office located at 11 Spokane Street and in our Yakima office located at 180 Iron Horse Court. Eastern Washington has an ideal climate, warm in the summer with mild winters and almost 200 days of sunshine each year. The area has many opportunities for outdoor recreation including biking, hiking, fishing, hunting climbing, camping, skiing, and golfing.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Primary responsibilities are project engineering and/or project management for water, wastewater, and utility projects for municipalities and special purpose districts in Eastern Washington. Work would include the preparation of engineering reports, preparation of plans, specifications, and estimates, and construction administration for public works projects.

This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys working in a creative and collaborative environment where you are can be part of a design team in providing service to communities throughout Eastern Washington.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ABILITIES:

 * 4-year Civil Engineering degree.
 * P.E. License.
 * At least 5 years of experience in Civil Engineering design – preferably in municipal water, wastewater, or utility systems.
 * Excellent interpersonal skills.
 * Able to work well with others in a collaborative manner.
 * Ability to prioritize and simultaneously manage multiple projects.

We offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits.

Job Description -

Altus Engineering is a civil engineering firm located in downtown Portsmouth specializing in both private development and municipal projects. We have a long history in the Seacoast area and have successfully delivered thousands of projects to a diverse client base. Our professional staff and principals take a hands-on approach through all aspects of a project, including planning, design, permitting, and construction. Our land development projects include a variety of residential, commercial, industrial and institutional sites, mixed-use and multi-family buildings, roadways, single family lots, environmental restoration and municipal and waterfront infrastructure. We are seeking an experienced civil engineer to join our team.

Responsibilities -

The successful candidate will be responsible for civil engineering design to include site and subdivision layout, roadway and parking lot design, site grading and drainage, stormwater treatment and modeling, utility design and implementation of erosion and sediment control practices. The candidate shall have experience in preparing engineering design plans, project specifications and cost estimates, and shall have experience performing engineering calculations for storm drainage, sanitary sewer, parking and traffic. Candidate shall possess strong written and oral presentation skills and have experience presenting to clients and regulatory boards. Knowledge of local, state and federal land development regulations, environmental permit application processes and supporting documentation is required. Experience with construction administration and construction site monitoring is preferred but not mandatory.

Qualifications -

Minimum of five years engineering experience in land development preferred.

Degree in Civil Engineering preferred but not required.

EIT or PE preferred but not required.

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.

Proficiency with AutoCAD, HydroCAD, AutoTURN and other engineering software.

Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Strong work ethic and attention to detail.

Team player but able to work independently and be self-motivated.

Pay and Benefits -

Altus offers a competitive experience-based salary and excellent benefit package, including retirement plan with company match, health insurance, health savings account, flexible paid vacation/sick/holiday time, professional development assistance, flexible work hours and a relaxed downtown office environment.

Only U.S.-based candidates with valid work credentials will be considered for this role.

Would you like to work for a growing company where your efforts are acknowledged, you make a difference, and have upward mobility in the company? Then Stephens may be a great match for you! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. continues our expansion to become a national forensic engineering company! Stephens Engineering Consultants, Inc. (STEPHENS) is a respected company that specializes in forensic engineering. Stephens is a growing company with our corporate office located outside of Houston, Texas. Our experienced engineers provide a wide range of expertise to our clients.

Job Description

We are searching for a full-time Forensic Engineer, PE (Civil/Structural) based in the Piedmont Triad (Greensboro–Winston-Salem–High Point), North Carolina metropolitan areas. The candidate may also service STEPHENS's clients in other states, particularly in the surrounding states.

Benefits of a career in Forensic Engineering

 * Not being confined to an office all day.
 * Getting out and seeing new things.
 * Regularly meeting new people.
 * No daily commute.
 * Problem solving and providing expert opinions.
 * More time with family.

Job Responsibilities

 * Prior forensic engineering experience is not required as STEPHENS provides on-the-job training.
 * Perform forensic (investigative) evaluations residential, commercial, and industrial buildings for including (but may not be limited to) storm related damage to roofing and exterior claddings, moisture intrusion, impact damage (tree, vehicle, etc.), foundation settlement, construction defects, etc.
 * Prepare precise and unbiased written reports of findings for your site investigations based on field inspections and research consistent with the company’s standards and guidelines.
 * Prior report writing skills are a plus.
 * Consistently and effectively communicate with clients, the engineering team, and the home office on daily work.
 * Must be customer service and team oriented, with professional and timely communication with company clients for assigned projects.
 * Must be flexible with scheduling, daily work, and quality control.
 * Consistently meet all of the required company expectations and deadlines, particularly during times of heavy workload.
 * Provide depositions and expert testimony, if necessary, on assigned work.
 * Additional duties assignment by management.
 * Must be willing to work additional hours during period of peak business demand as deemed necessary.
 * Must be proactive, a self-starter, and be able to work with minimal supervision.
 * Must be able to accurately type 30 wpm and be knowledgeable with Microsoft Office, particularly MS Word.
 * Proficient writing skills using proper English spelling and grammar.
 * Must be able to park a company vehicle at your residence.
 * Be willing to learn and adapt to inevitable company policy and procedural changes.

Education and Licensing Requirements

 * A minimum of a Bachelor of Science in Civil/Structural Engineering or engineering related discipline (Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial, etc.)
 * Possess and maintain an active professional engineer (PE) license in the state of employment or the ability to become licensed within two months.
 * An NCEES Record is preferred.
 * Have a valid driver’s license without travel time restrictions and the ability to be insured by the company to use the company vehicles.

Travel Requirements

 * This is a home-based position.
 * Residence in the Piedmont Triad (Greensboro–Winston-Salem–High Point), North Carolina metropolitan areas is required. Daily reporting to an office will not be required.
 * Willing to work from home or a remote location, particularly when travelling.
 * Travel to and from the site inspections provided by the home office. Some inspections may be located in the surrounding states.
 * Extended travel times may be required for this position depending on the location of the investigation.
 * Be willing to drive long distances, if necessary, which occasionally may require longer than 8-hour days.
 * Overnight travel may be required depending on the location and number of sites to investigate in an area.
 * Up to 50% of the time may be required for regular travel in your assigned region.

Physical Requirements – Must be willing and able perform the physical tasks associated with performing forensic investigations which may include (but not be limited to):

 * Standing, walking, sitting, or driving for extended periods of time.
 * Climbing stairs, ladders, and scaffolding.
 * Walking on flat, uneven, and pitched roof slopes, some which may be over 2-stories.
 * Crawling through confined spaces (attics, crawlspaces, etc.).
 * Working outside in the heat or cold.
 * The ability to lift and move objects weighing 50 to 100 lbs.

Overtime Requirements – The position provides a competitive salary with overtime and a yearly bonus. The employee must comply with working overtime during periods of heavy workload.

Stephens is an EEO Employer.

ElevenTen Systems LLC manufactures load-bearing cold formed steel wall panels for midrise structures, apartment buildings, hotels, commercial buildings and single-family residences. We also construct curtain wall panels for high rise buildings and other buildings.

We are seeking a full-time structural engineer to be part of the growing ElevenTen design team. The responsibilities of the engineer would include design of cold formed steel structures, including, wall panel design, composite slab design, cold-formed & hot rolled steel column design, joist design and other ancillary structural design. Familiarity with wind and seismic lateral design is necessary. The candidate will also help develop BIM models and shop drawings.

The candidate would be required to have a Professional Engineering license, or equivalent, and have substantial experience designing mid-rise and commercial structures. The candidate will be required to meet with and coordinate the structural design with project architects, project EOR, general contractor/ construction manager, building official, and the special inspector. Site visits and travel will be required but is not anticipated to be extensive. While not expected to be the primary task of the candidate, knowledge of wood design principles and concrete / foundation design principles is a plus.

The candidate needs to be familiar with AISI, IBC, ASCE 7, AISC and ACI standards. The candidate should also be proficient using RISA products, and cold-formed steel design software (i.e. Steel Smart System, Simpson CFS Designer, RSG CFS). Knowledge of Microsoft Office products is necessary, particularly Excel, since it is used frequently in our structural calculation procedures. Proficiency in Autodesk Revit is a bonus.

Benefits package includes: health care, paid time off, paid holidays, and sabbatical. ElevenTen pays for all the employee’s health care premiums and 50% of any dependents.

Childs Engineering provides professional engineering services to private, state, and federal clients related to the design and rehabilitation of piers, docks, marinas, dry docks, seawalls, ferry terminals, public boat landings, bridges and any other structure that can be found on the waterfront.

We have a very team focused atmosphere with our Engineers traveling thought out the USA and internationally providing support to our valued clients wherever they need us. We are a small, close knit company that values our employees work-life balance and creates a relaxed and fun work environment.

Typical Duties and Responsibilities

 * The role will involve working on a mix of projects located on the waterfront including Piers, Wharves, Bridges, and Marine Terminals, under the guidance of a Project Manager.
 * The work will involve a mix of field and office engineering work with travel within the United States and overseas.
 * The field work will include above and underwater inspection, destructive and non-destructive testing, topographic and hydrographic surveying, and construction oversight.
 * The office work will include structural analysis and design, preparation of drawings and specifications, quantity and cost estimating, and report writing.

Minimum Requirements

 * B.S. degree or higher in Civil, Structural, or Ocean Engineering.
 * 2-8 years of waterfront engineering and inspection experience.
 * EIT or PE registration.
 * Commercial diving certification (ADCI or equivalent) or a willingness to take training.
 * Familiarity with AutoCAD.
 * Ability to work and communicate effectively as part of a team.
 * Ability and willingness to travel, including overnight, as required.
 * Valid driver’s license

Preferred Qualifications

 * Familiarity with structural analysis software such as STAAD.
 * Experience with topographic or hydrographic surveys.
 * NHI Bridge Inspector Course.
 * US Citizen.

Location

 * The position is located out of our Hainsport, NJ office.
 * All field staff need to be located within driving distance of the office location.

Benefits

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including health, short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, and 401(k) and employer matching. Additional benefits include 10 paid holidays, 10-20 paid time off days (depending on experience), and many more. Our work environment is dynamic, has flexible schedules, with a variety of diverse projects for a broad range of experience.

Childs Engineering is committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to age, race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy), physical or developmental disability, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Position Description

Structural Engineer - Joint Base Andrews, Camp Springs, MD

The base Structural Engineer is specialized in reviewing, analyzing, and monitoring design and engineering proposals for various proposed structures as submitted by contracted engineering design staff. They verify and ascertain the detailed calculations about the strength and stability of structures like bridges and buildings. Additionally, a Structural Engineer researches advanced technology regarding best practices in the field and determines the most cost-effective solution. The Structural Engineer will work alongside the other base engineering professionals to create concepts to meet client needs. A bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or related engineering fields is required for the position.

Duties

 * Work closely with the base engineering staff to ensure plans, equipment, hardware and other required resources for projects are available and working properly.
 * Define clear goals for all aspects of a project and develop steps for their proper execution.
 * Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including time and scope involved.
 * Account for possible project challenges or constraints and proactively seek to manage challenges.
 * Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team.
 * Work alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of initiatives.
 * Establish a framework for necessary contributions from various departments and facilitate their collaboration.

Requirements

 * Must be a US Citizen
 * Must be determined suitable for federal facilities access.
 * Must qualify for a military issued civilian Common Access Card (CAC) from the Department of the Air Force for base facility and Government Furnished Equipment access.
 * Must successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
 * You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.

Qualifications

 * Master's degree in Structural Engineering preferred.
 * Experience developing schematics for structures in accordance with client specifications and safety standards.
 * Project leadership skills are essential.
 * Professional work experience in developing blueprints and designs for proposed structures.
 * Extensive knowledge and experience working with various operating systems.
 * Ability to work with various departments to facilitate the orderly execution of proposed project plans.
 * Experience with software engineering, customer experience and design architecture.
 * Advanced understanding of mechanical structures, building materials, techniques and processes.
 * Up to date understanding of best practices regarding building safety measures.

Ficcadenti Waggoner and Castle Structural Engineers, Inc.

Job Position: Structural Design Engineer

Location: Concord, CA

Firm Description:

Ficcadenti Waggoner and Castle Structural Engineers (FWC) was established in 1991 to provide structural engineering services to a diverse group of high-quality clients. FWC has over 70 employees with 4 offices nationwide.

Throughout our company, we believe that knowledge, experience, and education are the key components to be a successful partner with our clients.

FWC designs parking structures, theme parks, theaters, large retail centers, fitness centers, hotels, multifamily residential buildings, university facilities, airport facilities, and commercial buildings. We design using concrete, steel, aluminum, masonry, timber, cold formed steel, fiber reinforced plastic, and other materials.

Our qualifications and experience enable us to back our creative solutions with fundamental engineering principles. Our engineers use the latest analytical software combined with a hands-on approach with significant contractor interaction. Our design and graphics departments utilize the latest drafting and three-dimensional modeling packages to develop quality designs, reports, and construction documents.

Job Responsibilities:

We are seeking applicants with 5-10 years of experience to join our team. The job responsibilities include:

1. Designing significant structures using concrete,

steel, wood, masonry, timber, cold-formed steel, and fiber reinforced

plastic.

2. Developing designs using prefabricated construction

3. Interacting with clients

4. Conducting site inspections and interacting with contractors

5. Developing client relationships

Applicants must have the following qualifications:

1. BS degree required; MS degree preferred

2. PE license preferred

6. 401K program

7. Selected employee seminars or professional organizations: 100% paid

8. Annual retreat (Recent retreats have been at various winter or summer

resorts): 100% paid

Are you passionate about environmental sustainability and eager to make a positive impact on water resources? We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Junior Water/Wastewater Engineer to join our dynamic team. This position offers exciting opportunities for both local and international work, as you may be assigned to short projects all over the world, including locations such as Japan, Italy, Spain, Greece, Poland, Bahrain, Romania, and Hawaii. Embrace the chance to contribute to global water infrastructure solutions and gain invaluable experience in diverse cultural and professional settings.

In this role, you will work on a variety of projects related to the planning, design, and construction of water and wastewater systems.

Key Responsibilities:

 * Project Support: Assist in the planning and execution of water and wastewater projects under the guidance of senior engineers.
 * Design and Analysis: Contribute to the development of water and wastewater infrastructure designs, including pipelines, treatment plants, and pumping stations. Perform hydraulic and water quality analyses.
 * Regulatory Compliance: Stay abreast of environmental regulations and ensure project designs adhere to local, state, and federal guidelines.
 * Data Collection and Analysis: Gather and analyze data related to water and wastewater systems. Use data-driven insights to optimize system performance and efficiency.
 * Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including environmental scientists, geotechnical engineers, and project managers, to ensure seamless project integration.
 * Site Visits: Conduct field visits to project sites for data collection, assessment, and to ensure project specifications are met.
 * Documentation: Prepare comprehensive reports, drawings, and specifications for projects. Maintain accurate project records.
 * Continuous Learning: Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in water/wastewater engineering.

Qualifications:

 * Bachelor's degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering or a related field.
 * Strong academic foundation in water resources, hydraulics, and environmental engineering.
 * Proficiency in engineering software such as AutoCAD, GIS, and hydraulic modeling tools.
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 * Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
 * EIT/FE certification is a plus.

Wisconsin with offices in Menomonie, Green Bay, and Germantown. As a Civil Engineer Designer in our Raleigh office, you will help design creative and sustainable engineering solutions, pave the way forward for modern medicine advancements, scientific research and provide a better foundation for the future.

Responsibilities
In your new role, you will assist Civil Engineers with the day-to-day tasks for designing various district energy infrastructure systems. These tasks will include, but are not limited to:

 * Drafting
 * 3D Modeling
 * Design of underground utilities including chilled water, heating water, steam, power distribution, domestic water, sanitary sewer, and storm sewer
 * Completing Field Surveys
 * Writing Specifications
 * Participating in Project Meetings
 * Multi-Disciplined Coordination
 * Supporting Construction-Phase Work

Civil engineering designers will perform tasks under direct supervision of professional engineers to produce accurate permitting, bidding, construction drawings, and other various documents that may be required for each project. In this position, designers will

continue to learn about utility infrastructure and site development practices as well as industry specific design requirements such as municipal regulations and National Electric
Code. Target markets include healthcare, higher education, thermal utility generation, and campus power distribution.

Qualifications

Experience Desired:

 * BSCE from ABET accredited school
 * Leadership involvement in extracurricular activities/student organizations preferred
 * Passed the FE exam a plus
 * Working knowledge of AutoCAD Civil 3D

Effective skills to help you flourish:

 * Strong spoken and written communications skills
 * Excellent organization and time management skills
 * Quick technical comprehension and motivation focused on client outcomes
 * Able to effectively prioritize multiple tasks
 * Effective working individually and within team environments

Our commitment to you:
Through personal mentorship, collaborative team practices and the core value of development, training and education, we’ve created an environment that supports professional goals and ensures thriving and successful careers for our team. Join our team and embrace a company culture centered on respect and appreciation and teamwork.

Benefits:

 * Full-Time Pay
 * Paid Holidays
 * Competitive 401K plan
 * Experience Working with Board Certified Professional Engineers
 * High Profile Technical Project Experience
 * Fast-Paced & High Growth Environment

Job Title: Structural Design Specialist
Department: Engineering
Reports To: Discipline Leader
Approved Date:
FLSA Status: Exempt

SUMMARY
Plans, conducts, and coordinates the various phases of structural engineering work for assigned projects. Performs work which involves conventional structural engineering practice but may include a variety of complex features. Work requires a broad knowledge of concrete, steel, and masonry design, and a good working knowledge of food processing and food distribution facilities. Mission Focus: Professional Development, Excellence in Structural Design Services, Leading Edge Technology, Client Satisfaction.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 * Must be an effective communicator with client, design team, and contractors in resolving and maintaining project direction.
 * Works independently and is technically capable of providing most detailed structural calculations and specifications required to develop and define packaging and processing systems and layouts.
 * Evaluates and recommends most design philosophies for project and determines engineering systems to be provided to meet the project program and client needs.
 * Proficient with RISA, RAM and/or similar structural design software. Must have the ability to become proficient in RISA and RAM.
 * Can clearly outline design alternatives and provide summary of associated benefits/concerns.
 * Works with other engineers and designers that may be assigned to the project team within the same discipline.
 * Researches and applies code requirements in design including all necessary contacts with the appropriate local officials to ensure proper code compliance.
 * Prepares most project specifications. Prepares addenda and bulletins to correct/clarify/alter contract documents when necessary.
 * Responsible for review of project submittals and shop drawings.
 * Conducts site surveys to determine conformance with design intent during construction and to evaluate existing conditions during design. Prepares reports to document surveys.
 * Evaluates and responds to field questions and interprets drawing and specification conflicts; evaluates contractor alternates during bidding and construction. Makes recommendations for the resolution of conflicts.
 * Evaluates, advises, and implements improvements to project delivery system including design procedures, construction materials, standard designs, etc.
 * May assist the Structural Team Leader in training other engineers and designers on technical related issues.
 * Must be familiar with the capabilities and limitations of Revit and AutoCAD
 * Possesses discipline specific knowledge of regulatory agency guidelines including USDA, FDA, PMO, 3A standards, HACCP, and related issues.
 * Experience and a working understanding of Windows programs such as Word and Excel as well as discipline specific programs.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

 * A bachelor’s degree in civil or architectural engineering is required at a minimum. Also, the successful candidate must possess five (5) years, or more, of structural engineering experience.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
FE (Fundamentals of Engineering) certification required. Being a Registered Professional Engineer is a plus.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, and sit. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus. Must be able to make site visits (travel utilizing air, train, and car) and move freely in customer facilities and construction sites.

Employment Opportunity

Senior Civil/Environmental Engineer

Weber, Hayes & Associates

Our well-established Monterey Bay-located environmental and hydrogeologic consulting firm (www.weber-hayes.com) is seeking a full time California Registered Civil/Environmental Professional Engineer with experience in drinking water systems design and engineering to collaborate with our Engineering Group who specialize in potable water system design and engineering, construction management, and operations & management services for a wide range of clients. The ideal candidate is an intelligent, motivated, and detail-oriented team player who is at least 10 years into their career as an environmental engineer.

Minimum Requirements

 * Is a California Registered Professional Engineer
 * Possession of a valid Class C California driver's license

Senior Engineer Responsibilities and Duties

 * Collaborate with the Engineering Group and manage multiple projects at any one given time, including the preparation and management of project budgets, meeting project deadlines, and ensuring effective client and regulatory agency communication and relation
 * Supervising and directing all aspects of the design and engineering of potable water systems, primarily groundwater-sourced small, disadvantaged and underserved communities - the core work of the Engineering Group - as the Engineer in Responsible Charge
 * Supervising and directing water system construction monitoring and management services
 * Supervising and directing the management, operation and maintenance of a portfolio of small community water systems
 * Directing and mentoring junior staff

Familiarity with the State Water Board’s Technical Assistance Program and the Drinking/Clean Water State Revolving Fund a plus, but not required, as is California Drinking Water Operator Certification. Knowledge and experience in soil and groundwater remediation beneficial, but not required.

Compensation

Annual salary starts at $105K to $115K based on experience and pay increases are based on performance. This position includes medical, dental and prescription plan health benefits, profit-sharing bonuses, and 401(k) plan with employer match. Other benefits include 9.5 paid holidays per year, paid vacation time, and use of a company vehicle.

Application

To apply for the position, please email your resume along with at least two (2) professional references to the attention of Jered Chaney at jered@weber-hayes.com. If selected, within approximately 2 weeks of submittal you will be invited for an in-person or teleconference interview.

The Kleingers Group is seeking a collaborative, responsive, driven individual to join our team as a Municipal Engineer Project Manager. We are the acting engineer for several local municipal clients. Our municipal engineering team has in-depth experience researching, drafting, and implementing CIP plans for local cities and villages. Kleingers’ ability to package public infrastructure funding programs aggressively and creatively for CIP-designated projects has resulted in hundreds of thousands of dollars in community improvements.
The Role:
The Municipal Project Manager’s primary role is to be a client manager for multiple communities, engage in planning and consulting for various projects, while also organizing and mobilizing the internal expertise of The Kleingers Group. We focus on providing general civil consulting, site civil plan review, transportation engineering, land surveying, 3D laser scanning, landscape architecture, construction observation, and community planning services. You must have a PE license for this role.
Successful candidates will have experience in:

 * Municipal engineering and public infrastructure projects
 * Review and inspect site work, right-of-way, sidewalks, driveways, fences, walls, water/sewer connections and impacts on residential and commercial development.
 * Ensure industry compliance standards are met for all engineering details, city codes and policies, etc.
 * Federal, state, and local funding sources
 * Overseeing civil engineering projects with the required technical and project management expertise to do so.
 * Taking responsibility for projects from launch to completion. This includes:
 * Executing
 * Managing client expectations
 * Assigning project work
 * Assuring projects are completed of high quality and on time
 * Accurately budgeting and billing of all projects assigned
 * Building strong relationships through communicating project information and detail while serving as the liaison between the Kleingers team and all clients, general contractors, consultants, and public authorities.

*
The Qualifications:*

 * Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering
 * Professional Engineer (P.E.) license is required.
 * Minimum of five years of experience in the field of civil engineering and/or inspection with a focus on public infrastructure projects. This includes design and/or public inspection of projects such as roadways, sidewalks, water main, traffic signals, culverts and storm sewers.
 * Preparation of funding applications (OPWC, OKI, etc.)
 * Familiarity with state and local design and construction standards
 * Demonstrated history of leading site design
 * Strong project management and organizational skills are necessary.
 * Ability to be the Engineer of Record (EOR), preferred.
 * Highly effective in project management and organizational skills.

About The Kleingers Group
The Kleingers Group provides design solutions for a wide range of public, private, institutional, and corporate clients. We focus on providing site civil engineering, athletic field design, transportation engineering, land surveying, landscape architecture and community planning services. With offices located in Cincinnati, Columbus, Louisville, Akron, and Tampa, we are able provide our clients with the personal attention and service that has become our trademark.

Purpose

Leadership and Direction

Work is completed using standard engineering techniques and design principles and is reviewed by more senior staff to ensure application of sound professional judgement.

At the Operational and Company Level

Do the Work

 * Complete civil engineering work for assigned phases of large land/site development.

 * Complete design work and calculations using computer-aided software.

Success Metrics and Competencies

Ideal candidate will consistently demonstrate...

 * Ability to work both independently and within a team environment.

 * Commitment to becoming a “citizen” of the broader organization, breaking down barriers and silos.

Education, Work Experience, Licensure/Certifications, and Technical Requirements
